original: @108b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @108b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i ma h'a su kha s'a dha no pi ka bya khya na /
analyzed: shr'i ma h'a su kha s'a dha no pi ka bya khya na /
translated: ≈örƒ´mahƒÅsukha-sƒÅdhanopƒÅyikƒÅ-vyƒÅkhyƒÅ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal bde ba chen po sgrub pa'i thabs rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: dpal bde ba chen po sgrub pa'i thabs rnam par bshad pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Meaning of the SƒÅdhana of Glorious Great Bliss

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: bde ba chen po rdo rje che //
analyzed: bde ba chen po rdo rje che //
translated: Great bliss, great vajra,

original: ye shes mtha' yas 'byung gnas la //
analyzed: ye shes mtha' yas 'byung gnas la //
translated: Source of infinite wisdom,

original: phyag 'tshal sgrub thabs don rnams ni //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal sgrub thabs don rnams ni //
translated: I pay homage and explain the meaning of the sƒÅdhana

original: bla mas bstan bzhin bdag gis bri //
analyzed: bla mas bstan bzhin bdag gis bri //
translated: Just as taught by the guru.

original: dpal zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa la bya'o//
analyzed: dpal zhes bya ba ni phun sum tshogs pa la bya'o//
translated: Glorious refers to perfection.

original: de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is mundane and supramundane.

original: 'jig rten gyi dpal ni lha dang mi'i 'byor pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dpal ni lha dang mi'i 'byor pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Mundane glory is possessing all the wealth of gods and humans.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad la bya'o //
translated: Supramundane is all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de gnyis dang ldan pas dpal ldan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis dang ldan pas dpal ldan zhes bya'o //
translated: Possessing both of those is called glorious.

original: dpal gyi sgras ni lha mo bzhi la sogs pa la yang bya ste /
analyzed: dpal gyi sgras ni lha mo bzhi la sogs pa la yang bya ste /
translated: The term glory also refers to the four goddesses and so forth.

original: de rnams dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor pa'i tshul du gnas pas dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de rnams dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor pa'i tshul du gnas pas dpal ldan no //
translated: He is glorious because he abides in the manner of being inseparable from those.

original: rdo rje ni yang dag pa'i ye shes sems dpa' ni de nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ni yang dag pa'i ye shes sems dpa' ni de nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: Vajra is authentic pristine consciousness. Since he is the nature of that, he is called sattva.

original: sems can thams cad dang mthun par sku bstan pas sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang mthun par sku bstan pas sems dpa'o //
translated: He is a sattva because he displays his body in accordance with all sentient beings.

original: @109a * // mgon po sangs rgyas kun ngo bo //
analyzed: @109a * // mgon po sangs rgyas kun ngo bo //
translated: The lord is the essence of all buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni thugs rje'i rang bzhin yin pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par thams cad kyi don mdzad pas mgon po zhes bya /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thugs rje'i rang bzhin yin pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par thams cad kyi don mdzad pas mgon po zhes bya /
translated: Since he is the nature of compassion, he is called the lord because he performs the benefit of all in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: He is the essence of the buddhas of the three times and the ten directions.

original: zhe sdang rdo rje rgyal ba'i gtso ;
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje rgyal ba'i gtso ;
translated: He is the victor, the lord of the vajra of anger.

original: / zhes pa ni sems can zhe sdang can thams cad 'dul ba'i cha lugs su bstan pas zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa ni sems can zhe sdang can thams cad 'dul ba'i cha lugs su bstan pas zhe sdang rdo rje'o //
translated: He is the vajra of anger because he is displayed in the costume of taming all angry sentient beings.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyi mchog tu gyur pa dang // dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yin pas na rgyal ba'i gtso /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyi mchog tu gyur pa dang // dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po yin pas na rgyal ba'i gtso /
translated: He is the chief of the victors because he is the supreme of the pratyekabuddhas and sravakas, and because he is the lord of the mandala.

original: lha mo zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa rnams dang gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bde ba chen po rtag tu nyams su myong ba la bya'o //
analyzed: lha mo zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa rnams dang gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bde ba chen po rtag tu nyams su myong ba la bya'o //
translated: The goddess is the consort of the great seal of the ultimate realm, both mundane and supramundane, and is to be understood as the constant experience of great bliss in a nondual manner.

original: dad pas zhes pa ni gus pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: dad pas zhes pa ni gus pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: With faith means with devotion.

original: bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Having prostrated with my body, speech, and mind,

original: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba'i don ni rgyud thams cad kyi rgyal po gsang ba 'dus pa 'di gang zag blo dman pa rnams kyis rtogs shing go dka' bas de lta bu'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyag 'tshal ba'i don ni rgyud thams cad kyi rgyal po gsang ba 'dus pa 'di gang zag blo dman pa rnams kyis rtogs shing go dka' bas de lta bu'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of such a prostration is for the sake of benefiting those sentient beings who find it difficult to understand and realize this King of Tantras, the Guhyasamaja, due to their inferior intelligence.

original: dpal ni badzra satva /
analyzed: dpal ni badzra satva /
translated: The glorious one is Vajrasattva.

original: de dang ldan pas dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas dpal ldan no //
translated: Endowed with that, he is the glorious one.

original: gsang 'dus ni rgyud kyi mtshan no //
analyzed: gsang 'dus ni rgyud kyi mtshan no //
translated: Guhyasamaja is the name of the tantra.

original: don ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: don ni nges pa'o //
translated: The meaning is ascertainment.

original: rtogs pa ni sems kyis so ;
analyzed: rtogs pa ni sems kyis so ;
translated: Realization is by the mind.

original: / gsang ba ni tshig gis so //
analyzed: / gsang ba ni tshig gis so //
translated: The secret is by words.

original: sems can ni khams gsum na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can ni khams gsum na gnas pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are those dwelling in the three realms.

original: phan pa ni mtho ris dang thar pa thob par bya ba rgyud 'di la 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa ni mtho ris dang thar pa thob par bya ba rgyud 'di la 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The benefit is to cause them to attain the higher realms and liberation by engaging in this tantra.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplishment for the sake of attainment.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is glorious Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: thabs ni yan lag go ;
analyzed: thabs ni yan lag go ;
translated: The means are the branches.

original: /'di ni brtsams pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: /'di ni brtsams pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: This is the subject matter of the composition.

original: bshad par bya zhes pa ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes pa ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: To explain is the promise.

original: dang po sems bskyed ma thag go //
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed ma thag go //
translated: Immediately upon first generating the mind.

original: sngags pa zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags kyi tshul la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngags pa zhes bya ba ni gsang sngags kyi tshul la spyod pa'o //
translated: The mantra practitioner is one who practices the way of secret mantra.

original: nges pa ni the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni the tshom med pa'o //
translated: Ascertainment is being free from doubt.

original: da ni 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Now, the stages of engagement are taught.

original: rdo rje ni yang dag pa'i don te de la ma nor bar ston cing bde ba chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni yang dag pa'i don te de la ma nor bar ston cing bde ba chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The vajra is the true meaning, and it is taught without error, causing one to attain the state of great bliss.

original: mnyes par bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'o //
analyzed: mnyes par bya ba yang rnam pa gsum ste phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'o //
translated: The pleasing is also threefold: outer, inner, and secret.

original: phyi ni lus dang longs spyod do //
analyzed: phyi ni lus dang longs spyod do //
translated: The outer is the body and possessions.

original: nang ni shes rab rnam gsum gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: nang ni shes rab rnam gsum gyi sgo nas so //
translated: The inner is by way of the three wisdoms.

original: gsang ba ni gsang ba'i mchod pas so //
analyzed: gsang ba ni gsang ba'i mchod pas so //
translated: The secret is by means of the secret offering.

original: de ltar slob dpon mnyes @109b par byas nas dbang rnam gsum thob nas gnang ba ni sgrubs shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon mnyes @109b par byas nas dbang rnam gsum thob nas gnang ba ni sgrubs shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, having pleased the master, having obtained the three initiations, the permission is ‚Äúpractice.‚Äù

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni mnyes par bya ba la sogs pa zin nas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni mnyes par bya ba la sogs pa zin nas so //
translated: Then means after pleasing and so on.

original: sgrub pa ni gang yang rung ba'i sgrub pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni gang yang rung ba'i sgrub pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Practice is any of the practice substances.

original: brtsam par bya ba ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brtsam par bya ba ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: What is to be begun is the engagement.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi don ni sgra las drangs na manda ni snying po'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi don ni sgra las drangs na manda ni snying po'o //
translated: The meaning of ma·πá·∏çala is derived from the words: ma·πá·∏ça is the essence,

original: la ni aa da na ste len pa'o //
analyzed: la ni aa da na ste len pa'o //
translated: and la is ƒÅdana, which is taking.

original: dkyil 'khor bas dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bas dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The ma·πá·∏çala is the essence that is taken.

original: der zhugs pa ni tshul bzhin du slob dpon gyis bstan zhing dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: der zhugs pa ni tshul bzhin du slob dpon gyis bstan zhing dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: Entering there is being properly taught by the master and being initiated.

original: de bzhin ni 'dra ba'i don gsang ba ni thun mong ma yin pa dang // rtog ge bas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ni 'dra ba'i don gsang ba ni thun mong ma yin pa dang // rtog ge bas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Likewise, secret means similar, uncommon, and not of sophists.

original: nyid ni ma nor ba dkyil 'khor gyi don dang gnyis su med pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ni ma nor ba dkyil 'khor gyi don dang gnyis su med pa'i don to //
translated: The word itself means nonerroneous and nondual.

original: shes pa ni go ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni go ba'o //
translated: Knowledge means understanding.

original: kun byed thams cad za ba yis //
analyzed: kun byed thams cad za ba yis //
translated: The all-creating all-devourer

original: zhes pa ni rtog pa med cing gnyis su med pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtog pa med cing gnyis su med pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: means nonconceptual and nondual conduct.

original: the tshom med par dngos grub thob //
analyzed: the tshom med par dngos grub thob //
translated: Without doubt, one attains spiritual powers.

original: ces bya ba ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pas bsgrubs na yid kyi 'dod pa'i don grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pas bsgrubs na yid kyi 'dod pa'i don grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that if one practices with such qualities, one will accomplish the desired aims of the mind.

original: gtso bo ni yi dam gyi lha dang rdo rje slob dpon gnyis so //
analyzed: gtso bo ni yi dam gyi lha dang rdo rje slob dpon gnyis so //
translated: The principal are the pledged deity and the vajra master.

original: mi phyed pa ni mi 'gyur ba dang rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni mi 'gyur ba dang rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: The undivided are the unchanging and uninterrupted.

original: dad pa ni yid ches pa dang gus pa dang chags pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni yid ches pa dang gus pa dang chags pa'o //
translated: Faith means confidence, respect, and attachment.

original: rnam pa ni tha dad pa mi rtog pa'i blo ni tha dad pa'i 'du shes med cing gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni tha dad pa mi rtog pa'i blo ni tha dad pa'i 'du shes med cing gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: The aspect is the nonconceptual mind that lacks the perception of differences and is nondual.üîΩ

original: dam tshig ni mi 'da' ba ste sku gsung thugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni mi 'da' ba ste sku gsung thugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The commitments are not to transgress the body, speech, mind, and so on.

original: sdom pa ni mi g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni mi g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The vows are not to be distracted.

original: gnas pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: The abiding is to be endowed with those.

original: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas bsgrubs na sku gsung thugs kyi 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnal 'byor pas bsgrubs na sku gsung thugs kyi 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one practices with such yoga, one will accomplish the result of body, speech, and mind.

original: bram bre zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i ngag nyid yin pas na dor ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: bram bre zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i ngag nyid yin pas na dor ba'i tshig go //
translated: The brahmin is the very speech of virtue, so it is the word to be discarded.

original: dkyil 'khor dag ni dman pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni gong du bstan pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan par rang bzo dang gzu lums su byas shing bsgrubs na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dag ni dman pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni gong du bstan pa'i yon tan dang mi ldan par rang bzo dang gzu lums su byas shing bsgrubs na /
translated: The meaning of the inferior ma·πá·∏çala and so on is as follows: If one practices without the qualities that were previously explained, and one is self-devised and rash,

original: 'bras bu mi 'thob cing byas pa chud zos pas byar mi rung bar bstan /
analyzed: 'bras bu mi 'thob cing byas pa chud zos pas byar mi rung bar bstan /
translated: one will not obtain the result, and since one's efforts will be wasted, it is taught that it is not suitable to practice.

original: de lta bas na dam tshig dang sdom pa bstan te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dam tshig dang sdom pa bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the commitments and vows are explained.

original: dam tshig ni bsgrub pa'i dam rdzas so //
analyzed: dam tshig ni bsgrub pa'i dam rdzas so //
translated: The commitments are the substances for accomplishment.

original: sdom pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par dang du len pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par dang du len pa'o //
translated: The vows are to accept without transgression.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sha la sogs ba bdud rtsi lnga'o //
analyzed: sha la sogs ba bdud rtsi lnga'o //
translated: The flesh and so forth are the five nectars.

original: sha ni sha chen /
analyzed: sha ni sha chen /
translated: The flesh is the great flesh.

original: rakta ni khrag thams cad /
analyzed: rakta ni khrag thams cad /
translated: The blood is all blood.

original: dri chen dang rdo rje chu yang kun gyi'o //üîΩsems ni lnga pa byang chub ba zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med @110a * //
analyzed: dri chen dang rdo rje chu yang kun gyi'o // sems ni lnga pa byang chub ba zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med @110a * //
translated: The feces and the vajra water are of all.

original: pa'i rol pa las byung ba yin pas so //
analyzed: pa'i rol pa las byung ba yin pas so //
translated: The mind is the fifth, enlightenment, because it arises from the play of the nondual union of method and wisdom.

original: sngags pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa sgrub pa /
analyzed: sngags pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa sgrub pa /
translated: The mantra practitioner is the one who accomplishes nonconceptuality.

original: chogs zhes pa ni bya ba /
analyzed: chogs zhes pa ni bya ba /
translated: The rite is the activity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs pa dang 'gro nas 'byung ba'i thabs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs pa dang 'gro nas 'byung ba'i thabs so //
translated: It is the method of going and arising, consecrated as the nature of the tathagatas.

original: nyin gcig bzhin du ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Daily is at all times.

original: sbyang ba ni h'um gis so //
analyzed: sbyang ba ni h'um gis so //
translated: The purification is with hum.

original: 'bar ba ni aom gyis so //
analyzed: 'bar ba ni aom gyis so //
translated: The blazing is with om.

original: rtogs pa ni a'a:yis so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni a'a:yis so //
translated: The realization is with ah.

original: dogs pa ni 'grub mi 'grub pa'i the tshom mo //
analyzed: dogs pa ni 'grub mi 'grub pa'i the tshom mo //
translated: Doubt is the uncertainty of accomplishment or nonaccomplishment.

original: med pa ni spangs pa'i sems so //
analyzed: med pa ni spangs pa'i sems so //
translated: Nonexistence is the abandoned mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ci ltar gshegs pa bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa ci ltar gshegs pa bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata is the Tathagata because he has gone in the same way as the Tathagatas of the past.

original: de yang gang zhe na thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshul bsgoms shing bsgrubs pas bde ba chen po'i ngang du gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshul bsgoms shing bsgrubs pas bde ba chen po'i ngang du gyur pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: And what is that? It is Vairocana, etc., who have become the state of great bliss by cultivating and accomplishing the method of non-dual wisdom and means.

original: mnyes pa ni dgyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mnyes pa ni dgyes pa'i don to //
translated: Pleased means the meaning of delight.

original: de yang mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: And that is the direct realization.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsang sngags kyi sgor zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsang sngags kyi sgor zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa /
translated: The Tathagata is the yogi who has entered the door of mantra.

original: mnyes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi 'bras bu 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: mnyes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi 'bras bu 'thob pa'o //
translated: Pleased is the attainment of the result of body, speech, and mind.

original: sbyang pa'i thabs ni sgrub pa'i rdzas snod du bzhag la de'i steng du h'um gcig 'bar bar bsgom //
analyzed: sbyang pa'i thabs ni sgrub pa'i rdzas snod du bzhag la de'i steng du h'um gcig 'bar bar bsgom //
translated: The method of purification is to place the accomplishment substances in a vessel and meditate on a single h≈´·πÉ blazing above them.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa'i dri ma thams cad bsregs par bsam /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis ma rtogs pa dang log par rtogs pa'i dri ma thams cad bsregs par bsam /
translated: Think that the light rays burn all the stains of non-realization and wrong realization.

original: de ltar rnam par dag par byas la /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dag par byas la /
translated: Having purified in that way,

original: de'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang aa gcig bskyed /
analyzed: de'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang aa gcig bskyed /
translated: On top of that, generate a moon mandala and one A.

original: aa las 'od zer 'phros pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la phog pas zhu ste /
analyzed: aa las 'od zer 'phros pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la phog pas zhu ste /
translated: Light rays shine from the A, striking the moon mandala, which melts.

original: bdud rtsi'i thigs pa tshul bzhin du zhu zhing gnyis su med par song bas bdud rtsir gyur pa ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i thigs pa tshul bzhin du zhu zhing gnyis su med par song bas bdud rtsir gyur pa ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: The drop of nectar melts properly and becomes nondual, becoming nectar.

original: de'i steng du aom bsgom zhing 'phro 'du bya ba ni ma 'bar gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du aom bsgom zhing 'phro 'du bya ba ni ma 'bar gyi bar du'o //
translated: On top of that, meditate on the Om and perform the emanation and reabsorption until it blazes.

original: de ltar byas shing spyad na sku gsung thugs kyi dngos grub 'thob pas dam tshig dam pa'o //

original: aa las ni snang ba mtha' yas /
analyzed: aa las ni snang ba mtha' yas /
translated: From ƒÅ·∏• is AmitƒÅbha.

original: aom las ni rnam par snang mdzad /
analyzed: aom las ni rnam par snang mdzad /
translated: From o·πÉ is Vairocana.

original: spyor ba zhes bya ba ni spyi bo dang lce'i steng du de gnyis kyi sku bskyed pa la bya /üîΩde ltar bdag @111a * //
analyzed: spyor ba zhes bya ba ni spyi bo dang lce'i steng du de gnyis kyi sku bskyed pa la bya / de ltar bdag @111a * //

analyzed: lhar bsgom zhing dam rdzas dang bza' btung thams cad ni sku gsung thugs kyi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, meditating on oneself as the deity, all pledge substances and food and drink are for the purpose of attaining the result of body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: mnyes pa ni sngags kyi spyod pa tshul bzhin du spyad pas dgyes pa dang mngon du gyur pa la bya'o //

original: mchog ni sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: mchog ni sku gsung thugs so //

original: dngos grub kyang tshe 'di nyid la thob pa'i don to ;
analyzed: dngos grub kyang tshe 'di nyid la thob pa'i don to ;

original: / thams cad ni 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa grub kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: / thams cad ni 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa grub kyang bsdu'o //

original: de bas na dam tshig mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dam tshig mchog ces bya'o //

analyzed: 'phrog pa ni bdag gir bya ba'o //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i don gyi gnas byed pa dang ngan song du gtong ba'i phyir ro //

original: gso ba ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: gso ba ni spong ba'o //

analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni dkon mchog gsum dang rdo rje slob dpon dang sems can mang po la gnod par byed pa'o //

analyzed: gsod pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par snying rje'i sgo nas bsgral ba'o //

original: chags pa ni gzhan mi sems pa'o //

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i don to //

original: de nyid ni ma nor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni ma nor ba'o //

original: spyod pa ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni bsgom pa'o //

analyzed: mdor na sku gsung thugs rgyun mi 'chad par bsgom pa la bya'o //

original: sdom pa ni @111b srung ba'o //

analyzed: bsdams pa'o zhes pa bsrung ba'i nang na khyad par du bstan pa'o //

original: de ltar sgrub pa'i rgyu dam tshig rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa'i rgyu dam tshig rnams bstan nas /

analyzed: dam bca' ni nyan thos kyi spyod pa dang kri ya'o //

analyzed: brtul zhugs ni mu stegs can brag la mchong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The discipline is the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô jumping off cliffs and so forth.

analyzed: dka' spyod ni me lnga bsten pa dang zas mi za ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The austerity is the five fires, fasting, and so forth.

original: brten pas mi 'grub ces bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod pa rnams spyod pas sku gsung thugs kyi dngos grub mi thob pas spongs shig pa'i don to //
analyzed: brten pas mi 'grub ces bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod pa rnams spyod pas sku gsung thugs kyi dngos grub mi thob pas spongs shig pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase not accomplished by reliance means that one should abandon the conduct of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on, because one does not attain the spiritual powers of body, speech, and mind by engaging in that conduct.

original: 'dod pa ni sku gsung thugs /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni sku gsung thugs /
translated: The desired is the body, speech, and mind.

original: longs spyod ni gnyis su med par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod ni gnyis su med par bsgom pa'o //

original: thams cad ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad la bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad la bya'o //

original: yang na 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan thams cad do //

analyzed: slong mo za zhing mi bzlas te //

original: zhes pa ni ma h'a yo ga'i sgor zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas kri ya'am mu stegs pa ltar 'phral du bslang zhing sngags bzla bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ma h'a yo ga'i sgor zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas kri ya'am mu stegs pa ltar 'phral du bslang zhing sngags bzla bar mi bya'o //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: slong la dga' bar mi bya'o //

analyzed: de yang yid dang 'thad pa mi rnyed pas mi rung ngo //

translated: The purpose of the action is to have all the provisions completely perfect.üîΩ‚ÄúThe two branches are nondual‚Äù means that, unlike the KriyƒÅ [Vehicle], one should not meditate on oneself as the pledge being and make offerings to the wisdom being separately.

original: yan lag mi gnyis zhes bya ba ni kri ya ba ltar bdag dam tshig sems dpar bsgom zhing ye shes sems dpa' logs su mchod pa bzhin du mi bya bar ye shes sems dpa' dang bdag gnyis su med par bsgom zhing 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad bzla
analyzed: yan lag mi gnyis zhes bya ba ni kri ya ba ltar bdag dam tshig sems dpar bsgom zhing ye shes sems dpa' logs su mchod pa bzhin du mi bya bar ye shes sems dpa' dang bdag gnyis su med par bsgom zhing 'dod pa'i longs spyod thams cad bzla
translated: One should meditate on the wisdom being and oneself as nondual and enjoy all desired enjoyments.

original: ba'i don / yang na yan lag mi gnyis zhes ba ni gzungs ma dang gnyis su med pa'i tshul du 'dug nas bzla ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba'i don / yang na yan lag mi gnyis zhes ba ni gzungs ma dang gnyis su med pa'i tshul du 'dug nas bzla ba'i don to //
translated: Or, not two limbs means that one should recite while remaining in a state of nonduality with the knowledge consort.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ni 'dod pa thams cad do //üîΩde yang gzungs kyi lha mo la @112a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ni 'dod pa thams cad do // de yang gzungs kyi lha mo la @112a * //
translated: The enjoyment of desire is all desires.

original: sogs pa'i tshul du bsgom zhing spyad pa'i don to //
analyzed: sogs pa'i tshul du bsgom zhing spyad pa'i don to //
translated: One should meditate and practice in the manner of the knowledge goddess, and so on.

original: de ltar spyad pa'i yon tan bstan pa /
analyzed: de ltar spyad pa'i yon tan bstan pa /
translated: The qualities of practicing in that way are taught:

original: lus dang ngag yid bder gnas na //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid bder gnas na //
translated: When body, speech, and mind are comfortable,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: the supreme enlightenment is attained.

original: slong ba'i zas spang zhing 'dod pa thams cad spyad pas lus ngag yid gsum las su rung ba'i don to //
analyzed: slong ba'i zas spang zhing 'dod pa thams cad spyad pas lus ngag yid gsum las su rung ba'i don to //
translated: By abandoning alms food and enjoying all desires, the three, body, speech, and mind, become serviceable.

original: byang chub dam pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las 'phags pa bla na med pa'i byang chub chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin 'thob pa'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las 'phags pa bla na med pa'i byang chub chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin 'thob pa'i don to //
translated: The supreme enlightenment is the attainment of the unsurpassed enlightenment, the nature of the dharmakaya, which is superior to the hearers and solitary realizers.

original: gsang sngags tshul bzhin du spyad pa'i skyon bstan pa gzhan du bya ba ni gong du spyod pa spangs nas tshul dang mi ldan pa'i sgo nas gsang sngags bzlas na dus min 'chi ba zhes bya ste tshe'i mthar ma thug bar glo bur du 'chi ba la bya
analyzed: gsang sngags tshul bzhin du spyad pa'i skyon bstan pa gzhan du bya ba ni gong du spyod pa spangs nas tshul dang mi ldan pa'i sgo nas gsang sngags bzlas na dus min 'chi ba zhes bya ste tshe'i mthar ma thug bar glo bur du 'chi ba la bya
translated: The other point to be made is that if one recites the mantras without the proper qualifications, having abandoned the conduct as described above, this is called ‚Äúpremature death‚Äù and one will die suddenly before one‚Äôs time is up.üîΩ‚Äú One will always be burned in the hells‚Äù means that even after death one will go to the hells one after the other and will be burned all the time.

original: / dmyal ba rnams su rtag tu bsreg / cas pa ni shi nas kyang dmyal bar rim pa rim par 'gro zhing dus thams cad du bsreg par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas byar mi rung bar bstan to //
analyzed: / dmyal ba rnams su rtag tu bsreg / cas pa ni shi nas kyang dmyal bar rim pa rim par 'gro zhing dus thams cad du bsreg par 'gyur ba'i skyon yod pas byar mi rung bar bstan to //
translated: The point being made is that it is not suitable to do this.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas ni gsang sngags ma h'a yo ga'i sgor zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga mi bsten du mi rung bar bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa la sogs pas ni gsang sngags ma h'a yo ga'i sgor zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga mi bsten du mi rung bar bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThe buddhas and bodhisattvas‚Äù and so on teaches that it is not suitable for yogins who have entered the door of the Mahayoga of the secret mantra to not rely on the five sense pleasures.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga bsten zhing /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga bsten zhing /
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas of the past also relied on the five sense pleasures.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa mchog 'di spyad pas 'grub pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa mchog 'di spyad pas 'grub pa yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one becomes accomplished by engaging in this supreme conduct of mantra.

original: chos kyi yi ge ni yi ge thams cad kyi mchog yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi yi ge ni yi ge thams cad kyi mchog yi ge aa'o //
translated: The letter of Dharma is the supreme of all letters, the letter A.

original: 'thob par 'gyur ba de ni don 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ba de ni don 'thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of that is the attainment of the meaning.

original: de lta bas na da ltar gyi rnal 'byor pas kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga spyod cing bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na da ltar gyi rnal 'byor pas kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga spyod cing bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that even a present yogin should enjoy and practice the five sense objects.

original: chags pa ni dang po 'am 'dod pa la bya /
analyzed: chags pa ni dang po 'am 'dod pa la bya /
translated: Attachment is either the first or desire.

original: ye shes ni sku gsung thugs ma yi dam gyi lha /
analyzed: ye shes ni sku gsung thugs ma yi dam gyi lha /
translated: Wisdom is the deity of the pledge of awakened body, speech, and mind.

original: rtag ces pa ni dus thams cad dam rgyun mi 'chad pa la bya /
analyzed: rtag ces pa ni dus thams cad dam rgyun mi 'chad pa la bya /
translated: Constant means all times or uninterrupted.

original: bsgrub ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'am mngon sum du byed pa bya bas ni de 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan lnga la spyad par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgrub ces bya ba ni bsgom pa'am mngon sum du byed pa bya bas ni de 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan lnga la spyad par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Practice means meditation or actualization. The meaning is that the yogin who desires that should enjoy the five qualities such as form.

original: de yang bsam pa ji lta bu byed ce na /
analyzed: de yang bsam pa ji lta bu byed ce na /
translated: Moreover, how should one think?

original: ye shes sems dpa' dang byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' dang byang chub sems dpa' la mchod pa'i tshul du'o //
translated: In the manner of making offerings to the wisdom being and the bodhisattva.

original: de la byang chub ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: de la byang chub ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Enlightenment is the ultimate realm.

original: dpa' bo zhes pa ni gzugs kyi sku ston cing sems can gyi don byed pa'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa ni gzugs kyi sku ston cing sems can gyi don byed pa'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The hero is glorious Vajrasattva, who displays the form body and acts for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: yang na byang chub ni badzra satva la sogs pa @112b dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang na byang chub ni badzra satva la sogs pa @112b dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas so //
translated: Alternatively, enlightenment is Vajrasattva and so forth, the buddhas of the three times.

original: dpa' bo sgra las drangs na nyi ma la bya /
analyzed: dpa' bo sgra las drangs na nyi ma la bya /
translated: The hero is the sun, as indicated by the Sanskrit word s≈´rya.

original: mdor na ji ltar nyi mas rab rib thams cad sel ba bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyang sems can gyi mi shes pa'i rab rib thams cad thugs rje'i 'od zer gyis sel bar byed pas byang chub nyi ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdor na ji ltar nyi mas rab rib thams cad sel ba bzhin du sangs rgyas rnams kyang sems can gyi mi shes pa'i rab rib thams cad thugs rje'i 'od zer gyis sel bar byed pas byang chub nyi ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In brief, just as the sun removes all darkness, the buddhas remove the darkness of sentient beings' ignorance with the light rays of compassion. This is the meaning of the enlightenment sun.

original: gnyis su med pa'i lta ba la goms par byed pas rnal 'byor pas 'di dag la smad par mi bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i lta ba la goms par byed pas rnal 'byor pas 'di dag la smad par mi bya ba bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the yogi should not disparage these, since they are familiar with the nondual view.

original: gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: The form of a woman is attractive, unattractive, or neither.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa la yang smad par mi bya ste de ci'i phyir zhe na lha'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa la yang smad par mi bya ste de ci'i phyir zhe na lha'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Likewise, one should not disparage sound and so forth. Why is that? Because they are the nature of the deities.

original: rdo rje ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs so //
translated: The vajra is the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times.

original: 'chang ba ni de nyid kyi rang bzhin nam 'dzin pa la bya /
analyzed: 'chang ba ni de nyid kyi rang bzhin nam 'dzin pa la bya /
translated: Holding is either the nature of that or the grasping.

original: rgyal zhes pa ni mdzes shing 'bar ba nyon mongs pa med pa byang chub sems rdo rje la bya /
analyzed: rgyal zhes pa ni mdzes shing 'bar ba nyon mongs pa med pa byang chub sems rdo rje la bya /
translated: The king is the beautiful, blazing, unafflicted bodhicitta vajra.

original: de nyid thams cad du yang dag par gnas zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin don dam par de dang gnyis su med pa dang / kun rdzob tu gzugs kyi lha mo la sogs pa'i skur bstan zhing sems can gyi don byed pas so //
analyzed: de nyid thams cad du yang dag par gnas zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin don dam par de dang gnyis su med pa dang / kun rdzob tu gzugs kyi lha mo la sogs pa'i skur bstan zhing sems can gyi don byed pas so //
translated: That very thing is perfectly present everywhere, meaning that ultimately it is non-dual with the nature of form and so forth, and conventionally it appears as the form of the goddess of form and so forth, and acts for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de lta bas na gzugs la sogs pa rab 'bring tha ma gsum khyad par rnam pa gsum du bsgom zhing rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzugs la sogs pa rab 'bring tha ma gsum khyad par rnam pa gsum du bsgom zhing rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should meditate on the three kinds of distinctions, inferior, middling, and superior, of form, etc., and make offerings to Vajrasattva, the nature of all the Tathagatas.

original: de la khyad par rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med par shes pa dang / sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de la khyad par rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med par shes pa dang / sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: There, the three kinds of distinctions are: the knowledge of the door of liberation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the consecration of body, speech, and mind.

original: sngags pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: sngags pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The mantra practitioner is the yogi.

original: rnam pa ni 'di dag gis zhes pa gong du bstan pa'i mchod pa'i thabs rnams so//
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'di dag gis zhes pa gong du bstan pa'i mchod pa'i thabs rnams so//
translated: By these refers to the above-mentioned methods of offering.

original: dam tshig sdom pa bsrung zhes pa ni de nyid las mi 'da' bar byas na bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam tshig sdom pa bsrung zhes pa ni de nyid las mi 'da' bar byas na bya ba'i don to //
translated: Observing the vows of commitment means that if one does not transgress them, it has the sense of something to be done.

original: tshe 'di nyid la zhes pa ni phung po 'di nyid ma brjes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la zhes pa ni phung po 'di nyid ma brjes pa'i don to //
translated: In this very life means the sense of not changing this very body.

original: 'di dag gis zhes pa gong du bstan pa'i mchod pa'i thabs rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis zhes pa gong du bstan pa'i mchod pa'i thabs rnams so //
translated: By these refers to the above-mentioned methods of offering.

original: rdo rje gsum nyid ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum nyid ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of the three vajras‚Äù means that the bodhisattva becomes the embodiment of the body, speech, and mind of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: rigs gsum gyi rig 'dzin gyi 'bras bu 'thob pa'o //üîΩgal te gti mug can zhes pa la sogs pas ni gong du bstan pa'i sngags kyi spyod pa dang mi ldan par bdag sngags pa'o zhes pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bya ba 'am /üîΩgsang @113a * //
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi rig 'dzin gyi 'bras bu 'thob pa'o // gal te gti mug can zhes pa la sogs pas ni gong du bstan pa'i sngags kyi spyod pa dang mi ldan par bdag sngags pa'o zhes pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis bsgom pa dang bzlas pa bya ba 'am / gsang @113a * //
translated: The phrase the nature of the three vajras means that one becomes the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the tathagatas, or else one attains the result of being a knowledge-holder of the three families.

original: sngags dang gsang sngags kyi spyod pa smad cing spong ba'i skyon bstan /
analyzed: sngags dang gsang sngags kyi spyod pa smad cing spong ba'i skyon bstan /
translated: The phrase if one is ignorant and so forth teaches the fault of despising and rejecting the secret mantra and the conduct of the secret mantra.

original: de la zhes pa ni dam tshig las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni dam tshig las 'das pa'o //
translated: The phrase in that case means that one transgresses the commitments.

original: dngos grub mi 'byung ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub phra mo yang mi 'thob pa'i don to //
analyzed: dngos grub mi 'byung ba ni 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub phra mo yang mi 'thob pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase one will not attain powers means that one will not attain even the most minor worldly powers.

original: zhing zhes pa ni mi 'thob pa'i steng du gong ma ltar yang 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhing zhes pa ni mi 'thob pa'i steng du gong ma ltar yang 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase one's field means that in addition to not attaining powers, one will also experience the consequences described above.

original: rims ni zhag gcig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rims ni zhag gcig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase one will contract a disease refers to diseases such as those that last for one day and so forth.

original: dug ni sbrul la sogs pa'i srog chags kyi dug dang / shing kimpa ka la sogs pa'i rtsva shing gi dug dang lus las byung ba'i dug go //
analyzed: dug ni sbrul la sogs pa'i srog chags kyi dug dang / shing kimpa ka la sogs pa'i rtsva shing gi dug dang lus las byung ba'i dug go //
translated: Poison is the poison of living beings such as snakes, the poison of plants such as kimpaka, and the poison of the body.

original: nad ni nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nad ni nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Disease is the four hundred and four diseases and so forth.

original: bgegs ni bgegs kyi rgyal po bi na ya ka la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: bgegs ni bgegs kyi rgyal po bi na ya ka la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Obstruction is the obstruction of the king of obstructions, Vinayaka, and so forth.

original: / kyis zhes pa ni de rnams kun gyis bsad nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: / kyis zhes pa ni de rnams kun gyis bsad nas zhes pa'o //
translated: By all of them means that they all kill.

original: sems can zhes pa ni dam tshig las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sems can zhes pa ni dam tshig las 'das pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings means those who transgress the commitments.

original: dmyal bar 'gro zhes pa ni dmyal ba chen po brgyad la sogs par skye ba'o //
analyzed: dmyal bar 'gro zhes pa ni dmyal ba chen po brgyad la sogs par skye ba'o //
translated: They go to hell means that they are born in the eight great hells and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dam tshig las 'das pa de shin tu sdig che bar bstan /
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dam tshig las 'das pa de shin tu sdig che bar bstan /
translated: The Buddha, Bodhisattvas, and so forth teach that transgressing the commitments is a very great evil.

original: byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa ni thugs rje che ba de rnams kyis mi bzlog pa'i don to //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa ni thugs rje che ba de rnams kyis mi bzlog pa'i don to //
translated: The blessing is the great compassion of those who do not turn away from those who transgress the commitments.

original: me tog la sogs phul yang mi bzhes pa ni dam tshig las nyams pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba ci byas kyang bsod nams chen por mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: me tog la sogs phul yang mi bzhes pa ni dam tshig las nyams pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba ci byas kyang bsod nams chen por mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: Not accepting the offerings of flowers and so forth means that whatever roots of virtue that one with impaired commitments does, they will not become great merit.

original: 'jig rten 'dir yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdor na dam tshig nyams pa'i gang zag ni 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol tu shin tu yang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur bas dam tshig las skad cig kyang 'da' bar mi rung bar bstan /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir yang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mdor na dam tshig nyams pa'i gang zag ni 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol tu shin tu yang sdug bsngal bar 'gyur bas dam tshig las skad cig kyang 'da' bar mi rung bar bstan /
translated: ‚Äú In this world, there is suffering‚Äù and so forth means that in brief, a person with impaired commitments will have extremely great suffering in this world and the next, and therefore it is not suitable to transgress the commitments even for a moment.

original: 'jig rten 'di zhes pa ni tshe 'di'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di zhes pa ni tshe 'di'o //
translated: ‚Äú In this world‚Äù means in this life.

original: sdug bsngal ba ni bkres skom la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi tshor ba myong ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ni bkres skom la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi tshor ba myong ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Suffering‚Äù means experiencing all feelings of suffering, such as hunger and thirst.

original: pha rol ni tshe phyi ma'o //
analyzed: pha rol ni tshe phyi ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú The next‚Äù means the next life.

original: yang zhes pa ni 'di la ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang zhes pa ni 'di la ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Also‚Äù means in addition to this.

original: dmyal bar 'gro ba ni gong ma dang mthun no //
analyzed: dmyal bar 'gro ba ni gong ma dang mthun no //
translated: ‚Äú Going to hell‚Äù is the same as above.

original: dam tshig spyod pa ni gong du bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa ni gong du bstan pa rnams so //
translated: ‚Äú Commitments‚Äù are the ones taught above.

original: nyams pa ni mi bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: nyams pa ni mi bsrung ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Impaired‚Äù means not protected.

original: gti mug can ni legs nyes kyi don mi go ba'o //
analyzed: gti mug can ni legs nyes kyi don mi go ba'o //
translated: The deluded one does not understand the meaning of good and bad.

original: 'bras bu mi thob ces pa ni byas pa thams cad 'bras bu med pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi thob ces pa ni byas pa thams cad 'bras bu med pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase does not attain the fruit means that all his actions are fruitless.

original: de ltar dam tshig dang spyod pa rnams la rnal 'byor pa gnas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dam tshig dang spyod pa rnams la rnal 'byor pa gnas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the yogi's abiding in the commitments and conduct,

original: da ni rang gi lus ngag yid gsum 'phags pa'i sku gsung thugs su sgrubs shig par @113b bstan /
analyzed: da ni rang gi lus ngag yid gsum 'phags pa'i sku gsung thugs su sgrubs shig par @113b bstan /
translated: now he teaches that one should accomplish one's own body, speech, and mind as the body, speech, and mind of the noble ones.

original: sngar smos pa'i sdom pa ni gong du bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: sngar smos pa'i sdom pa ni gong du bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The vows mentioned earlier are those taught above.

original: gnas nas zhes pa ni dang du blangs nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnas nas zhes pa ni dang du blangs nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase from the place means having taken up.

original: rtag par ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag par ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: The word always means at all times.

original: mi phyed pa ni mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The word indivisible means unchanging.

original: brtul zhugs zhes pa ni nan tan gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩlus ngag yid gsum ni rang gi'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs zhes pa ni nan tan gyis zhes bya ba'i don to // lus ngag yid gsum ni rang gi'o //
translated: The word observance means with effort.

original: rdo rje zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi sku gsung thugs so //
translated: One's own body, speech, and mind are the three vajras.

original: sgrub pa brtsam par bya ba ni der bsgyur ba'i spyod pa dang ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa brtsam par bya ba ni der bsgyur ba'i spyod pa dang ting nge 'dzin la 'jug par bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de yang gnas ji lta ba bzhin du brtsam zhe na /

analyzed: dben pa chen po ni dur khrod dam lha khang stong pa la sogs pa'i gnas dben zhing yid du 'ong ba thams cad do //

original: rnams su zhes pa ni de rnams gang yang rung ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnams su zhes pa ni de rnams gang yang rung ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin those places‚Äù means any of those.

analyzed: dngos grub thob ces pa ni de lta bu'i gnas su bsgrubs na yid kyis 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone attains siddhi‚Äù means that if one practices in such a place, one attains the desired result.

original: sems dpa'i skyil krung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa'i srung mtshams bcad pa'i cho ga bstan /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgrub pa'i srung mtshams bcad pa'i cho ga bstan /
translated: The ‚Äúheroic cross-legged posture‚Äù and so forth teach the ritual for the boundary-protection practice.

analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung ni phyed skyil lo //
translated: The ‚Äúheroic cross-legged posture‚Äù is the half-cross-legged posture.

analyzed: de yang g-yon pa bskum zhing g-yas cung zad brkyang ba'i tshul lo //

analyzed: 'jam pa'i bstan ni phyi dang nang dang gsang ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúGentle‚Äù refers to the outer, inner, and secret.

analyzed: phyi ni srin bal la sogs pa la byas la 'jam zhing yid du 'ong ba rnams so //

analyzed: nang ni nyi zla padma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The inner is the sun, moon, lotus, and so forth.

original: skabs 'dir nang gi las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: skabs 'dir nang gi las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: In this context, the inner is the sun ma·πá·∏çala.

original: gsang ba ni yum dang gnyis su med par rdo rje dang padmar ldan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: gsang ba ni yum dang gnyis su med par rdo rje dang padmar ldan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The secret is the manner of possessing the vajra and lotus in union with the mother.

original: 'dug nas zhes pa ni stan de gsum gyi steng du bdag gong du bstan pa'i tshul du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug nas zhes pa ni stan de gsum gyi steng du bdag gong du bstan pa'i tshul du 'dug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeated‚Äù means that one sits on those three seats in the manner taught above.

original: ci byed cen ;
analyzed: ci byed cen ;

analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du bsgom zhes bya ba'i don /
translated: The meaning is that one meditates on the manner of the anger vajra that will be explained below.

original: gnas nas zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas nas zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the place‚Äù means from the place of meditative concentration.

translated: ‚ÄúProtection‚Äù means that all obstructors cannot find an opportunity.üîΩ‚ÄúImagination‚Äù means

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams so //

translated: the meditative concentrations below.

original: gzugs chen 'bar ba zhes pa ni bdag zhe sdang rdo rje yab yum du gnas pa'i thugs ka nas h'um las khro bo bcu phyung ba'i cha lugs so //
analyzed: gzugs chen 'bar ba zhes pa ni bdag zhe sdang rdo rje yab yum du gnas pa'i thugs ka nas h'um las khro bo bcu phyung ba'i cha lugs so //

analyzed: gzugs che ba ni srid pa gsum gyi sems can zil gyis gnon pa'i sku dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: 'bar ba ni ye shes kyi 'od zer bskal pa'i me bzhin 'bar ba'i sems can gyi nyon mongs pa sreg par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBlazing‚Äù means that the fire of gnosis blazes like the fire at the end of the eon, burning the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: 'jigs rten pa ni sems can thams cad 'khor ba las 'jigs shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i sar 'bros par byed pa'am sgrub pa po la bar chod byed pa'i bgegs thams cad skrag cing 'bros par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs rten pa ni sems can thams cad 'khor ba las 'jigs shing mya ngan las 'das pa'i sar 'bros par byed pa'am sgrub pa po la bar chod byed pa'i bgegs thams cad skrag cing 'bros par byed pa'o //
translated: The mundane is that which terrifies all sentient beings with the fear of samsara and causes them to flee to the stage of nirvana, or it is that which terrifies and causes to flee all the obstructors who create obstacles for the practitioner.

analyzed: khro bo ni khros pa'i cha lugs shin tu 'jigs pa'i tshul lo //

original: bcu dag ni grangs so //
analyzed: bcu dag ni grangs so //

analyzed: phyung ba ni zhe sdang rdo rje yab yum gnyis su med pa'i thugs ka nas so //
translated: Emanated means from the heart of the nondual father and mother, Hevajra.

original: de yang ci lta zhe na zhe sdang rdo rje yab yum gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems bde ba chen po'i cha bcur byas te de'i h'um bcur gyur par bsam /

translated: Furthermore, how is that? The nondual bodhicitta of the father and mother, Hevajra, is divided into ten parts of great bliss, and one imagines those to be the ten h≈´·πÉs.

analyzed: de nas ya m'anta ka pradzny'anta ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa ming brjod pa tsam gyis khro bo bcu thugs ka nas phyung zhing so so'i phyogs su ma las bskyed pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas par bsam mo //
translated: Then, by merely uttering the names Yamantaka, Prajnantaka, and so forth, the ten wrathful ones are emanated from the heart and are thought to stand on the sun ma·πá·∏çalas generated from ma in their respective directions.

original: smad rtse mor bsam pa ni khro bo de rnams rked pa man chad zur gsum pa phur bu'i tshul du bya'o //
analyzed: smad rtse mor bsam pa ni khro bo de rnams rked pa man chad zur gsum pa phur bu'i tshul du bya'o //
translated: The lower part is thought of as the peak, meaning that the lower part of those wrathful ones is triangular, like a dagger.

original: ro stod khro bo lta bu zhes pa ni rked pa yan chod khro bo'i cha lugs zhal gsum phyag drug pa la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ro stod khro bo lta bu zhes pa ni rked pa yan chod khro bo'i cha lugs zhal gsum phyag drug pa la sogs pa dang ldan par bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The upper part is like a wrathful one means that the upper part is meditated upon as having the accoutrements of a wrathful one, with three faces, six arms, and so forth.

original: phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs bcur nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bcu bskyed nas khro bo de rnams dkyil 'khor dag gi steng du gnas par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs bcur nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bcu bskyed nas khro bo de rnams dkyil 'khor dag gi steng du gnas par bsam pa'o //
translated: The ma·πá·∏çalas of the ten directions means that after generating ten sun ma·πá·∏çalas in the ten directions, such as the east, one should think that those wrathful ones stand on those ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: rim bzhin zhes pa ni phyogs dang khro bo ma nor ba dang shar phyogs nas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rim bzhin zhes pa ni phyogs dang khro bo ma nor ba dang shar phyogs nas bskyed pa'o //
translated: The phrase in order means that the directions and the wrathful deities are not confused, and that they are generated from the east.

original: de yang shar phyogs su gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: de yang shar phyogs su gshin rje gshed do //
translated: Moreover, in the east is Yam√¢ntaka.

original: shar lhor mi g-yo mgon no //
analyzed: shar lhor mi g-yo mgon no //
translated: In the southeast is Acala.

original: lhor shes rab mthar byed /üîΩlho nub tu 'dod pa'i rgyal po /
analyzed: lhor shes rab mthar byed / lho nub tu 'dod pa'i rgyal po /
translated: In the south is Praj√±√¢nta.üîΩIn the southwest is K√¢mar√¢ja.

analyzed: nub tu padma mthar byed / nub byang du n'i la danda /
translated: In the west is Padm√¢ntaka.üîΩIn the northwest is N√Æladanda.

original: byang du aa mri ta kunda li /
analyzed: byang du aa mri ta kunda li /
translated: In the north is Amritakundali.

original: byang shar du ma h'a ba la /
analyzed: byang shar du ma h'a ba la /
translated: In the northeast is Mah√¢bala.

original: 'og tu ka ma la kunda li /
analyzed: 'og tu ka ma la kunda li /

original: steng du h'um mdzad @114b do ;
analyzed: steng du h'um mdzad @114b do ;
