analyzed: / de ltar khro bo rnams bskyed nas yang 'di ltar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, having generated the wrathful deities, one should do this.

original: bgegs zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chad byed pa'o //
analyzed: bgegs zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chad byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase obstructing spirits means those who create obstacles to meditative concentration.

original: thams cad ni bgegs kyi rigs ji lta bu yang rung ba ma lus pa'i don to //üîΩbshig pa ni med par byas pa 'am /
analyzed: thams cad ni bgegs kyi rigs ji lta bu yang rung ba ma lus pa'i don to // bshig pa ni med par byas pa 'am /
translated: The word all means without exception, whatever kind of obstructing spirits there are.

original: tshar gcad pa'i don to//
analyzed: tshar gcad pa'i don to//
translated: The word destroy means to make them non-existent, or to mean to subdue.

original: gnod mdzes bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa ni khro bo gnod mdzes bskyed cing bgegs rnams khug cig par bka' stsal pa dang phur bus thob cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnod mdzes bka' stsal zhes pa la sogs pa ni khro bo gnod mdzes bskyed cing bgegs rnams khug cig par bka' stsal pa dang phur bus thob cig pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the wrathful one commands and so forth is that one generates the wrathful one Sumbha and commands the obstructors to be summoned and to be struck with the dagger.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas zhes pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje yab yum gyi gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems las khro bo h'um dkar bskyed nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas zhes pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje yab yum gyi gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems las khro bo h'um dkar bskyed nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gnas par bsam pa'o //
translated: The meaning of dwelling in the center of a sun mandala is that one generates the wrathful one white Hum from the nondual exalted wisdom of the father and mother, and imagines him dwelling on top of a sun mandala.

original: dbyar gyi sprin phung lta bu zhes pa ni de'i sku mdog bstan te shin tu yang gnag pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi sprin phung lta bu zhes pa ni de'i sku mdog bstan te shin tu yang gnag pa'o //
translated: The meaning of like a summer cloud bank is that one teaches his body color, which is very dark.

original: bskal pa'i me dpung zhes pa ni sku'i 'od shin tu 'bar zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad sreg pa'i mthu che ba'am bdud dang bgegs thams cad 'od kyis tshig cing thal bar rlog pa'i 'od dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: bskal pa'i me dpung zhes pa ni sku'i 'od shin tu 'bar zhing nyon mongs pa thams cad sreg pa'i mthu che ba'am bdud dang bgegs thams cad 'od kyis tshig cing thal bar rlog pa'i 'od dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of a mass of the fire of the end of the eon is that one imagines his body with a very blazing light, with the power to burn all afflictions, or with light that burns and reduces to ashes all maras and obstructors.

original: g-yas brkyang ba ni zhabs gnyis stang stabs so //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang ba ni zhabs gnyis stang stabs so //
translated: The meaning of right leg extended is that he has the gait of two legs.

original: smin mtshams khro gnyer ni dpral ba khro gnyer gsum mam lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: smin mtshams khro gnyer ni dpral ba khro gnyer gsum mam lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The frown between the eyebrows is the three or five wrinkles on the forehead.

original: dmar ba'i spyan ni sems can thams cad la thugs rje'i dbang gis chags pa'i don dang bgegs thams cad 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir spyan shin tu yang dmar bar bstan to //
analyzed: dmar ba'i spyan ni sems can thams cad la thugs rje'i dbang gis chags pa'i don dang bgegs thams cad 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir spyan shin tu yang dmar bar bstan to //
translated: The red eyes are taught to be very red in order to have passion for all sentient beings through the power of compassion and in order to frighten all obstructors.

original: zhal gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi sgo nas sems can gyi don mdzad pa 'am mnga' ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhal gsum ni sku gsung thugs kyi sgo nas sems can gyi don mdzad pa 'am mnga' ba'i don to //
translated: The three faces are the meaning of the activity of benefitting sentient beings through body, speech, and mind, or the meaning of possessing them.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa ni shin tu yang 'jigs par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa ni shin tu yang 'jigs par byed pa'i don to //
translated: The bared fangs are for the purpose of frightening very much.

original: rnam par bsgyur ba ni ljags so //
analyzed: rnam par bsgyur ba ni ljags so //
translated: The tongue is the transformation.

original: phyag drug la dang po gnyis h'um gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyag drug la dang po gnyis h'um gi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The six arms are the first two endowed with the h≈´·πÉ mudra.

original: de yang g-yon gyi mdzub mo bsdigs pa'i tshul du thugs kyi thad kar gzhag ba'o //
analyzed: de yang g-yon gyi mdzub mo bsdigs pa'i tshul du thugs kyi thad kar gzhag ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the left index finger is placed at the heart in the manner of threatening.

original: g-yas kyi mdzub mo gnam du bsdigs pa'i tshul du bsgreng ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi mdzub mo gnam du bsdigs pa'i tshul du bsgreng ba'o //
translated: The right index finger is extended in the manner of threatening the sky.

original: dpa' bo ni 'jig rten gyi lha la sogs pa gang gis kyang mi thub pa'i don to //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni 'jig rten gyi lha la sogs pa gang gis kyang mi thub pa'i don to //
translated: The hero means that he is invincible by any worldly god, etc.

original: rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa zhes pa ni phyag de gnyis kyis so //üîΩg-yas gnyis lcags kyu ral gri ni bar ma lcags kyu ral gri'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa zhes pa ni phyag de gnyis kyis so // g-yas gnyis lcags kyu ral gri ni bar ma lcags kyu ral gri'o //
translated: Holding the vajra and bell means with those two hands.

original: g-yon gyi bar ma dgra sta tha ma zhags pa'o //üîΩ'di 'dra gzugs zhes pa ni gong du @115a * //
analyzed: g-yon gyi bar ma dgra sta tha ma zhags pa'o // 'di 'dra gzugs zhes pa ni gong du @115a * //
translated: The two right hands are the hook and sword, the middle one is the hook, and the last one is the sword.üîΩThe middle left hand is the axe, and the last one is the noose.

original: bstan pa'i cha lugs khro bo mdun du gnas par bsgoms nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bstan pa'i cha lugs khro bo mdun du gnas par bsgoms nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This form means that one should meditate on the wrathful one in front, with the accouterments taught above.

original: rang gis de la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rang gis de la bka' stsal pa /
translated: He himself spoke to him.

original: zhes pa ni thugs ka nas byung ba'i khro bo h'um ka ra la zhe sdang rdo rje bgegs thams cad khug shig par sngags kyi sgo nas bskul ba'i don no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thugs ka nas byung ba'i khro bo h'um ka ra la zhe sdang rdo rje bgegs thams cad khug shig par sngags kyi sgo nas bskul ba'i don no //
translated: This means that from his heart, the wrathful Humkara was urged by the mantra to summon all obstructors with the vajra of hatred.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: aom sumbha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: aom sumbha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi yi ge rnams so //
translated: The mantra syllables Om sum bha ra, etc.

original: aom ni ye shes lnga'am sku gsung thugs bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: aom ni ye shes lnga'am sku gsung thugs bstan pa 'am /
translated: Om is the five wisdoms or the teaching of body, speech, and mind.

original: sngags thams cad kyi mgo aom gyis 'dren pas so //
analyzed: sngags thams cad kyi mgo aom gyis 'dren pas so //
translated: Since all mantras are introduced with Om,

original: de yang ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta zhe na /
translated: how is that?

original: sngon lha chen po 'dod chags chen po skyes nas gangs ri'i bu mo au ma dang zla drug gi bar du mtshams ma bye bar 'dod chags spyod pa gzigs nas thugs rjes de gnyis 'dul ba'i don du khro bo chen po'i cha lugs su sprul nas /
analyzed: sngon lha chen po 'dod chags chen po skyes nas gangs ri'i bu mo au ma dang zla drug gi bar du mtshams ma bye bar 'dod chags spyod pa gzigs nas thugs rjes de gnyis 'dul ba'i don du khro bo chen po'i cha lugs su sprul nas /
translated: Previously, when the great god saw that the daughter of the snow mountain, Uma, was engaging in sexual intercourse without interruption for six months, he was born with great desire.

original: de gnyis mtshams ma bye bar mnan pa'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams bred cing 'dar nas mdzes so mdzes so zhes bstod pas ya mtshan du gyur to //
analyzed: de gnyis mtshams ma bye bar mnan pa'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams bred cing 'dar nas mdzes so mdzes so zhes bstod pas ya mtshan du gyur to //
translated: When he suppressed them without interruption, the worldly gods were terrified and trembled, and since they praised him, saying, ‚ÄúExcellent, excellent,‚Äù he became astonished.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu de gnyis mnan nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed cing mdzes par byas pas so //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu de gnyis mnan nas byang chub kyi sems bskyed cing mdzes par byas pas so //
translated: Again, since he suppressed them, he generated the mind of awakening and was excellent.

original: na zhes pas ni nges pa'i don a'a na ya zhes pa ni bgegs thams cad khyer la shog cig ba'o //
analyzed: na zhes pas ni nges pa'i don a'a na ya zhes pa ni bgegs thams cad khyer la shog cig ba'o //
translated: Na means the definitive meaning. Anaya means ‚Äúbring all obstructors here.‚Äù

original: khro ba'i rgyal po 'di dag gis zhes pa ni sngags de dag gis bskul ma thag tu khro bo gnod mdzes kyis bgegs thams cad bzung nas khro bo rnams kyi 'og tu bcug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khro ba'i rgyal po 'di dag gis zhes pa ni sngags de dag gis bskul ma thag tu khro bo gnod mdzes kyis bgegs thams cad bzung nas khro bo rnams kyi 'og tu bcug par 'gyur ro //
translated: By these kings of wrath means that as soon as they are invoked by those mantras, the wrathful Acala seizes all the obstructors and puts them under the wrathful ones.

original: blo ldan ni cho ga la mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: blo ldan ni cho ga la mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor ba'o //
translated: The wise one is the yogi who is skilled in the rite.

original: sbyor ba yis zhes pa ni 'og tu mnan pa'i bgegs rnams mi lta bar bya ba'i phyir phur bu byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa'i cho ga byas nas thob shig pa'i don to //
analyzed: sbyor ba yis zhes pa ni 'og tu mnan pa'i bgegs rnams mi lta bar bya ba'i phyir phur bu byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa'i cho ga byas nas thob shig pa'i don to //
translated: By the performance means that having performed the rite of consecrating the dagger and so forth in order to prevent the obstructors from looking, one should strike.

original: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyal chen po //
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtsi rgyal chen po //
translated: The great king Vajra Am·πõta

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni phur bu bsgom pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni phur bu bsgom pa'i thabs so //
translated: and so forth are the means of meditating on the dagger.

original: phur bu thams cad khro bo aa mri ta kund'a li'i rang bzhin du bsgoms pas rdo rje phur bu nyid gnas pa zhes bya /
analyzed: phur bu thams cad khro bo aa mri ta kund'a li'i rang bzhin du bsgoms pas rdo rje phur bu nyid gnas pa zhes bya /
translated: Since all the daggers are meditated on as having the nature of the wrathful Am·πõtaku·πá·∏çali, they are called the abode of the vajra dagger.

original: autpala sngon po'i mdog 'dra ba ni phur bu'i kha dog sngo skyar 'dug pa'i don to //
analyzed: autpala sngon po'i mdog 'dra ba ni phur bu'i kha dog sngo skyar 'dug pa'i don to //
translated: The color of a blue lotus means that the color of the dagger is a pale blue.

original: 'bar ba'i phreng ba ni phur bu nyid las dkris pa'i tshul du 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i phreng ba ni phur bu nyid las dkris pa'i tshul du 'phro ba'o //
translated: The garland of flames is the manner of the emanation from the kƒ´la itself.

original: lte ba man @115b chad zhes pa la sogs pa ni gong du bstan pa'i khro bo rnams 'dra bar bsgoms shig pa'i don to //
analyzed: lte ba man @115b chad zhes pa la sogs pa ni gong du bstan pa'i khro bo rnams 'dra bar bsgoms shig pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe navel and below‚Äù and so forth is that one should meditate on the wrathful ones as taught above.

original: bgegs kyi tshogs la 'og tu gzigs pa zhes pa ni 'og tu mnan pa'i bgegs rnams la ma 'gul cig ces pa'i brda sdang mig tu blta ba'o //
analyzed: bgegs kyi tshogs la 'og tu gzigs pa zhes pa ni 'og tu mnan pa'i bgegs rnams la ma 'gul cig ces pa'i brda sdang mig tu blta ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLooking down at the hosts of obstructors‚Äù means that one should look with wrathful eyes at the obstructors who are suppressed below, as a sign not to move.

original: de'i sngags ni phur bu'i sngags 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sngags ni phur bu'i sngags 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The mantra of that is the kƒ´la mantra that will come below.

original: brjod pa ni lan grangs brgya rtsa brgyad dam /
analyzed: brjod pa ni lan grangs brgya rtsa brgyad dam /
translated: ‚ÄúRecite‚Äù means one hundred and eight times,

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig gam bdun zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig gam bdun zhes pa'i don to //
translated: or twenty-one times, or seven times.

original: rdo rje phur bu ni de lta bur byin gyis brlabs pa'i phur bu'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phur bu ni de lta bur byin gyis brlabs pa'i phur bu'o //
translated: The vajra kƒ´la is the kƒ´la that is empowered in that way.

original: nges pa ni the tshom med par btab na bgegs thams cad gnon par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa ni the tshom med par btab na bgegs thams cad gnon par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúCertainly‚Äù means that if one strikes without doubt, all obstructors will be suppressed.

original: de'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra of that is:üîΩo·πÉ gha gha

original: aom gha gha zhes pa la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: aom gha gha zhes pa la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams so //
translated: and so forth.

original: rdo rje tho ba phyag bsnams mchog / ces pa la sogs pa ni phur bu 'debs pa'i tshe rnal 'byor pas h'um mdzad bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje tho ba phyag bsnams mchog / ces pa la sogs pa ni phur bu 'debs pa'i tshe rnal 'byor pas h'um mdzad bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: The supreme one holding a vajra hammer, and so on, means that when the yogi plants the dagger, he should meditate on Humkara.

original: de yang h'um gi phyag rgya btang la thob phur bu 'dzin cing tshig kyang h'um h'um zhes brjod cing rgyun mi 'chad par bsgrags te /
analyzed: de yang h'um gi phyag rgya btang la thob phur bu 'dzin cing tshig kyang h'um h'um zhes brjod cing rgyun mi 'chad par bsgrags te /
translated: Moreover, having assumed the seal of Hum, holding the dagger, and uttering the words Hum Hum, he should proclaim it without interruption.

original: mig kyang sdang mig tu me stag 'phro ba'i tshul du blta zhing bgegs rnams phur bus btab par bya ba'i don to //üîΩphyogs mtshams kun du rdo rje me /
analyzed: mig kyang sdang mig tu me stag 'phro ba'i tshul du blta zhing bgegs rnams phur bus btab par bya ba'i don to // phyogs mtshams kun du rdo rje me /
translated: He should also look with angry eyes, as if shooting sparks, and the obstructors should be struck with the dagger.

original: zhes pa ni phyogs mtshams su yi ge ram bskyed nas bskal pa'i me dang 'dra bar ye shes kyi me bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyogs mtshams su yi ge ram bskyed nas bskal pa'i me dang 'dra bar ye shes kyi me bskyed pa'o //
translated: The vajra fire in all directions and corners means that having generated the syllable Ram in the directions and corners, one should generate the fire of wisdom, like the fire at the end of the eon.

original: rnam par 'phro ba ni phyogs thams cad du 'phro zhing sems can gyi nyon mongs pa bsregs pa dang / me stag 'bar ba 'phro zhing sdang ba rnams tshig par bsam mo //
analyzed: rnam par 'phro ba ni phyogs thams cad du 'phro zhing sems can gyi nyon mongs pa bsregs pa dang / me stag 'bar ba 'phro zhing sdang ba rnams tshig par bsam mo //
translated: The spreading out is spreading out in all directions, burning the afflictions of sentient beings, and the spreading out of blazing sparks, burning the angry ones.

original: phyogs bcu kun du 'bros par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun du 'bros par 'gyur /
translated: They will flee in all ten directions.

original: zhes pa ni bgegs thams cad sgrub pa'i gnas kyi mtshams nas so so'i phyogs su 'bros par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bgegs thams cad sgrub pa'i gnas kyi mtshams nas so so'i phyogs su 'bros par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: This means that all obstructors will flee to their own directions from the boundary of the site of the rite.üîΩHaving staked the boundary with daggers,

original: phyogs mtshams phur bus btab nas ni gong ma ltar byas nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams phur bus btab nas ni gong ma ltar byas nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means having done as above.

original: steng 'og yang dag byin gyis brlab //
analyzed: steng 'og yang dag byin gyis brlab //
translated: Bless above and below.

original: ces pa ni gong ma ltar phur bu gdab pa dang me bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni gong ma ltar phur bu gdab pa dang me bskyed pa'o //
translated: This means to stake the daggers and generate the fire as above.

original: de ltar gnas srung ba bstan nas dam pa'i don zhes pa la sogs pas gnas sbyang ba'i cho gga bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas srung ba bstan nas dam pa'i don zhes pa la sogs pas gnas sbyang ba'i cho gga bstan te /
translated: Having thus taught the protection of the site, the purification of the site is taught by the passage beginning with ‚Äúthe ultimate reality‚Äù and so on.

original: de yang don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sbyang dgos pas na srid pa gsum ma skyes pa rang bzhin med par sgoms shig pa'i don to//
analyzed: de yang don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sbyang dgos pas na srid pa gsum ma skyes pa rang bzhin med par sgoms shig pa'i don to//
translated: Moreover, since it is necessary to purify by ultimate concentration, one should meditate on the three worlds as unborn and essenceless.

original: @116a * // dngos po med par bsgom pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs par snang ba g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba thams cad ye nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin par ma shes shing ye nas yod pa las med par
analyzed: @116a * // dngos po med par bsgom pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs par snang ba g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba thams cad ye nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin par ma shes shing ye nas yod pa las med par
translated: The meaning of meditation on non-entity and so forth is that all the movements and non-movements that appear as the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and so forth are primordially unborn, and yet one does not understand that.

original: sgom pa ni sgom pa yang dag pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sgom pa ni sgom pa yang dag pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Meditating on what is primordially existent as non-existent is not the correct meditation.

original: de lta bas na don dam pa'i rang bzhin sgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas yod pa dang med pa dang thog ma dang tha ma la sogs pa'i sems kyi bye brag thams cad mi dmigs par nam mkha' ltar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam pa'i rang bzhin sgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas yod pa dang med pa dang thog ma dang tha ma la sogs pa'i sems kyi bye brag thams cad mi dmigs par nam mkha' ltar bsgom pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nƒ´ who meditates on the nature of the ultimate does not observe any of the various aspects of the mind, such as existence and non-existence, beginning and end, and so forth. One meditates like space.

original: dngos po ni gong du bstan pa'i phung po dang khams la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni gong du bstan pa'i phung po dang khams la sogs pa'o //
translated: Entity refers to the aggregates, elements, and so forth that were taught above.

original: brtan pa ni sa dang ri rab la sogs pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: brtan pa ni sa dang ri rab la sogs pa'i snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: Stable refers to the world of the environment, such as the earth and Mount Meru, and so forth.

original: g-yo ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i bcud kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i bcud kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: Mobile refers to the world of the inhabitants, such as gods, humans, and so forth.

original: kun ni ma lus pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun ni ma lus pa'i don to //
translated: All means without exception.

original: tshigs bcad 'di yis stong gyur zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas na ma mkha' ltar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'di yis stong gyur zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas na ma mkha' ltar bsgom pa'o //
translated: This verse says that ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù is the meditation on the absence of intrinsic existence of all phenomena, as explained in the previous verse.

original: nas ni stong par bsams nas bsgrub bya'i sa byin gyis brlab ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: nas ni stong par bsams nas bsgrub bya'i sa byin gyis brlab ces pa'i don to //
translated: This verse says that one should meditate on the emptiness of the place as explained in the previous verse, and then, having imagined it as empty, one should consecrate the ground of the victim.

original: cho ga 'di'i sbyor ba zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i byang chub sems rdo rje bsgom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'di'i sbyor ba zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i byang chub sems rdo rje bsgom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúapplication of this rite‚Äù is the meditation on the vajra mind, and so forth, which will be explained below.

original: ye shes sa ni rigs lnga la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi bzhugs pa'i gnas yin pa'am yum lnga'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: ye shes sa ni rigs lnga la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi bzhugs pa'i gnas yin pa'am yum lnga'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The ‚Äúground of gnosis‚Äù is the abode of the deities of the five families, or else it is the nature of the five mothers.

original: byin gyis brlab pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis bskyed pa la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConsecration‚Äù means to generate by means of meditative concentration.

original: byang chub rdo rje dmigs nas zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis dngos por lta ba'i bag chags thams cad byang bar byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas h'um las bdag byang chub sems rdo rje de kun du bzang mo bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub rdo rje dmigs nas zhes pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis dngos por lta ba'i bag chags thams cad byang bar byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas h'um las bdag byang chub sems rdo rje de kun du bzang mo bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized Bodhivajra means that the yogin who has purified all habitual tendencies of viewing things as real by means of the samadhi of emptiness should visualize himself as Bodhicittavajra and Samantabhadri.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'dug pa'i aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la 'dug pa'i aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la /
translated: From the syllable A on the moon disc, he should visualize a moon disc.

original: de'i steng du byang chub sems rdo rje dang / kun du bzang mo sku mdog zla ba'i mdog dang 'dra ba zla ba'i 'od dang ldan pa sangs rgyas lngas dbu brgyan pa sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du sbyor ba'i tshul du bzhugs pa phyag rgya gnyis kyis 'gying ba'i tshul du g-yon pas yum la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du byang chub sems rdo rje dang / kun du bzang mo sku mdog zla ba'i mdog dang 'dra ba zla ba'i 'od dang ldan pa sangs rgyas lngas dbu brgyan pa sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du sbyor ba'i tshul du bzhugs pa phyag rgya gnyis kyis 'gying ba'i tshul du g-yon pas yum la 'khyud pa /
translated: On top of that, he should visualize Bodhicittavajra and Samantabhadri, the color of the moon, with the radiance of the moon, crowned with the five Buddhas, in the posture of the Bodhisattva sitting in the vajra posture, embracing the consort with the two hands in the manner of dancing,

original: g-yas pas rdo rje 'dzin pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pas rdo rje 'dzin pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: the right hand holding a vajra.

original: nam mkha'i khams kun khyab cis @116b pa ni de ltar byang chub sems rdo rje kun du bzang mo gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems las yi ge mar gyur la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kun khyab cis @116b pa ni de ltar byang chub sems rdo rje kun du bzang mo gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems las yi ge mar gyur la /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúpervading the entire realm of space‚Äù is that the bodhicitta, the indivisible union of Vajra·∏çƒÅka and Samantabhadrƒ´, becomes the syllable ma.

original: de'i 'phro 'du byas pa las lha mo m'a ma k'i rgyur bar bsams la 'phro 'du byas pa las sems can gyi don du chu'i rang bzhin du gyur nas nam mkha' dang mnyam par gnas par bsam pa'i don to //üîΩnam mkha' rdo rje dbus gnas pa //üîΩzhes pa ni gong ma dang 'dra bar gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems las yi ge lam du gyur la gong ma ltar 'phro 'du byas pa las lha mo lo tsa na sku mdog dkar mo gyur bar bsams la 'phro 'du byas pa las sems can gyi
analyzed: de'i 'phro 'du byas pa las lha mo m'a ma k'i rgyur bar bsams la 'phro 'du byas pa las sems can gyi don du chu'i rang bzhin du gyur nas nam mkha' dang mnyam par gnas par bsam pa'i don to // nam mkha' rdo rje dbus gnas pa // zhes pa ni gong ma dang 'dra bar gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems las yi ge lam du gyur la gong ma ltar 'phro 'du byas pa las lha mo lo tsa na sku mdog dkar mo gyur bar bsams la 'phro 'du byas pa las sems can gyi
translated: From the emanation and reabsorption of that, one should imagine that it becomes the cause of the goddess MƒÅmakƒ´.üîΩThe meaning of the statement ‚Äúabiding in the center of the vajra of space‚Äù is that the indivisible bodhicitta becomes the syllable la·πÉ, and from the emanation and reabsorption of that, one should imagine that it becomes the goddess LocanƒÅ.

original: don du sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: don du sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du gyur par bsam mo //
translated: From the emanation and reabsorption of that, one should imagine that it becomes the nature of the earth element for the benefit of sentient beings and remains equal to space.

original: de yang khyon ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: de yang khyon ji tsam zhe na /
translated: How large is that?

original: dpag tshad bye ba zhes bya ste de yang gtsor smos pa yin gyi nam mkha'i khams kun khyab pa 'am /
analyzed: dpag tshad bye ba zhes bya ste de yang gtsor smos pa yin gyi nam mkha'i khams kun khyab pa 'am /
translated: The ten million leagues is the principal [measure], but it pervades the entire realm of space,

original: de bas chung ba'am sems kyis gang lcogs dang ngo //
analyzed: de bas chung ba'am sems kyis gang lcogs dang ngo //
translated: or less than that, as much as the mind can manage.

original: dang ba ni shel lta bur 'dug cing 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dang ba ni shel lta bur 'dug cing 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: Clear means like a crystal, existing and shining brightly.

original: dri ma med pa ni rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'phral gyi yid du mi 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa med pa dang / 'phral gyi yid du mi 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: Immaculate means naturally free from afflictions and free from immediate unpleasantness.

original: 'od zer sna lnga ni dkar po la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin 'od do //
analyzed: 'od zer sna lnga ni dkar po la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin 'od do //
translated: Five-colored light rays means the five wisdoms' nature light, such as white and so forth.

original: kun du 'khrigs pa ni phyogs thams cad du 'bar zhing rab rib sel ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun du 'khrigs pa ni phyogs thams cad du 'bar zhing rab rib sel ba'i don to //
translated: Totally swirling means blazing in all directions and clearing away darkness.

original: sangs rgyas rdo rje can gyis gnas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdo rje can gyis gnas /
translated: The abode of the vajra holders.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu de sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid byang chub sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin pa'am rigs lnga la sogs pa'i lha'i pho brang dkyil 'khor bskyed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu de sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid byang chub sems rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin pa'am rigs lnga la sogs pa'i lha'i pho brang dkyil 'khor bskyed pa yin pas so //
translated: This means that since it is the nature of all buddhas, the vajra of awakening, it is the nature of the five families and so forth, the generated mandala palace of the deity.

original: de dbus bh'um ni gnas zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa'i sa gzhi'i dkyil du gzhal yas khang bskyed par bstan /
analyzed: de dbus bh'um ni gnas zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa'i sa gzhi'i dkyil du gzhal yas khang bskyed par bstan /
translated: The line ‚ÄúIn its center is the abode of Bhr≈´·πÉ‚Äù teaches that the celestial mansion is generated in the center of the ground base taught above.

analyzed: de yang gzhal yas khang gi rang bzhin ni gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba chen po'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i snying po yi ge bhr'um las bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'i don to // gser gyi ri bo 'dra ba yi ;
translated: Moreover, since the nature of the celestial mansion is the nature of the great U·π£·πáƒ´·π£a Cakravartin, it is generated from the essence syllable Bhr≈´·πÉ.

original: / zhes pa ni sku ri rab dang 'dra bar shin tu yang che ba dang sku mdog ser ba'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa ni sku ri rab dang 'dra bar shin tu yang che ba dang sku mdog ser ba'o //
translated: The line ‚ÄúLike a golden mountain‚Äù means that the body is very great, like Mount Meru, and the body color is yellow.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gzhal med khang ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhugs gnas yin pas so //üîΩ'khor los sgyur ba bsgom par bya ba ni gzhal yas khang gi @117a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gzhal med khang ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhugs gnas yin pas so // 'khor los sgyur ba bsgom par bya ba ni gzhal yas khang gi @117a * //
translated: Since the celestial mansion of all buddhas is the abode of all tathƒÅgatas of the three times,

original: rang bzhin du smon lam gyis gyur pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin du smon lam gyis gyur pa yin pas so //
translated: the line ‚ÄúOne should meditate on the Cakravartin‚Äù means that since the nature of the celestial mansion is transformed by aspiration,

original: de yang gong du bstan pa'i yi ge las gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba chen po sku mdog gser dang 'dra ba zhal gsum phyag drug pa g-yas gsum 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang rin po che bsnams pa /
analyzed: de yang gong du bstan pa'i yi ge las gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba chen po sku mdog gser dang 'dra ba zhal gsum phyag drug pa g-yas gsum 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang rin po che bsnams pa /
translated: Furthermore, from the syllable taught above, one should meditate on the Great Wheel-Turning U·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, whose color is like gold, who has three faces and six arms, holding a wheel, a vajra, and a jewel in his three right hands,

original: g-yon gsum na padma dang ral gri dang lcags kyu bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon gsum na padma dang ral gri dang lcags kyu bsnams pa /
translated: and holding a lotus, a sword, and a goad in his three left hands,

original: rigs lngas dbu brgyan pa /
analyzed: rigs lngas dbu brgyan pa /
translated: and who is crowned with the five families.

original: sku las 'od zer bsam gyis mi khyab pa phyogs bcur 'phro ba lo tsa na dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba'i tshul du gnas par bsgom pa'i don to //

original: bstan ni lha mo sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: bstan ni lha mo sgrol ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDemonstration‚Äù is the goddess TƒÅrƒÅ.

original: shes rab ldan pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with wisdom‚Äù is the yogin.

original: de zhes pa ni gzhal yas khang dang sa gzhi dang chu'i 'og tu gong du bstan pa'i tshul du yi ge ha las lha mo sgrol ma rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni gzhal yas khang dang sa gzhi dang chu'i 'og tu gong du bstan pa'i tshul du yi ge ha las lha mo sgrol ma rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang 'dra ba bsgom zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The that means that, in the manner taught above, one should meditate on the goddess TƒÅrƒÅ arisen from the syllable hƒÅ, like the wind mandala, on the ground and the water below the celestial mansion.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i yi ge bhr'um las lha mo na bza' dkar mo drod thams cad kyi tshul du gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i yi ge bhr'um las lha mo na bza' dkar mo drod thams cad kyi tshul du gnas par bsam mo //
translated: One should think that the goddess PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, similar to that, arisen from the syllable bhr≈´·πÉ, abides in the manner of all heat.

original: gong du rim pa bzhin ma bstan pa ni phyi rol gyi yi ge dang tshig la mkhas pa rnams kyis mi go bar bya ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis man ngag tu mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gong du rim pa bzhin ma bstan pa ni phyi rol gyi yi ge dang tshig la mkhas pa rnams kyis mi go bar bya ba'i phyir slob dpon gyis man ngag tu mdzad pa'o //
translated: The reason for not teaching the sequence above is that the master has made it an esoteric instruction so that those skilled in external letters and words will not understand.

original: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
translated: Abiding in the middle of the sky realm,

original: zhes pa ni nam mkha' kun du bzang mo'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gzhal yas khang de lta bu bskyed pa de bde bar gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhugs gnas yin pa'i don no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam mkha' kun du bzang mo'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid la gzhal yas khang de lta bu bskyed pa de bde bar gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhugs gnas yin pa'i don no //
translated: means that the celestial mansion is generated in the emptiness that is the nature of the sky, Samantabhadrƒ´, and that the meaning is that it is the abode of all Sugatas.

original: rin chen bzhi dngos zhes pas ni gzhal yas khang gi kha dog bstan to //üîΩye shes bzhi las rin po che bzhir snang ba ste de yang shar phyogs me long lta bu'i ye shes shel lta bur snang ba dang / lho phyogs mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes aindra n'i la ltar snang ba dang / nub phyogs so sor rtog pa'i ye shes padma r'a ga ltar snang ba dang /
analyzed: rin chen bzhi dngos zhes pas ni gzhal yas khang gi kha dog bstan to // ye shes bzhi las rin po che bzhir snang ba ste de yang shar phyogs me long lta bu'i ye shes shel lta bur snang ba dang / lho phyogs mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes aindra n'i la ltar snang ba dang / nub phyogs so sor rtog pa'i ye shes padma r'a ga ltar snang ba dang /
translated: The four jewels in reality means that the colors of the celestial mansion are taught.üîΩThe four jewels appear from the four exalted wisdoms.

original: byang phyogs bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes aindra n'i la margad ljang gu ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes aindra n'i la margad ljang gu ltar snang ba'o //
translated: That is to say, the mirror-like exalted wisdom in the east appears like a crystal, the exalted wisdom of uniformity in the south appears like an emerald, the exalted wisdom of individual discernment in the west appears like a ruby, and the exalted wisdom of successful activities in the north appears like an emerald.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni kun la khyab par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes ni kun la khyab par shes par bya'o //

original: mchod rten zhes pa ni 'jig rten gsum gyis mchod par 'os pa gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mchod rten zhes pa ni 'jig rten gsum gyis mchod par 'os pa gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äústupa‚Äù means that it is the nature of the crown chakravartin, who is worthy of worship by the three worlds.

original: @117b 'od zer 'phro bas rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: @117b 'od zer 'phro bas rnam par brgyan //

original: ye shes rgya mtsho zhes pa ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: ye shes rgya mtsho zhes pa ni sangs rgyas so //

analyzed: de yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa gting dpag dka' bas so //

original: dus gsum ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ro //
analyzed: dus gsum ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ro //
translated: The ‚Äúthree times‚Äù are the past, present, and future.

original: yang na ye shes ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: yang na ye shes ni gdod ma nas ma skyes pa chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Alternatively, ‚Äúpristine awareness‚Äù is the originally unborn basic space of phenomena.

original: rgya mtsho ni mtha' thug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ni mtha' thug pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOcean‚Äù is without limit.

original: de'i rang bzhin dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas yin pa'i don to //

original: gnas su de ni rnam par bsam //
analyzed: gnas su de ni rnam par bsam //

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyi bzhugs gnas yin par bsgom mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa rnams kyi bzhugs gnas yin par bsgom mo //

analyzed: gru bzhi ye shes bzhi'am yum bzhi las grub pa'i rtags so ;
translated: The four corners are the sign of its being created from the four exalted wisdoms or the four mothers.

analyzed: / sgo bzhi ni stong pa nyid la sogs pa bzhi'i rtags so //

analyzed: sgo rgyan bzhi ni byams pa chen po la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'i rtags so //
translated: The four door ornaments are the sign of the four abodes of BrahmƒÅ, such as great love.

analyzed: yang dag ldan zhes pa ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin tva ra na bzhi dang gzhal yas khang dang ldan pa'i don to //

analyzed: dril bu ni shes rab kyi sgra sgrogs shing sems can gyi mi shes pa thams cad sel ba'i don to //

translated: The streamers are the sign of the relative body of the deities of the ma·πá·∏çala, such as the five families, which is superior to gods and humans and endowed with the signs and indications, in accordance with the disciples.

translated: The word ‚Äúand‚Äù means that the Buddha‚Äôs qualities are superior to those of worldly gods such as Mahe≈õvara. The word ‚Äúwith‚Äù refers to the infinite ornaments such as pearl tassels, yak-tail whisks, and canopies.

analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan mtha' yas pa dang sbyor ro //

analyzed: sgo khyud kyi sa rnam par brgyan pa ni yid bzhin nor bu rin po che'i sgo khyud rnams dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: grva mtshams ni thig gnyis kyi bar dang ka ba'i bar ro //

analyzed: thams cad ni lha rnams kyi bzhugs pa'i sa rnams so //

analyzed: zla gam chu'i 'phyang zhes pa la sogs pa'i rgyan 'di dag gis kyang mdzes par byas shing sangs rgyas kyi yon tan du shes par bya'o //

analyzed: thig skud bzhi ni yongs btab pa //

translated: indicate that one should draw or visualize the ma·πá·∏çala of nine sectors in the center of the celestial mansion endowed with those qualities.

original: thig skud ces pa ni ras bal la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la bu mo mtshan dang ldan pas bkal ba kha dog gsum mam lnga sum sgril lam lnga sgril byas pa'i skud pa byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thig skud ces pa ni ras bal la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la bu mo mtshan dang ldan pas bkal ba kha dog gsum mam lnga sum sgril lam lnga sgril byas pa'i skud pa byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúlines‚Äù are threads spun by a girl with good qualities from any material such as cotton. One should understand that the three- or five-colored thread, which is triple or quintuple, is the nature of bodhicitta.

original: bzhi yongs su gtang ba ni de'i dus su rnal 'byor pas sku gsung thugs su bsgoms la aom a'a: h'um brjod cing shar phyogs nas nub phyogs su thig gnyis btab pa dang / lho phyogs nas byang phyogs su thig gnyis btab pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi yongs su gtang ba ni de'i dus su rnal 'byor pas sku gsung thugs su bsgoms la aom a'a: h'um brjod cing shar phyogs nas nub phyogs su thig gnyis btab pa dang / lho phyogs nas byang phyogs su thig gnyis btab pa'o //
translated: The complete giving of the four is as follows: At that time, the yogin should meditate on body, speech, and mind, and say O·πÇ ƒÄ·∏§ H≈™·πÇ, and draw two lines from the east to the west, and two lines from the south to the north.

original: ka ba mchog brgyad kun du gnas pa ni de ltar btab pas phyogs re rer ka ba gnyis gnyis kyi tshul du gnas pas so //
analyzed: ka ba mchog brgyad kun du gnas pa ni de ltar btab pas phyogs re rer ka ba gnyis gnyis kyi tshul du gnas pas so //
translated: The eight supreme corners are present is to say, by drawing in that way, there are two lines in each direction.

original: mchog ces pas ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgyad kyi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ces pas ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo brgyad kyi rnam par dag pa'o //

analyzed: dbus su 'khor lo dmigs bya ba ni thig de'i mtha' kun nas zlum por bskor zhing re'u cha dgu bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The wheel should be visualized in the center means that the yogin should draw a circle all around the lines and make a nine-part grid.

original: mdor na zhes pa ni phyogs dang sangs rgyas so sor slob dpon gyis ma bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: mdor na zhes pa ni phyogs dang sangs rgyas so sor slob dpon gyis ma bstan pa'i don to //

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ces pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ces pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: All buddhas means the five transcendent lords beginning with Ak·π£obhya.

original: rang gi gnas su rnam par bsam //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su rnam par bsam //
translated: One should visualize them in their own places.üîΩThis means that one should visualize or draw the individual Tathagatas in their respective directions.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa so so'i phyogs su bsgom pa 'am bri zhes pa'i don te de yang dbus su mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa so so'i phyogs su bsgom pa 'am bri zhes pa'i don te de yang dbus su mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: In the center is Akshobhya.

original: shar du rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: shar du rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: In the east is Vairochana.

original: lhor rin chen dpal lo //
analyzed: lhor rin chen dpal lo //
translated: In the south is Ratnasambhava.

original: nub tu tshe dpag med do //
analyzed: nub tu tshe dpag med do //
translated: In the west is Amitabha.

original: byang du don thams cad grub pa'o //
analyzed: byang du don thams cad grub pa'o //
translated: In the north is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rdo rje lha mo bzhi rnams zhes pa ni sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lha mo bzhi rnams zhes pa ni sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four Vajra goddesses are Buddhalocana and so forth.

original: 'khor lo'i grvar ni rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i grvar ni rnam par bsgom //
translated: One should visualize them in the corners of the wheel.

original: zhes pa ni me'i phyogs nas dbang ldan gyi phyogs su sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa bzhi rim pa bzhin du dgod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni me'i phyogs nas dbang ldan gyi phyogs su sangs rgyas spyan la sogs pa bzhi rim pa bzhin du dgod pa'o //
translated: This means that one should place Buddhalocana and so forth in the southeast, northeast, southwest, and northwest corners respectively.

original: gshin rje gshed la sogs zhes pa ni gshin rje gshed dang gzhan @118b gyis mi thub pa dang / rta mgrin dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed la sogs zhes pa ni gshin rje gshed dang gzhan @118b gyis mi thub pa dang / rta mgrin dang bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'o //
translated: Yam√¢ntaka and so forth are Yam√¢ntaka, Aparajita, Hayagriva, and Amritakundali.

original: sgor dmigs ba ni shar sgo nas byang sgor rim pa bzhin du dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgor dmigs ba ni shar sgo nas byang sgor rim pa bzhin du dmigs pa'o //
translated: One should visualize them at the gates means that one should visualize them at the east gate, north gate, and so forth respectively.

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa bsgom //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa bsgom //
translated: One should meditate on Kshitigarbha and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad sems ma brgyad dkyil 'khor gyi phyi'i rim pa la 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad sems ma brgyad dkyil 'khor gyi phyi'i rim pa la 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: This means that one should meditate on the eight Bodhisattvas such as Kshitigarbha and the eight Bodhisattva-Dakinis in the outer circle of the mandala, in the manner that will be described below.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa //
translated: Abiding in the center of the sun mandala.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la de'i steng du sems kyi rdo rje rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin nam bdag nyid du gyur pa bsgom par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la de'i steng du sems kyi rdo rje rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin nam bdag nyid du gyur pa bsgom par bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one should generate the sun mandala in the center of the mandala, and on top of that one should meditate on the mind-vajra, Vajrasattva, who is the nature or essence of all the Tathagatas.

original: zhal gsum phyag drug lta bu zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin zhal gsum dang / 'gro ba drug gi don byed pa'i phyag drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhal gsum phyag drug lta bu zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin zhal gsum dang / 'gro ba drug gi don byed pa'i phyag drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Like one with three faces and six arms. This means that one has three faces which are the nature of body, speech, and mind, and six arms which act for the benefit of the six classes of beings.

original: phyag mtshan la sogs pa ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: phyag mtshan la sogs pa ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The hand implements and so forth will be taught below.

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa ni de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom pa'am //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa ni de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyis bsgom pa'am //
translated: Abiding in the center of the mandala of the buddhas is meditating on it in that way through meditative concentration, or it is the mandala of the buddhas that is drawn as a reflection.

original: gzugs brnyan du bris pa'i dkyil 'khor sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nam bzhugs gnas yin pas sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan du bris pa'i dkyil 'khor sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin nam bzhugs gnas yin pas sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Since it is the nature of the buddhas or their abode, it is the mandala of the buddhas.

original: dbus su gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pa de'i dkyil du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: dbus su gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pa de'i dkyil du 'dug pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the center is sitting in the center of that mandala.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the mandala in that way,

original: da ni ting nge 'dzin rnam gsum gyis phyag rgya chen po bskyed cing bsgrub dgos pas de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: da ni ting nge 'dzin rnam gsum gyis phyag rgya chen po bskyed cing bsgrub dgos pas de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: now, since one must generate and accomplish the great seal through the three meditative concentrations, the meditative concentration of suchness is explained.

original: lus dang ngag yid rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ni lus dang ngag yid ni rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa ni lus dang ngag yid ni rnal 'byor pa'i'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind vajras, and so on, are the body, speech, and mind of the practitioner.

original: rdo rje ni ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: Vajra is the nature of nonarising.

original: mtshan nyid dam pa'i don nyid de //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dam pa'i don nyid de //
translated: The characteristic is the ultimate itself.

original: zhes pa ni bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum don dam pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum don dam pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: This means that one meditates on the ultimate nature of one‚Äôs body, speech, and mind as emptiness.

original: tshul bzhin zhes pa ni dngos po med par bsgom pa'i dngos po zhes pa'i tshigs bcad kyi sgo nas dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin zhes pa ni dngos po med par bsgom pa'i dngos po zhes pa'i tshigs bcad kyi sgo nas dpyad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the proper way‚Äù refers to the verse ‚ÄúThe thing to be meditated on as nonexistent is the thing that is analyzed.‚Äù

original: nas zhes pa ni bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum nam mkha' ltar bsgoms nas 'og gi sngags bzla ba'i don to //
analyzed: nas zhes pa ni bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum nam mkha' ltar bsgoms nas 'og gi sngags bzla ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThen‚Äù means that after meditating on one‚Äôs body, speech, and mind as like space, one should recite the following mantra.

original: sngags 'di rab tu brjod pa ni stong pa nyid kyi don yid la byed cing ma nor bar lan gsum brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di rab tu brjod pa ni stong pa nyid kyi don yid la byed cing ma nor bar lan gsum brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúReciting this mantra‚Äù means that one should bring to mind the meaning of emptiness and recite it correctly three times.üîΩThe mantra is: O·πÉ ≈õ≈´nyatƒÅ-j√±ƒÅna-vajra-svabhƒÅvƒÅtmako ‚Äôha·πÉ

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a ni chos thams cad @119a * //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a ni chos thams cad @119a * //
translated: All phenomena

original: don dam par chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nam mkha' ltar gnas pas stong pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nam mkha' ltar gnas pas stong pa'o //
translated: are empty, in the sense that ultimately they abide like space, in the essence of the expanse of reality.

original: rdo rje ni mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúVajra‚Äù means unchanging.

original: a'atma ko& ham zhes pa ni bdag kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: a'atma ko& ham zhes pa ni bdag kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúAham‚Äù means ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: nam mkha' bzhin du blta bar bya ba ni gong ma'i don yang nas yang du yid la bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du blta bar bya ba ni gong ma'i don yang nas yang du yid la bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be viewed as like space‚Äù means that one should bring to mind the meaning of the preceding verse again and again.

original: nam mkha' brtag tu med pa ltar //
analyzed: nam mkha' brtag tu med pa ltar //
translated: Just as space is not an object of the eyes,

original: zhes pa ni chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar brtag tu med pa yin pas bdag kyang rang bzhin med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar brtag tu med pa yin pas bdag kyang rang bzhin med par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since all phenomena are like space, they are not to be examined. Therefore, one should understand that the self is also without intrinsic nature.

original: yi ge rnam par bsgom zhes pa ni de ltar de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid la ci nus su gnas nas /
analyzed: yi ge rnam par bsgom zhes pa ni de ltar de bzhin nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid la ci nus su gnas nas /
translated: The ‚Äúmeditation on the syllables‚Äù is as follows: Having thus remained in the meditative concentration on reality, emptiness, to the best of one‚Äôs ability,

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i yid kyis 'og nas 'byung ba'i yi ge gsum bsgom zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i yid kyis 'og nas 'byung ba'i yi ge gsum bsgom zhes bya'o //
translated: one should meditate on the three syllables that will be described below, with the intention of acting for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: bla 'og dbus ni rim bzhin zhes pa ni spyi bo dang / lce dang snying gi thad ka tsam du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bla 'og dbus ni rim bzhin zhes pa ni spyi bo dang / lce dang snying gi thad ka tsam du bsgom pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAbove, below, and in the middle‚Äù means that one should meditate just above the crown of one‚Äôs head, at the tip of one‚Äôs tongue, and in the heart.

original: bdag nyid yi ge gzugs ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum gyi bag chags yi ge 'bru gsum du dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid yi ge gzugs ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum gyi bag chags yi ge 'bru gsum du dmigs par bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúyogin who abides in emptiness‚Äù should visualize the traces of one‚Äôs own body, speech, and mind as the three seed syllables.

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dbus nyid du //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor dbus nyid du //
translated: In the center of the ma·πá·∏çala of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni stong pa'i dbus su yi ge gsum po dkar po dmar po mthing nag tu kha dog gsum du bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa'i dbus su yi ge gsum po dkar po dmar po mthing nag tu kha dog gsum du bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: This means that in the center of the void one should generate the three syllables as having three colors, white, red, and dark blue.

original: nyi zla padmar yang dag gnas //
analyzed: nyi zla padmar yang dag gnas //

original: zhes pas de rnams kyi gdan bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pas de rnams kyi gdan bstan te /

original: de yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um ngo //üîΩzla ba la aom mo //
analyzed: de yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um ngo // zla ba la aom mo //
translated: Moreover, on top of a sun disk is a h≈´·πÉ.üîΩOn the moon is an o·πÉ.

original: padma la a'a: 'o //
analyzed: padma la a'a: 'o //
translated: On the lotus is an ƒÅ·∏•.

original: aom ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: aom ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i rang bzhin no //
translated: One should know that the o·πÉ is the nature of the body of all tathƒÅgatas of the three times,

original: a'a: ni gsung gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: a'a: ni gsung gi rang bzhin no //
translated: the ƒÅ·∏• is the nature of speech,

original: h'um ni thugs kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um ni thugs kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: and the h≈´·πÉ is the nature of mind.

original: dang bzla ba 'dra ba ni yi ge gsum nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pas so so'i kha dog gsal ba dang zla ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang bzla ba 'dra ba ni yi ge gsum nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pas so so'i kha dog gsal ba dang zla ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Like the moon and the sun means that the three syllables are clear in their individual colors, without the stains of afflictions, like the moon.

original: yi ge gsum ni gong du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum ni gong du bstan pa'o //
translated: The three syllables are as taught above.

original: zhu bar brtag ces pa ni lha'i bu zla ba bdud rtsi 'dod pa'i dus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor las bdud rtsi zhu zhing thigs par 'bab pa bzhin du yi ge gong ma 'od kyi tshul du zhu zhing bar ma la thim /
analyzed: zhu bar brtag ces pa ni lha'i bu zla ba bdud rtsi 'dod pa'i dus su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor las bdud rtsi zhu zhing thigs par 'bab pa bzhin du yi ge gong ma 'od kyi tshul du zhu zhing bar ma la thim /
translated: The line dissolve into the one above means that just as when the moon is in the phase that is desired by the celestial son, the nectar dissolves from the moon's orb and falls in drops, the upper syllable dissolves in the form of light and dissolves into the middle syllable.

original: de bzhin du bar ma yang 'og ma la thim 'og ma yang zhu zhing 'od kyi tshul du gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bar ma yang 'og ma la thim 'og ma yang zhu zhing 'od kyi tshul du gyur par bsam mo //
translated: In the same way, the middle syllable dissolves into the lower one, and the lower one also dissolves and becomes light.

original: rgyu drug gnas pa'i @119b sems can ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang ngan song gsum du skyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu drug gnas pa'i @119b sems can ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang ngan song gsum du skyes pa rnams so //
translated: The sentient beings who abide in the six realms are those born as gods, humans, demigods, and in the three lower realms.

original: sangs rgyas kun ni phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa rnams kyi sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun ni phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa rnams kyi sku gsung thugs so //
translated: The buddhas of all directions are the body, speech, and mind of those who reside in the ten directions.
