original: kun bsdus ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs dang sems can gyi lus ngag yid gsum gcig tu gyur nas slar 'du bar bsgom pa'o //üîΩrang bzhin med par mos pa'i zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa dag chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgom zhing /üîΩdon dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa'i sems kyi bag chags la bya /
analyzed: kun bsdus ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs dang sems can gyi lus ngag yid gsum gcig tu gyur nas slar 'du bar bsgom pa'o // rang bzhin med par mos pa'i zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa dag chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgom zhing / don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems la gnas pa'i sems kyi bag chags la bya /
translated: The line all are gathered by the yoga of gathering means that the light rays of the three syllables taught above radiate into the ten directions and become nondual with the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all buddhas.

original: gzhug par bya ba ni der bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhug par bya ba ni der bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The

original: dharma dha tu sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa ni de ltar sangs rgyas dang sems can thams cad kyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin bdag la bsdus pas chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje bdag yin no bar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dharma dha tu sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes pa ni de ltar sangs rgyas dang sems can thams cad kyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin bdag la bsdus pas chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje bdag yin no bar bsgom pa'o //
translated: Having thus gathered into oneself the ultimate nature of all Buddhas and sentient beings, one meditates on oneself as the vajra of the ultimate realm.üîΩThe verse is: That thought of enlightenment is all-pure.

original: byang chub sems de kun du dag / ces pa de ltar stong pa nyid bsgoms nas bsdu ba'i sbyor ba byas pas bdag gi sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral nas ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi rang bzhin du gnas pas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems de kun du dag / ces pa de ltar stong pa nyid bsgoms nas bsdu ba'i sbyor ba byas pas bdag gi sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral nas ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi rang bzhin du gnas pas so //
translated: Having thus meditated on emptiness, one performs the yoga of gathering, and one's continuum of mind, free from all afflictions, abides in the nature of light rays of pristine wisdom.

original: dri med zla ba lta bur gnas //
analyzed: dri med zla ba lta bur gnas //
translated: The verse is: Abiding like a stainless moon.

original: zhes pa ni zla ba lta bur 'od gsal zhing me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gang ba ltar gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zla ba lta bur 'od gsal zhing me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gang ba ltar gnas pa'i don to //
translated: This means that one abides like a full moon mandala, clear like the moon and the nature of mirror-like pristine wisdom.

original: kun bsdus gong bur sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: kun bsdus gong bur sbyor ba yis //
translated: The verse is: By the yoga of gathering into a whole,

original: zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon yi ge 'bru gsum dang / 'phags pa'i sku gsung thugs dang ; sems can gyi lus ngag yid gsum gyi rang bzhin rnams gcig tu gyur nas bdag lha gang bsgom pa de'i sa bon gyi yi ger gyur par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi sa bon yi ge 'bru gsum dang / 'phags pa'i sku gsung thugs dang ; sems can gyi lus ngag yid gsum gyi rang bzhin rnams gcig tu gyur nas bdag lha gang bsgom pa de'i sa bon gyi yi ger gyur par bsam pa'o //
translated: This means that the three seed syllables of body, speech, and mind taught above, the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the noble ones, and the nature of the body, speech, and mind of sentient beings become one, and you imagine that they become the seed syllable of the deity you are meditating on.

original: de ltar bsgom pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Meditating in this way is the wisdom of equality.

original: gzugs kyi ngo bor rnam par bsgom pa ni yi ge 'od du 'phros @120a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngo bor rnam par bsgom pa ni yi ge 'od du 'phros @120a * //
translated: Meditating on the essence of form is the seed syllable radiating light,

original: shing sems can gyi don thams cad bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa'i dngos por gyur nas thugs dam gyi rgyud bskul nas slar 'dus pa las phyag mtshan du gyur par bsgom mo //
analyzed: shing sems can gyi don thams cad bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa'i dngos por gyur nas thugs dam gyi rgyud bskul nas slar 'dus pa las phyag mtshan du gyur par bsgom mo //
translated: performing all the purposes of sentient beings, becoming the objects of offering to all tathƒÅgatas, invoking their mind streams, and then meditating on it becoming the insignia through the light gathering back.

original: de yang 'phros shing slar 'dus pa las sku phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang 'phros shing slar 'dus pa las sku phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: Furthermore, through radiating and gathering back, it becomes a subtle form.

original: de bzhin du sku phra mor spros shing slar 'dus pa las phyag rgya chen por gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku phra mor spros shing slar 'dus pa las phyag rgya chen por gyur par bsam mo //
translated: In the same way, one should think that the subtle body emanates and reabsorbs, and that it becomes the great seal.

original: de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the discriminating wisdom.

original: sngags kyi sku ni mthar phyin pa //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku ni mthar phyin pa //
translated: The mantra body is perfected.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar cho ga rnams kyis sku bskyed pas mthar phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar cho ga rnams kyis sku bskyed pas mthar phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, because the body is generated by the rites, it is called ‚Äúperfected.‚ÄùüîΩI am the nature of all buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin bdag / ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kun ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin bdag / ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas kun ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams so //
translated: All buddhas are the deities of the ma·πá·∏çala, such as Vairocana, and so on.

original: rang bzhin bdag ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i don to //üîΩphung po khams su rnam bsams te //
analyzed: rang bzhin bdag ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i phung po la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i don to // phung po khams su rnam bsams te //
translated: I am the nature is the meaning of the consecration of the aggregates and so on that will occur below.üîΩThe aggregates and constituents are imagined,

original: skye mched la sogs rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: skye mched la sogs rnam par brgyan //
translated: and the sense bases and so on are arrayed.

original: zhes pa ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du lhar byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de rnams kyi rang bzhin 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du lhar byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The nature of those is consecrated as the deity in the manner that will occur below.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du //
translated: The nature of the aggregate of form

original: rnam par snang mdzad rab tu gnas //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad rab tu gnas //
translated: Vairocana is well-established.

original: zhes pa ni bdag phyag rgyar gyur pa'i gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin la yi ge m'am dam aom bskyed la de las 'od zer phyogs bcur 'phros nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rdul phra rab tsam gyi rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku bkug nas yi ge
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag phyag rgyar gyur pa'i gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin la yi ge m'am dam aom bskyed la de las 'od zer phyogs bcur 'phros nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rdul phra rab tsam gyi rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku bkug nas yi ge
translated: This means that in the nature of the form aggregate, which is one's own deity-form, one generates the syllable ma or the seed syllable o·πÉ. From that, light rays radiate into the ten directions, drawing in the entire world system in the aspect of Vairocana's body, the size of a mere atom.

original: dang gnyis su med par 'gyur zhing rnam par bsam mo //üîΩtshor ba dkon mchog dpal zhes pa ni de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po'i rang bzhin la yi ge aa las rin chen 'byung ldan bskyed pa'o //üîΩ'du shes snang ba mtha' yas zhes pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po yi ge hr'i: las snang ba mtha' yas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dang gnyis su med par 'gyur zhing rnam par bsam mo // tshor ba dkon mchog dpal zhes pa ni de bzhin du tshor ba'i phung po'i rang bzhin la yi ge aa las rin chen 'byung ldan bskyed pa'o // 'du shes snang ba mtha' yas zhes pa ni 'du shes kyi phung po yi ge hr'i: las snang ba mtha' yas bskyed pa'o //
translated: One should imagine that the two become nondual and dissolve into the syllable.üîΩFeeling is Ratnasa·πÉbhava means that in the nature of the aggregate of feeling, one generates Ratnasa·πÉbhava from the syllable a.üîΩPerception is AmitƒÅbha means that in the nature of the aggregate of perception, one generates AmitƒÅbha from the syllable h·πõ.

original: 'du byed thams cad gdon mi za ba zhes pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i rang bzhin yi ge aa las don yod grub pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad gdon mi za ba zhes pa ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i rang bzhin yi ge aa las don yod grub pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Formations are Amoghasiddhi means that in the nature of the aggregate of formations, one meditates on Amoghasiddhi from the syllable a.

original: rnam par shes su mi bskyod gnas //
analyzed: rnam par shes su mi bskyod gnas //
translated: He is not to be moved in consciousness.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin la yi ge h'um las bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin la yi ge h'um las bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: This means that the nature of the aggregate of consciousness is the Bhagavat Ak·π£hobhya, generated from the syllable h≈´·πÉ.

original: mdor na zhes pa ni de rnams bsgom pa'i @120b bye brag gzhan yod na yang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mdor na zhes pa ni de rnams bsgom pa'i @120b bye brag gzhan yod na yang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In brief means that although there are other distinctions in the meditation, this is the meaning.

original: phung po lnga rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five aggregates are form and so on.

original: sangs rgyas lnga ni gong du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga ni gong du bstan pa'o //
translated: The five buddhas are as previously explained.

original: rab tu grags zhes pa ni de ltar bsgom pa 'am gnas par rgyud thams cad kyi nang du bstan zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu grags zhes pa ni de ltar bsgom pa 'am gnas par rgyud thams cad kyi nang du bstan zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Well known means that such a meditation or abiding is taught in all the tantras.

original: aom sva aam ha h'um yi ge 'di rnams las bskyed kyang rung /
analyzed: aom sva aam ha h'um yi ge 'di rnams las bskyed kyang rung /
translated: The meaning is that one should generate from these syllables o·πÉ svƒÅ ƒÅ·πÉ ha·πÉ h≈´·πÉ.

original: sa yi khams ni rnam bsam pa //
analyzed: sa yi khams ni rnam bsam pa //
translated: The earth element is imagined.

original: zhes pa ni bdag phyag rgyar gnas pa'i phyi nang gi brtan pa'i rang bzhin las grub pa spyan ni bsam byas nas zhes bya ste sangs rgyas spyan yi ge lam las bskyed nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag phyag rgyar gnas pa'i phyi nang gi brtan pa'i rang bzhin las grub pa spyan ni bsam byas nas zhes bya ste sangs rgyas spyan yi ge lam las bskyed nas /
translated: This means that having imagined the eye, which is the nature of the inner and outer stable [elements], from the self abiding in the seal, that is, having generated the buddha eye from the syllable la·πÉ,

original: gong ma ltar spro bar byas la sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: gong ma ltar spro bar byas la sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du gnas par bsam mo //
translated: Having expanded in the above manner, one should imagine that one's body is situated in the nature of the earth element.

original: sra ba lta bur byin gyis brlab //
analyzed: sra ba lta bur byin gyis brlab //
translated: One should bless it as hard.

original: ces pa ni gong ma ltar bsgoms pa'i mthus cis kyang mi shigs pa'i lus thob pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni gong ma ltar bsgoms pa'i mthus cis kyang mi shigs pa'i lus thob pa'i don to //
translated: This means that by the power of meditation in the above manner, one obtains a body that is indestructible by anything.

original: chu khams m'a ma k'i gong ma bzhin du yi ge m'am las lha mo m'a ma k'i spro bsdu byas nas khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa gsher ba'i rang bzhin du lus ngag sems la khyab par bsgom mo //
analyzed: chu khams m'a ma k'i gong ma bzhin du yi ge m'am las lha mo m'a ma k'i spro bsdu byas nas khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa gsher ba'i rang bzhin du lus ngag sems la khyab par bsgom mo //
translated: The water element is Mamaki, as above. Having expanded and withdrawn the goddess Mamaki from the syllable Mam, one should meditate on the pervasion of one's body, speech, and mind with the nature of fluidity, such as semen and blood.

original: gang ba nyid brtag ces pa ni khyab pa la yang bya gong ma ltar bsgoms pas yon tan phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
analyzed: gang ba nyid brtag ces pa ni khyab pa la yang bya gong ma ltar bsgoms pas yon tan phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba la bya'o //
translated: Being filled means pervasion. As above, by meditating in this way, one will have an abundance of good qualities.

original: me'i khams la sogs pa ni yi ge bam las lha mo na bza' dkar mo 'phro 'du byas nas /
analyzed: me'i khams la sogs pa ni yi ge bam las lha mo na bza' dkar mo 'phro 'du byas nas /
translated: The fire element and so on are the goddess PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, who is expanded and withdrawn from the syllable Bam.

original: dro ba'i rang bzhin thams cad la thim par bsam mo //
analyzed: dro ba'i rang bzhin thams cad la thim par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that she dissolves into all the natures of heat.

original: de ni 'bar ba lta bu zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms pa'i mthus nyon mongs pa thams cad sreg pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer du 'grub pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni 'bar ba lta bu zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms pa'i mthus nyon mongs pa thams cad sreg pa'i ye shes kyi 'od zer du 'grub pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is like a flame‚Äù means that by the power of such meditation, it is accomplished as the light ray of the pristine awareness that burns all afflictions.

original: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa'i de ni gong ma ltar yi ge t'am las lha mo sgrol ma spro bsdu byas nas /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa'i de ni gong ma ltar yi ge t'am las lha mo sgrol ma spro bsdu byas nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the wind constituent‚Äù and so forth. As above, one emanates and reabsorbs the goddess TƒÅrƒÅ from the syllable ta·πÉ or la·πÉ.

original: g-yo ba'i rang bzhin la khyab cing gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i rang bzhin la khyab cing gnas par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that she pervades and abides in the nature of movement.

original: blo ldan ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: blo ldan ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wise‚Äù are the yogins.

original: de ni rlung lngar 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: de ni rlung lngar 'byung ba ste //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the arising of the five winds.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni lha mo sgrol ma de rlung lnga'i sgo nas sems can gyi don byed pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha mo sgrol ma de rlung lnga'i sgo nas sems can gyi don byed pas so //
translated: This is because the goddess TƒÅrƒÅ performs the welfare of sentient beings by way of the five winds.

original: de yang 'jig rten pa'i rlung dang / mkha' la 'gro ba'i rlung dang / dangs snyigs 'byed pa'i rlung dang / phyi nang du rgyu ba'i rlung dang / srog gi dbang po'i tshul du gnas pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa'i rlung dang / mkha' la 'gro ba'i rlung dang / dangs snyigs 'byed pa'i rlung dang / phyi nang du rgyu ba'i rlung dang / srog gi dbang po'i tshul du gnas pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: Moreover, there are the mundane wind, the wind that moves in space, the wind that separates the pure and impure, the wind that moves in and out, and the wind that abides in the manner of the life faculty.

original: de bzhin yid kyi 'gro ba zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms pas bar snang la 'gro ba'i rdzu 'phrul 'thob pa'i don to //üîΩnam mkha'i @121a * //üîΩkhams kyi rang bzhin kun du bzang mo brtag ces pa ni yi ge h'um las kun du bzang mo spro bsdu byas nas nam mkha'i rang bzhin la khyab par gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin yid kyi 'gro ba zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms pas bar snang la 'gro ba'i rdzu 'phrul 'thob pa'i don to // nam mkha'i @121a * // khams kyi rang bzhin kun du bzang mo brtag ces pa ni yi ge h'um las kun du bzang mo spro bsdu byas nas nam mkha'i rang bzhin la khyab par gnas par bsam mo //
translated: Likewise, ‚Äúthe going of the mind‚Äù means that by such meditation one attains the magical power of going through space.üîΩ‚ÄúThe nature of the realm of space‚Äù means that one should imagine that Samantabhadrƒ´, emanating and withdrawing from the syllable h≈´·πÉ, pervades the nature of space.

original: nam mkha' de yi sbyor bas ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' de yi sbyor bas ni //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the yoga of that space‚Äù means that one should imagine that the yoginƒ´, pervading the nature of space, is the nature of the realm of space.

original: sangs rgyas kyis kyang mi gzigs zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms pa'i mthus mi snang ba'i dngos grub 'thob pas 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyis mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis kyang mi gzigs zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms pa'i mthus mi snang ba'i dngos grub 'thob pas 'jig rten gyi lha rnams kyis mi mthong bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúEven the buddhas do not see her‚Äù means that by the power of such meditation one attains the power of invisibility, and so is not seen by the worldly gods.

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni la dor ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa ni la dor ba'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúBuddhas‚Äù is a particle of dismissal.

original: phung po khams kyi bye brag ni //
analyzed: phung po khams kyi bye brag ni //
translated: ‚ÄúThe particulars of the aggregates and elements‚Äù

original: gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bar gnas //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bar gnas //
translated: ‚Äúabides in the yoga of nonduality‚Äù means that the aggregates and elements are the nature of the five mothers.

original: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po lnga dang / sa la sogs pa'i phung po lnga bdag gi tha mal pa'i tshul ma yin par lha dang gcig tu gyur pas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bar nas zhes bya //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po lnga dang / sa la sogs pa'i phung po lnga bdag gi tha mal pa'i tshul ma yin par lha dang gcig tu gyur pas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor bar nas zhes bya //
translated: This is the five aggregates of form, and the five aggregates of earth, etc. , not in the manner of the ordinary self, but having become one with the deity, so it is called the union of non-duality.

original: de ltar zhes pa gong du de ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa gong du de ltar ro //
translated: Thus, as above, thus.

original: mkhas nyid ni sngags kyi bye brag la mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas nyid ni sngags kyi bye brag la mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The expert is the yogi who is skilled in the particulars of mantra.

original: bsam byas na zhes pa ni bshad pa bzhin du bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsam byas na zhes pa ni bshad pa bzhin du bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: If one thinks, the meaning is that one meditates in accordance with the explanation.

original: de nyid kun du tshim par 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid kun du tshim par 'gyur //
translated: That itself is the universal satisfaction.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar phung po dang khams lha dang lha mo'i rang bzhin du shes pas bsgom pa'i mchog yin pa 'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar phung po dang khams lha dang lha mo'i rang bzhin du shes pas bsgom pa'i mchog yin pa 'am /
translated: This means that by knowing the aggregates and elements in the nature of male and female deities in that way, it is the supreme meditation,

original: lha thams cad dgyes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos grub thams cad thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi mchog yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: lha thams cad dgyes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dngos grub thams cad thob par 'gyur ba'i thabs kyi mchog yin pa'i don to //
translated: or it is the supreme method for attaining all powers because it is the cause of delighting all deities.

original: 'di rnams kyis kyang bskyed pa'i dus su bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis kyang bskyed pa'i dus su bskul bar bya'o //
translated: One should also invoke them at the time of creation.

original: de la mo ha zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad /üîΩra ti ni lha mo lo tsa nas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'i mchod pas dgyes par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de la mo ha zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad / ra ti ni lha mo lo tsa nas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba'i mchod pas dgyes par byed pa'am /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúmoha‚Äù is Bhagavat Vairocana.

original: yang na sems can gti mug gis ldongs pa rnams ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis sel cing dag par byed pas gti mug dga' ba ma'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can gti mug gis ldongs pa rnams ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis sel cing dag par byed pas gti mug dga' ba ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú Rati‚Äù is the worship of the union of non-duality by the goddess Locana, which delights him, or else, it is the delight of delusion, because it removes and purifies the darkness of delusion of sentient beings with the light of wisdom.

original: dve sha ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: dve sha ni bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Dvesa‚Äù is Bhagavat Akshobhya.

original: ra ti ni gong ma dang 'dra bar dgyes par byed pa 'am yang na sems can zhe sdang can gyi zhe sdang spang bar byed cing yang dag pa'i don bstan nas dga' bar byed pas zhe sdang dga' ba ma'o //
analyzed: ra ti ni gong ma dang 'dra bar dgyes par byed pa 'am yang na sems can zhe sdang can gyi zhe sdang spang bar byed cing yang dag pa'i don bstan nas dga' bar byed pas zhe sdang dga' ba ma'o //
translated: ‚Äú Rati‚Äù is the delight of hatred, because it delights by removing the hatred of sentient beings who are full of hatred, or else, it is the delight of hatred, because it delights by teaching the true meaning.

original: r'a ga ni bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: r'a ga ni bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: ‚Äú Rag‚Äù is Bhagavat Amitabha.

original: ra ti ni gong ma dang 'dra bar dgyes par byed pa 'am yang na 'dod chags che ba'i sems can rnams 'dod chags kyi tshul du dag par byed cing thar pa'i lam ston cing dga' bar byed @121b pas 'dod chags dga' bar byed pas 'dod chags dga' ba
analyzed: ra ti ni gong ma dang 'dra bar dgyes par byed pa 'am yang na 'dod chags che ba'i sems can rnams 'dod chags kyi tshul du dag par byed cing thar pa'i lam ston cing dga' bar byed @121b pas 'dod chags dga' bar byed pas 'dod chags dga' ba
translated: Rat√Æ is the same as above, delighting, or else purifying beings of great passion in the manner of passion, teaching the path of liberation and delighting them, thus passion delighting.

original: ma'o // badzra ni bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa'o //
analyzed: ma'o // badzra ni bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa'o //
translated: Vajra is the Bhagavat, the accomplishment of all aims.

original: ra ti ni gong ma dang 'dra bar dgyes par byed pa 'am yang na sems can lta ba log par spyod pa ngan pas spyod pa rnams la rdo rje'i lam ston cing dga' par byed pas rdo rje dga' ba ma'o //
analyzed: ra ti ni gong ma dang 'dra bar dgyes par byed pa 'am yang na sems can lta ba log par spyod pa ngan pas spyod pa rnams la rdo rje'i lam ston cing dga' par byed pas rdo rje dga' ba ma'o //
translated: Rat√Æ is the same as above, delighting, or else teaching the vajra path to beings who practice evil conduct through the practice of false views, thus vajra delighting.

original: mig dang rna ba sna dang lce //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna dang lce //
translated: Eye, ear, nose, tongue,

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' drug mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug la gong ma'i tshul du bsgom par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' drug mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug la gong ma'i tshul du bsgom par bya ba'i don to //
translated: and so on means that the six bodhisattvas, Kshitigarbha and so on, should be meditated upon in the manner of the above, in the six sense organs, eye and so on.

original: de yang thlhim de yang las sa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: de yang thlhim de yang las sa'i snying po'o //
translated: The om is the essence of Kshitigarbha.

original: aom las phyag na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: aom las phyag na rdo rje'o //
translated: The om is Vajrapani.

original: aom gnyis pa las nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: aom gnyis pa las nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: The second om is Akashagarbha.

original: aom gsum pa las spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: aom gsum pa las spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The third om is Avalokitesvara.

original: ha las sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
analyzed: ha las sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'o //
translated: The ha is Sarvanivarana Viskambini.

original: aom tha ma las kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: aom tha ma las kun du bzang po'o //
translated: The last om is Manjusri.

original: nang gi skye mched rnams su ni //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched rnams su ni //
translated: In the inner sense-fields,

original: sa yi snying po la sogs gnas //
analyzed: sa yi snying po la sogs gnas //
translated: the Bodhisattvas Kshitigarbha and so forth abide.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms pas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms pas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i don to //
translated: This means that by meditating in this way, the nature of the sense-fields such as the eyes and so forth, and the nature of the Bodhisattvas Kshitigarbha and so forth, are non-dual.

original: phyi yi skye mched rang bzhin du //
analyzed: phyi yi skye mched rang bzhin du //
translated: The nature of the outer sense-fields

original: gzugs la sogs pa rab tu gnas //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rab tu gnas //
translated: is fully present as form and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni dbang po drug gi yul gzugs la sogs pa drug la gzugs kyi lha mo la sogs pa drug bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dbang po drug gi yul gzugs la sogs pa drug la gzugs kyi lha mo la sogs pa drug bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that one should meditate on the six goddesses of form and so forth in the six objects of form and so forth of the six sense-powers.

original: de yang gzugs kyi skye mched la yi ge dza'i bskyed nas 'phro 'du byas pa las rdo rje gzugs kyi lha mor gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: de yang gzugs kyi skye mched la yi ge dza'i bskyed nas 'phro 'du byas pa las rdo rje gzugs kyi lha mor gnas par bsam mo //
translated: Furthermore, having generated the letter jra from the form sense-sphere, one should imagine that it radiates and reabsorbs, and that it becomes the Vajra Form Goddess.

original: de bzhin du sgra'i skye mched la h'um las rdo rje sgra'i lha mor bsam mo //üîΩdri'i skye mched la yi ge bam las rdo rje dri'i lha mo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra'i skye mched la h'um las rdo rje sgra'i lha mor bsam mo // dri'i skye mched la yi ge bam las rdo rje dri'i lha mo'o //
translated: Similarly, one should imagine that the sound sense-sphere becomes the Vajra Sound Goddess from the letter h≈´·πÉ.üîΩThe smell sense-sphere becomes the Vajra Smell Goddess from the letter va·πÉ.

original: ro'i skye mched la yi ge ho las rdo rje ro'i lha mor bsam mo //üîΩreg bya'i skye mched la yi ge kham las rdo rje reg bya'i lha mo'o //
analyzed: ro'i skye mched la yi ge ho las rdo rje ro'i lha mor bsam mo // reg bya'i skye mched la yi ge kham las rdo rje reg bya'i lha mo'o //
translated: The taste sense-sphere becomes the Vajra Taste Goddess from the letter ho·∏•.üîΩThe touch sense-sphere becomes the Vajra Touch Goddess from the letter kha·πÉ.

original: chos kyi skye mched la yi ge ram las chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma bskyed par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched la yi ge ram las chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma bskyed par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The dharma sense-sphere becomes the Vajra Realm Goddess from the letter ra·πÉ.

original: sa'i snying la sogs sngags rnams ni //
analyzed: sa'i snying la sogs sngags rnams ni //
translated: The mantras of K·π£itigarbha and so on

original: rdo rje can gyi rgyud las gsungs //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi rgyud las gsungs //
translated: are taught in the tantra of Vajradhara.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' drug gi bskyed pa'i sa bon yin 'bru rnams ston pas rgyud las bstan pas slob dpon gyis 'dri yang bris zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' drug gi bskyed pa'i sa bon yin 'bru rnams ston pas rgyud las bstan pas slob dpon gyis 'dri yang bris zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the seed syllable of the six bodhisattvas, taught in the tantra, so the master should write it.

original: 'di dag sngags ni ma gsungs phyir //
analyzed: 'di dag sngags ni ma gsungs phyir //
translated: Since the mantras are not taught,

original: gzugs @122a * //
analyzed: gzugs @122a * //
translated: the forms and so on are not written.

original: la sogs pa ma bris zhes pa ni gzugs kyi lha mo la sogs pa bskyed pa'i sa bon yig 'bru rnams rgyud nang du gsal por ma bstan pas 'dir yang ma bris zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: la sogs pa ma bris zhes pa ni gzugs kyi lha mo la sogs pa bskyed pa'i sa bon yig 'bru rnams rgyud nang du gsal por ma bstan pas 'dir yang ma bris zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that since the seed syllables that generate the goddesses of form and so on are not clearly taught in the tantra, they are not written here.

original: phyi yi longs spyod kyis mchod phyir //
analyzed: phyi yi longs spyod kyis mchod phyir //
translated: In order to worship with outer enjoyments,

original: gzugs sgra dag tu rab tu gnas //
analyzed: gzugs sgra dag tu rab tu gnas //
translated: they are well established in form and sound.

original: zhes pa ni phyi'i longs spyod gzugs la sogs pa lnga rnal 'byor pas mi spang zhing dang du len pa'i phyir dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i che ba'i yon tan khyad par las lha mo'i tshul du de dag la gnas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi'i longs spyod gzugs la sogs pa lnga rnal 'byor pas mi spang zhing dang du len pa'i phyir dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i che ba'i yon tan khyad par las lha mo'i tshul du de dag la gnas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that since the five outer enjoyments of form and so on are not to be abandoned by the yogin, they are established in those as goddesses by the special qualities of the greatness of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: byin gyi rlabs kyis byin brlabs nas //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs kyis byin brlabs nas //
translated: Having blessed with consecration,

original: zhes pa ni de ltar na kun rdzob tu nang gi skye mched dang phyi'i skye mched lha dang lha mor shes pa dang / don dam par rang bzhin gcig par shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar na kun rdzob tu nang gi skye mched dang phyi'i skye mched lha dang lha mor shes pa dang / don dam par rang bzhin gcig par shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the inner and outer sense-fields are known as gods and goddesses on the relative level, and as of one nature on the ultimate level.

original: 'dod pa lnga spyod ces pa ni de lta bas na gzugs la sogs pa smad cing mi spang bar spyad pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga spyod ces pa ni de lta bas na gzugs la sogs pa smad cing mi spang bar spyad pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the line ‚Äúenjoying the five objects of desire‚Äù is that one should not despise or reject form, etc., but should enjoy them.

original: gzugs ni mig gi yul du gnas //
analyzed: gzugs ni mig gi yul du gnas //
translated: Form is present as the object of the eye.

original: zhes pa ni de yang ji ltar spyod chen /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de yang ji ltar spyod chen /
translated: This is also the way of the great enjoyment.

original: phyi'i tha mal pa'i tshul du mig gi longs spyod kyi yul gzugs yin pa dang nang gi ni mig sa'i snying po'o //

original: zhes pa ni khro bo bdud rtsi 'khyil pas sems can thams cad 'khor ba las 'don cing mya @122b dan las 'das ba'i bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dang / rdo rje yang byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin bdud rtsi 'phro zhing 'khyil pa'i don gyis so //

original: sngags 'di rnams kyis bskul zhing bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di rnams kyis bskul zhing bskyed pa'o //

analyzed: de la ya ma ni sems can thams cad kyi srog gi dbang po dgag pa'o //

analyzed: yang na ya ma ris su gtogs pa'i srin po lha dang mi la gnod pa byed pa rnams 'dul zhing byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, yama means to subdue the rƒÅk·π£asas who belong to Yama and who harm gods and humans, and to cause them to generate the mind of awakening.

original: yang na yam ni shar phyogs so //
analyzed: yang na yam ni shar phyogs so //

original: aanta krita ni de'i phyogs kyi bdud dang bgegs rnams tshar gcod cing sgo srung gi tshul du gnas pa'i don to //

analyzed: aanta krita ni khro bo 'dis de ltar blta pa'i sems can rnams la rnam par thar pa'i sgo bstan nas gnyis su med pa'i lta ba la gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: Antak·πõta means having destroyed that view, and it means that he causes sentient beings who view things in that way to abide in the view of nonduality by teaching them the door of liberation.

analyzed: yang na pra dzny'a zhes pa ni shin tu yang nga rgyal che ba'i ru tra rnams so //
translated: Alternatively, praj√±ƒÅ means the very proud Rudras,

original: aantra kri ta ni de btul zhin byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: aantra kri ta ni de btul zhin byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: and antak·πõta means having subdued them and caused them to generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: yang bradznya ni lho phyogs la bya /
analyzed: yang bradznya ni lho phyogs la bya /
translated: Alternatively, praj√±ƒÅ means the south,

original: aanta krita ni de'i phyogs kyi bdud dang bgegs rnams tar gcod cing sgo srung gi tshul du gnas pa'o ;
analyzed: aanta krita ni de'i phyogs kyi bdud dang bgegs rnams tar gcod cing sgo srung gi tshul du gnas pa'o ;
translated: and antak·πõta means having destroyed the demons and obstructors in that direction, and it means that he abides in the manner of a doorkeeper.

original: / padma ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: / padma ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Padma means desire.

original: aanta krita ni khro bo 'dis sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i 'dod chags las thar par byed cing bde ba chen po'i tshul du ston pa'o //
analyzed: aanta krita ni khro bo 'dis sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i 'dod chags las thar par byed cing bde ba chen po'i tshul du ston pa'o //
translated: Antak·πõta means angry, and this [mantra] liberates all sentient beings from the desire of cyclic existence and shows the way of great bliss.

original: yang na padma ni padma'i rigs su gtogs pa'i srin po mgrin bcu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na padma ni padma'i rigs su gtogs pa'i srin po mgrin bcu la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Alternatively, lotus refers to the rƒÅk·π£asas belonging to the lotus family, such as the ten-necked one, and so on.

original: aanta krita ni de rnams btul zhing byang chub kyi lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: aanta krita ni de rnams btul zhing byang chub kyi lam bstan pa'o //
translated: Antak·πõta means tamed and taught the path of enlightenment to them.

original: yang na padma ni nub phyogs la bya /
analyzed: yang na padma ni nub phyogs la bya /
translated: Alternatively, lotus refers to the west, and

original: aatna krita ni gong ma dang 'dra /
analyzed: aatna krita ni gong ma dang 'dra /
translated: Antak·πõta is as above.

original: bighnan ni sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems thob par byed pa la gegs byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bighnan ni sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi sems thob par byed pa la gegs byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Vighna means obstructing, and refers to the afflictions that obstruct the attainment of unsurpassed bodhicitta by all sentient beings.

original: aanta krita ni khro bo 'dis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang sbyor zhing 'dul ba'i thabs ston cing tshar gcod par byed pas so //
analyzed: aanta krita ni khro bo 'dis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang sbyor zhing 'dul ba'i thabs ston cing tshar gcod par byed pas so //
translated: Antak·πõta means angry, and this [mantra] shows the method of subduing and taming the minds of all sentient beings and eradicates them.

original: yang na bighr'an ni dge ba rnams la bar chad byed pa'i bgegs kyi rgyal po bin ya ka'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na bighr'an ni dge ba rnams la bar chad byed pa'i bgegs kyi rgyal po bin ya ka'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: Or, the Vighnas are the kings of the Vighnas, the Vinayakas, who create obstacles to virtue.

original: aanta krita ni de rnams btul zhing byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: aanta krita ni de rnams btul zhing byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: Antakrt is their subjugation and the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: @123a * // yang na bighn'an ni byang phyogs la bya /
analyzed: @123a * // yang na bighn'an ni byang phyogs la bya /
translated: Or, the Vighnas are the northern direction,

original: aanta krita ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: aanta krita ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: and Antakrt is as above.

original: de ltar don kun rab bzhugs pa //
analyzed: de ltar don kun rab bzhugs pa //
translated: Thus, all things well-placed,

original: zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: this is the knowledge of purposeful action.

original: de ltar ni gong du bstan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de ltar ni gong du bstan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Thus is in the manner taught above.

original: don kun ni lha dang lha mo'i rnams so //
analyzed: don kun ni lha dang lha mo'i rnams so //
translated: All things are the gods and goddesses.

original: rab zhugs pa zhes pa ni bdag gi phung po dang khams dang dang skye mched la sogs pa lha de rnams dang gnyis su med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab zhugs pa zhes pa ni bdag gi phung po dang khams dang dang skye mched la sogs pa lha de rnams dang gnyis su med par byed pa'o //
translated: Well-placed means that one's aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, etc. are made nondual with those gods.

original: sang rgyas kun bdag gtso bor ni //
analyzed: sang rgyas kun bdag gtso bor ni //
translated: The Lord of all the Buddhas,

original: bskyed nas byin gyis brlab ces pa ni de ltar ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum gyis bdag dpal rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams can gyi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i phyag rgya chen por bsgoms pas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bskyed nas byin gyis brlab ces pa ni de ltar ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gsum gyis bdag dpal rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams can gyi bdag nyid du gyur ba'i phyag rgya chen por bsgoms pas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Having generated, one should consecrate means that by meditating on the great seal of oneself as glorious Vajrasattva, the nature of all Ones-Thus Gone, by means of the three aspects of meditative concentration, one should consecrate oneself as the great seal of Vajrasattva.

original: byin gyis brlab ces pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab ces pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du sku gsung thugs su byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Consecrate means to consecrate oneself as body, speech, and mind, in the manner to be explained below.

original: de yang tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas byin gyis brlab pa dang sngags kyi sgo nas so //üîΩtshigs su bcad pas gsol ba gdab //
analyzed: de yang tshigs su bcad pa'i sgo nas byin gyis brlab pa dang sngags kyi sgo nas so // tshigs su bcad pas gsol ba gdab //
translated: Moreover, there is consecration by means of verses, and by means of mantras.

original: ces pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis rigs nges pa'i sangs rgyas la gsol ba gdab pa dang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas la'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis rigs nges pa'i sangs rgyas la gsol ba gdab pa dang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas la'o //
translated: One should supplicate with verses means that one should supplicate the Buddhas who have ascertained the lineages, and the Buddhas of the ten directions, with the two verses to be explained below.

original: spyi bo dbus 'gyur bsam zhes pa ni gsol ba btab pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: spyi bo dbus 'gyur bsam zhes pa ni gsol ba btab pa'i thabs bstan pa'o //
translated: One should imagine the transformation in the middle of the crown means that one should explain the method of supplication.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gang zhes pas ni bdag phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i spyi bor aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa gcig bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gang zhes pas ni bdag phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i spyi bor aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rdzogs pa gcig bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe moon disk‚Äù means that one should generate a complete moon disk from the letter A above one‚Äôs head, where one is abiding as the great seal.

original: der ni aom dkar 'od ldan pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi phyag rgya zla ba phyed pa'i 'od las lhag pa'i yi ge aom dkar po gcig bsgom mo //
analyzed: der ni aom dkar 'od ldan pa ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i rang bzhin gyi phyag rgya zla ba phyed pa'i 'od las lhag pa'i yi ge aom dkar po gcig bsgom mo //
translated: ‚Äú There, the white O·πÇ, endowed with light‚Äù means that one should meditate on a white letter O·πÇ, which is the seal of the nature of the body of all tathƒÅgatas, on the moon disk, which is superior to the light of the half moon.

original: 'od zer rnam pa lnga 'phro ba ni de las ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer dkar po la sogs pa lnga phyogs kun du 'phro ba'o //üîΩde las lha mo rnams 'phro ba //
analyzed: 'od zer rnam pa lnga 'phro ba ni de las ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer dkar po la sogs pa lnga phyogs kun du 'phro ba'o // de las lha mo rnams 'phro ba //
translated: ‚Äú Radiating five-colored light rays‚Äù means that from that [O·πÇ] five light rays of the nature of the five gnoses radiate in all directions.

original: zhes pa ni 'od zer des sems can gyi don bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi thugs dam bskul nas slar 'dus pa las rnam par snang mdzad yab yum du gyur pas bsams nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'od zer des sems can gyi don bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi thugs dam bskul nas slar 'dus pa las rnam par snang mdzad yab yum du gyur pas bsams nas /
translated: ‚Äú From that, the goddesses radiate‚Äù means that after the light rays perform the welfare of sentient beings and arouse the spiritual practice of the buddhas, they reabsorb and become Vairocana and his consort.

original: de gnyis kyi bde ba chen po'i tshul yi ge lam du gyur nas lha mo sangs rgyas spyan 'phro ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi bde ba chen po'i tshul yi ge lam du gyur nas lha mo sangs rgyas spyan 'phro ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the emanation of the goddess BuddhalocanƒÅ is that the method of the great bliss of those two becomes the path of the letter.

original: bdag por rab tu sbyar zhes pa ni bdag po ni rnam par snang mdzad @123b do ;
analyzed: bdag por rab tu sbyar zhes pa ni bdag po ni rnam par snang mdzad @123b do ;
translated: ‚ÄúApplied to the lord‚Äù means that the lord is Vairocana.

original: / rab tu sbyar ba ni dbang bskur ba'i tshul du lha mo de'i spyi bor bsam pa 'am gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bsam mo //
analyzed: / rab tu sbyar ba ni dbang bskur ba'i tshul du lha mo de'i spyi bor bsam pa 'am gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bsam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúApplied‚Äù means that one should imagine the goddess on the crown of the lord, or one should imagine the nondual union.

original: spyan ni rnam par bsam bya ba //
analyzed: spyan ni rnam par bsam bya ba //
translated: One should imagine the eyes.

original: nam mkha'i khams kun gang bar zhes pa ni de ltar lha mor bsgom zhing 'phro ba yang nam mkha'i khams thams cad du til gyi gong bu bzhin du sems kyis lcogs tang spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams kun gang bar zhes pa ni de ltar lha mor bsgom zhing 'phro ba yang nam mkha'i khams thams cad du til gyi gong bu bzhin du sems kyis lcogs tang spro bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFilling all the realm of space‚Äù means that one should imagine the goddess in that way, and also emanate her filling all the realm of space, like a full sesame pod, with the mind.

original: rdo rje sku ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yab yum mo //
analyzed: rdo rje sku ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yab yum mo //
translated: The vajra body is the BhagavƒÅn Vairocana, the father and mother.

original: rnam par bsam pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi spro ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par bsam pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi spro ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúImagined‚Äù means the emanations of the BhagavƒÅn.

original: bar snang khams ni gang bar gnas //
analyzed: bar snang khams ni gang bar gnas //
translated: They abide filling the realm of space.

original: zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa bzhin du nam mkha' thams cad khyab par gnas pa rnams mngon sum du bsam pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du bstan pa bzhin du nam mkha' thams cad khyab par gnas pa rnams mngon sum du bsam pa'i don to //
translated: This means that one should imagine that they are present, pervading all space, as explained above.

original: de dbus bdag por bsam bya zhing //
analyzed: de dbus bdag por bsam bya zhing //
translated: One should imagine that in the middle of them is the Lord,

original: bdag gi mdun du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mdun du gnas pa'o //

original: zhes pa ni bar snang khams khyab par gnas pa'i sangs rgyas yab yum thams cad kyi dbus su dang por bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yab yum bdag rnal 'byor pa'i mdun na bzhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bar snang khams khyab par gnas pa'i sangs rgyas yab yum thams cad kyi dbus su dang por bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yab yum bdag rnal 'byor pa'i mdun na bzhugs par bsam mo //
translated: This means that one should imagine that in the middle of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, pervading space, is the Bhagavat Vairocana, the first created Buddha, present in front of the yogin.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang ba //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang ba //
translated: Bearing the thirty-two marks,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad bcus brgyan //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad bcus brgyan //
translated: adorned with the eighty minor marks,

original: zhes pa ni bar snang khyab par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas de rnams kyang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / gzhan yang sku'i rgyan thams cad dang ldan par bsam zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bar snang khyab par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas de rnams kyang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / gzhan yang sku'i rgyan thams cad dang ldan par bsam zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that one should imagine that those Buddhas, pervading space, have the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks, and are also endowed with all the ornaments of a Buddha-body.

original: sngags pa ni phyag rgya chen por gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: sngags pa ni phyag rgya chen por gnas pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The mantra practitioner is the yogi who abides in the great seal.

original: bcol ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis sku'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab pa zhu ba'o //
analyzed: bcol ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis sku'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab pa zhu ba'o //
translated: The request is the supplication for the consecration as the nature of the body with the two verses that will occur below.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gnyis brjod pa ni tshigs bcad sku gsung thugs gsum ka la gnyis gnyis yod pas rim pa bzhin du re re la yang gsum gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gnyis brjod pa ni tshigs bcad sku gsung thugs gsum ka la gnyis gnyis yod pas rim pa bzhin du re re la yang gsum gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The recitation of two verses each is because each of the three, body, speech, and mind, has two, so each should be recited three times in order.

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas sku 'chang ba //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas sku 'chang ba //
translated: The glorious one who holds the body of the Buddha

original: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sku'i rigs su nges pa'i sangs rgyas la gsol pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pas ni sku'i rigs su nges pa'i sangs rgyas la gsol pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: and so forth supplicates the Buddha who is ascertained as the family of the body.

original: de la dpal ldan ni gong du bshad pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: de la dpal ldan ni gong du bshad pa dang mthun no //
translated: Therein, the glorious one is in accordance with the explanation above.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku 'chang ba ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sku'i khyad par du bstan zhing gnas pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku 'chang ba ni phyogs bcu dus gsum gyi sku'i khyad par du bstan zhing gnas pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The one who holds the body of the Buddha is the BhagavƒÅn Vairocana who is taught as the special body of the ten directions and three times and abides.

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pas //
translated: By meditating on the indivisible three vajrasüîΩand so forth supplicates the family of speech.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das de yang @124a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das de yang @124a * //
translated: This is the Blessed One,

original: gang gis kyang dbye bar mi nus pa'am 'joms par mi nus pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa 'am de nyid las mi g-yo ba'i thugs dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis kyang dbye bar mi nus pa'am 'joms par mi nus pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa 'am de nyid las mi g-yo ba'i thugs dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: who has a nature of body, speech, and mind that cannot be divided or destroyed by anyone, or who has a mind that does not move from that nature.

original: deng bdag byin gyis brlabs nas su //
analyzed: deng bdag byin gyis brlabs nas su //
translated: Bless me today

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das khyod bdag kyang sku gsung thugs sgom pa yin pas yab yum gyi thugs kyi rang bzhin byang chub sems su dus 'di nyid du byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das khyod bdag kyang sku gsung thugs sgom pa yin pas yab yum gyi thugs kyi rang bzhin byang chub sems su dus 'di nyid du byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This Blessed One, you, are also the meditation on body, speech, and mind. Therefore, bless me today with the nature of the mind of the father and mother, the bodhicitta.

original: rdo rje skus ni mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: rdo rje skus ni mdzad du gsol //
translated: With the vajra body, please do!

original: zhes pa ni de ltar byin gyis brlabs te khyed dang 'dra bar bdag gi lus kyang rdo rje'i skur mdzod cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar byin gyis brlabs te khyed dang 'dra bar bdag gi lus kyang rdo rje'i skur mdzod cig pa'i don to //
translated: Having been blessed in this way, make my body like yours, a vajra body.

original: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa 'dir phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la so so'i sku 'dra bar bdag gi lus kyang mdzod cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa 'dir phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la so so'i sku 'dra bar bdag gi lus kyang mdzod cig pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of all buddhas dwelling in the ten directions and so forth is that all buddhas dwelling in the ten directions should also make my body like their bodies.

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The meaning of meditating on the three indestructible vajras and so forth is the same as above.

original: de ltar gsol ba btab nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang po bskyed pa la sogs pa lha mo sangs rgyas spyan dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba'i phyag rgya dang ldan par rgyun mi 'chad par slar byon cing bdag gi spyi bo'i bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: de ltar gsol ba btab nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang po bskyed pa la sogs pa lha mo sangs rgyas spyan dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba'i phyag rgya dang ldan par rgyun mi 'chad par slar byon cing bdag gi spyi bo'i bcom ldan 'das
translated: Having thus supplicated, the BhagavƒÅn Vairocana, generated first and so forth, endowed with the consort who is united with BuddhalocanƒÅ in nondual union, should return uninterruptedly and dissolve into the BhagavƒÅn on my crown.

original: yab yum la thim par bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yab yum la thim par bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on the father and mother dissolving into the BhagavƒÅn on one's crown.

original: de ni zhugs par mos byas la //
analyzed: de ni zhugs par mos byas la //
translated: Then, having imagined that the BhagavƒÅn has entered,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni spyi bor bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das yab yum de yang bdag gi spyi bor thim zhing gnyis su med par gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni spyi bor bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das yab yum de yang bdag gi spyi bor thim zhing gnyis su med par gyur te /
translated: and so forth means that the BhagavƒÅn father and mother who are dwelling on one's crown should also dissolve into one's crown and become nondual.

original: phung po lnga la khyab par byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga la khyab par byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate the five aggregates with the pervasion.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku ni gang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku ni gang //
translated: What is the body of the Buddhas?

original: phung po lnga la rab tu gnas //
analyzed: phung po lnga la rab tu gnas //

original: zhes pa de ltar gsol ba btab cing byin gyis rlabs pas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i rang bzhin gang yin pa bdag gi phung po lnga la gnas par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de ltar gsol ba btab cing byin gyis rlabs pas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i rang bzhin gang yin pa bdag gi phung po lnga la gnas par bsam pa'o //
translated: Thus, by supplicating and consecrating in that way, one should imagine that the nature of the body of the Buddhas of the ten directions, such as BhagavƒÅn Vairocana, is present in one's five aggregates.üîΩOne should say, May I also be like that,

original: sangs rgyas sku yi rang bzhin du //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku yi rang bzhin du //
translated: the nature of the body of the Buddhas.

original: bdag kyang de dang 'dra bar shog / ces pa ni de ltar gnas pas sangs rgyas kyi sku rdo rje lta bur bdag gi lus kyang de dang 'dra ba kyur cig ces tshig tu brjod cing smon pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag kyang de dang 'dra bar shog / ces pa ni de ltar gnas pas sangs rgyas kyi sku rdo rje lta bur bdag gi lus kyang de dang 'dra ba kyur cig ces tshig tu brjod cing smon pa'i don to //
translated: By being present in that way, one's body is like the vajra body of the Buddhas. One should say the words, May I also be like that, and aspire to that meaning.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a wa aa'tma ko& ham @124b zhes pa ni bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kye sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin no zhes bsgom zhing /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya badzra sva bh'a wa aa'tma ko& ham @124b zhes pa ni bdag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kye sku rdo rje'i rang bzhin no zhes bsgom zhing /
translated: O·πÉ sarva tathƒÅgata kƒÅya vajra svabhƒÅva ƒÅtmako 'ham

original: sngags 'di lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //üîΩde bzhin lce dbus padma la //
analyzed: sngags 'di lan gsum du brjod par bya'o // de bzhin lce dbus padma la //
translated: means I am the nature of all tathƒÅgatas' vajra body, and one should meditate on this and recite this mantra three times.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni de ltar sku'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni de ltar sku'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs par bstan to //
translated: As for in the middle of the tongue, a lotus, and so on, having thus consecrated oneself as the nature of the body, it teaches the consecration as the nature of the speech of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: lce dbus padma la zhes pa ni bdag phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i lce'i dkyil du yi ge bam las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bskyed la aom las rdo rje 'dod chags shes byas te /
analyzed: lce dbus padma la zhes pa ni bdag phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i lce'i dkyil du yi ge bam las padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bskyed la aom las rdo rje 'dod chags shes byas te /
translated: As for in the middle of the tongue, a lotus, one should generate an eight-petaled lotus from va·πÉ in the middle of the tongue of oneself abiding in the great seal, and one should generate a vajra from o·πÉ and know it as Vajra Passion.

original: de'i steng du yi ge aa bskyed la gong ma bzhin du spro bsdu byas la bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas dang / lha mo na bza' dkar mo yab yum gnyid su med par gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge aa bskyed la gong ma bzhin du spro bsdu byas la bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas dang / lha mo na bza' dkar mo yab yum gnyid su med par gyur par bsam mo //
translated: On top of that, one should generate the letter A, and perform the emanation and re-absorption as above, and think that Bhagavat Amitabha and the Goddess PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´ become non-dual.

original: de las bar snang khyab pa dang spro bsdu bya ba la sogs pa gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de las bar snang khyab pa dang spro bsdu bya ba la sogs pa gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: From that, one should pervade the space, and perform the emanation and re-absorption, and so forth, as above.

original: rab zhugs de la gsol btab cing //
analyzed: rab zhugs de la gsol btab cing //
translated: Having entered, one should supplicate,

original: rdo rje dag tu byin gyis brlab pa ni bar snang khyab par bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnams la 'og gi tshigs bcad gnyis kyis bdag gi tshig de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab par bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dag tu byin gyis brlab pa ni bar snang khyab par bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das rnams la 'og gi tshigs bcad gnyis kyis bdag gi tshig de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab par bya zhes bya'o //
translated: and bless the vajra. One should bless one‚Äôs speech as the nature of the speech of all the TathƒÅgatas with the two verses below, to the Bhagavats who dwell pervading the space.

original: chos kyi dag lam dpal ldan pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dag lam dpal ldan pa //
translated: The glorious path of Dharma

original: zhes pa'i tshigs bcad kyis gsung gi rigs nges pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la gsol ba btab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs bcad kyis gsung gi rigs nges pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la gsol ba btab pa'o //
translated: With this verse, one should supplicate the Buddhas who are ascertained as the speech family.

original: de la chos kyi ngag lam ni chos thams cad tshig gis bstan pa yin la de'i rang bzhin du gnas pa bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: de la chos kyi ngag lam ni chos thams cad tshig gis bstan pa yin la de'i rang bzhin du gnas pa bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The path of the Dharma speech is the teaching of all Dharmas with words, and the nature of that is the Bhagavat Amitabha.

original: dpal ldan yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: dpal ldan yang de nyid yin no //
translated: The glorious one is also that very [Amitabha].

original: rdo rje gsung gis mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: rdo rje gsung gis mdzad du gsol //
translated: Please do so with the vajra speech!

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsung khyod kyis bdag gi tshig rnams nyid kyi gsung bzhin du mdzod cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsung khyod kyis bdag gi tshig rnams nyid kyi gsung bzhin du mdzod cig pa'i don to //
translated: This means, please make my words just like your speech, O Vajra Speech.

original: phyi ma rnams gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phyi ma rnams gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The later [lines] are similar to the earlier.

original: lce ni 'phro bar rnam bsam ste //
analyzed: lce ni 'phro bar rnam bsam ste //
translated: Thinking of the tongue as emanating,

original: zhes pa ni de ltar gsol ba btab nas lce la bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas las 'od zer spros shing bskul bas slar byon cing lce la thim par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar gsol ba btab nas lce la bskyed pa'i sangs rgyas las 'od zer spros shing bskul bas slar byon cing lce la thim par bya'o //
translated: This means, having made such a request, light rays emanate from the buddhas generated on the tongue and invoke [Amitabha], who returns and dissolves into the tongue.

original: rang ngag chos rnams kun gyi gnas //
analyzed: rang ngag chos rnams kun gyi gnas //
translated: My speech is the abode of all Dharmas.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar thim pas rang gi tshig 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi ta bu ni //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar thim pas rang gi tshig 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi ta bu ni //
translated: This means, by dissolving in that way, my speech is the abode of all mundane and supramundane Dharmas.

original: nga rgyal bskyed na / gsung dbyangs thams cad rnam par dag pa ni de @125a * //
analyzed: nga rgyal bskyed na / gsung dbyangs thams cad rnam par dag pa ni de @125a * //
translated: All melodious speech is pure.

original: ltar bsgoms pa'i lce las ngag 'byung ba thams cad tshig dang don du ldan zhing 'khyal pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ltar bsgoms pa'i lce las ngag 'byung ba thams cad tshig dang don du ldan zhing 'khyal pa med pa'o //
translated: All speech that comes from the tongue that you have meditated on is endowed with words and meaning and is not frivolous.

original: chos kyi ngag tu byin gyis brlab pa ni bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas kyi gsung yin par bsam pa'o //üîΩrdo rje chos kyi gsung rnams ni //
analyzed: chos kyi ngag tu byin gyis brlab pa ni bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas kyi gsung yin par bsam pa'o // rdo rje chos kyi gsung rnams ni //
translated: The consecration of speech as the Dharma is to think that it is the speech of the Bhagavat Amitabha.üîΩThe speech of Vajradharma

original: des pa'i tshig ni phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: des pa'i tshig ni phun sum tshogs //
translated: is endowed with the words of the Sage.

original: zhes pa ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: This is just as the Bhagavat Amitabha is.

original: gsung 'khyal pa med cing don dang ldan pa de bzhin du bdag gi tshig rnams kyang gyur cig ces brjod cing smon par bya'o //
analyzed: gsung 'khyal pa med cing don dang ldan pa de bzhin du bdag gi tshig rnams kyang gyur cig ces brjod cing smon par bya'o //
translated: Just as his speech is not frivolous and is endowed with meaning, may my words also be like that.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta b'ak badzra svabh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta b'ak badzra svabh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Om. All tathagatas' vajra speech is my nature.

original: zhes pa'i sngags 'dis bdag gi tshig de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rang bzhin du bsgom zhing lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags 'dis bdag gi tshig de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi rang bzhin du bsgom zhing lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //
translated: With this mantra, one should meditate on one's own speech as having the nature of the speech of all the Ones-Gone-Thus, and one should repeat it three times.

original: de ltar sku gsung byin gyis brlab par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sku gsung byin gyis brlab par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the consecration of body and speech,

original: thugs byin gyis brlab par bstan to //üîΩsnying ga'i zla ba la dmigs pa la sogs pas ni de la bdag phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i snying la aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed nas de'i steng du h'um las rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum sku mdog mthing nag tu 'dug pa ye shes lnga'i
analyzed: thugs byin gyis brlab par bstan to // snying ga'i zla ba la dmigs pa la sogs pas ni de la bdag phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i snying la aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed nas de'i steng du h'um las rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum sku mdog mthing nag tu 'dug pa ye shes lnga'i
translated: he teaches the consecration of mind.

original: 'od zer 'phro ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer 'phro ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: By means of focusing on the moon at the heart and so forth, one should generate oneself as the Great Seal, and then generate a moon mandala from a in one's heart.  On top of that, from h≈´·πÉ, one should generate blue Vajrasattva in union with consort, radiating five-colored light rays of exalted wisdom.

original: sngar smos pa yi rim pa bzhin //
analyzed: sngar smos pa yi rim pa bzhin //
translated: As previously mentioned,

original: rdo rje sems la gsol btab nas //
analyzed: rdo rje sems la gsol btab nas //
translated: having supplicated Vajrasattva,

original: zhes pa ni gong du sku dang gsung gi skabs su spro ba la sogs pa byas pa bzhin 'dir yang byas nas gsol ba btab pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du sku dang gsung gi skabs su spro ba la sogs pa byas pa bzhin 'dir yang byas nas gsol ba btab pa'i don to //

original: de ni zhugs par bsgom byas te //
analyzed: de ni zhugs par bsgom byas te //
translated: One should meditate on the descent of the consecration,

original: sems ni byin gyis brlab par bya //
analyzed: sems ni byin gyis brlab par bya //

original: zhes pas ni de ltar gsol ba btab cing snying ga nas spros shing bskul bas bar snang khyab par gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum slar byon cing snying la thim par bsgoms nas rang gi sems i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs 'o
analyzed: zhes pas ni de ltar gsol ba btab cing snying ga nas spros shing bskul bas bar snang khyab par gnas pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' yab yum slar byon cing snying la thim par bsgoms nas rang gi sems i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs 'o
translated: Thus, having made supplications, and having emanated from the heart and urged the Vajrasattva couples who dwell pervading the space to return and dissolve into the heart, one should meditate on one's mind as the nature of the Buddha's marks, signs, and so forth.

original: // dpal ldan rdo rje thugs 'chang ba /
analyzed: // dpal ldan rdo rje thugs 'chang ba /

analyzed: la sogs pa ni thugs su nges pa'i rigs la gsol ba 'debs par bstan to //

analyzed: rdo rje thugs kyis mdzad du gsol //

analyzed: / slad ma ni gong ma dang mthun no //

analyzed: bya'o ; /'od zer ldas dkris lta bu ni //
