analyzed: nga rgyal bskyed nas sbyor bar bya //
translated: Having generated pride, one should unite.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar 'od zer 'phro zhing gnas pa de mngon sum gsal bar bskyed nas thugs dang sems gnyis su med par sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar 'od zer 'phro zhing gnas pa de mngon sum gsal bar bskyed nas thugs dang sems gnyis su med par sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: Having generated the appearance of light rays and abiding in that, one should unite the mind and the mind of enlightenment, which are nondual.

original: kun du bzang po zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spyod kyang de'i nyes pas mi gos pas badzra satva'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spyod kyang de'i nyes pas mi gos pas badzra satva'o //
translated: Samantabhadra is Vajrasattva, because one is not sullied by the faults of desire and so on, even though one engages in the conduct of desire and so on.

original: gsang dbang ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid dam mchog yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsang dbang ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid dam mchog yin pa'i don to //
translated: The secret initiation is the nature or the supreme of all the tathagatas.

original: yang na gsang ba ni lo tsa na la sogs pa yum gyi rang bzhin du gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na gsang ba ni lo tsa na la sogs pa yum gyi rang bzhin du gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Or else, the secret is the lotuses and so forth that are the nature of the consort.

original: de dag dang gnyis su med pa'i bde ba'i ngang du rtag tu gnas pas dbang ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang gnyis su med pa'i bde ba'i ngang du rtag tu gnas pas dbang ngo //
translated: The initiation is the constant abiding in the state of bliss that is nondual with them.

original: blo ldan ni phyin ci log spang sa ba'o //üîΩbdag kyang de dang 'dra ba'i sems can zhes pa ni de ltar bu'i yon tan dang ldan zhing rdo rje 'chang gi thugs su 'gyur bar shog cig ces brjod cing smon pa'o //
analyzed: blo ldan ni phyin ci log spang sa ba'o // bdag kyang de dang 'dra ba'i sems can zhes pa ni de ltar bu'i yon tan dang ldan zhing rdo rje 'chang gi thugs su 'gyur bar shog cig ces brjod cing smon pa'o //
translated: The wise one is the one who has abandoned error.üîΩMay I also be like that, a sentient being.üîΩThis is the expression and aspiration that one should have the qualities of such a one and become the mind of Vajradhara.

original: aom sarba th'a ga ta tsitta badzra sva h'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes ba'i sngags 'dis bdag gi sems de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin no bar bsgom zhing brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba th'a ga ta tsitta badzra sva h'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes ba'i sngags 'dis bdag gi sems de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin no bar bsgom zhing brjod par bya'o //
translated: With the mantra Om sarva tathagata citta vajra svabhava atmako ham, one should meditate and say that one's mind is the nature of the vajra mind of all tathagatas.

original: de ltar bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs zhes pa la sogs pa ni gong du bstan pa'i tshul gyis bdag gis bdag gi phung po dang khams la sogs pa lha dang lha mo'i rang bzhin du shes pa dang lus dang ngag dang sems de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs zhes pa la sogs pa ni gong du bstan pa'i tshul gyis bdag gis bdag gi phung po dang khams la sogs pa lha dang lha mo'i rang bzhin du shes pa dang lus dang ngag dang sems de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung
translated: As such, ‚Äúself-consecration‚Äù and so on are the method of teaching above, knowing that one‚Äôs aggregates, elements, and so on are the nature of male and female deities, and the body, voice, and mind are the three kƒÅyas of the tathƒÅgatas.üîΩ

original: thugs su byin gyis brlabs pa byas pa'i phyag rgya de nyid la dpal byang chub sems rdo rje'i dpal byang chub sems rdo rje'i skur bsgom par bstan to //
analyzed: thugs su byin gyis brlabs pa byas pa'i phyag rgya de nyid la dpal byang chub sems rdo rje'i dpal byang chub sems rdo rje'i skur bsgom par bstan to //
translated: Thus, self-consecration and so forth indicate that one should meditate on oneself as the glorious Bodhicittavajra, in the manner taught above, by recognizing one's aggregates, elements, and so forth as the nature of gods and goddesses, and by consecrating one's body, speech, and mind as the body, speech, and mind of the Tathagata.

original: de aa las bskyed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bdag 'dug par bsams la snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um dkar po gcig bskyed /
analyzed: de aa las bskyed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bdag 'dug par bsams la snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um dkar po gcig bskyed /
translated: One should imagine oneself seated upon a moon disk generated from A, and at one's heart, upon a moon disk, a white HUM.

original: de spro bsdu byas pa las byang chub kyi sems rdo rjer gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: de spro bsdu byas pa las byang chub kyi sems rdo rjer gyur par bsam mo //
translated: From the emanation and re-absorption of that, one should imagine oneself as Bodhicittavajra.

original: sems dpa'i skyil krung ni 'dug stangs so //
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung ni 'dug stangs so //
translated: The hero's cross-legged posture is the sitting position.

original: zla ba'i mdog ni sku mdog go //
analyzed: zla ba'i mdog ni sku mdog go //
translated: The moon color is the body color.

original: rnam par thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs @126a * //
analyzed: rnam par thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs @126a * //
translated: All aspects refers to the major and minor marks of a buddha and so on.üîΩ

original: pa'i yon tan thams cad dang dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i phyi'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i yon tan thams cad dang dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i phyi'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In every way means that he is adorned with all the good qualities of the Buddha such as the major and minor marks, and with all the external ornaments such as the crown protrusion.

original: de rnams thun mong ma yin pas mchog go //
analyzed: de rnams thun mong ma yin pas mchog go //
translated: He is supreme because he is not common to others.üîΩHe wears his hair in braids and a crown.

original: ral pa cod pa na 'chang la zhi //üîΩzhes pa ni dbu skra ral par 'du gnyid cod pa na du byas pa 'am //
analyzed: ral pa cod pa na 'chang la zhi // zhes pa ni dbu skra ral par 'du gnyid cod pa na du byas pa 'am //
translated: He is peaceful.üîΩHe wears his hair in braids and a crown means that he wears his hair in braids and a crown.

original: ral pa dang cod pa na gyis brgyan pa'o ;
analyzed: ral pa dang cod pa na gyis brgyan pa'o ;
translated: Or he is adorned with braids and a crown.

original: / zhi ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i me khong na med pas phyi'i sku zhe sdang gi rtags khro ga nyer la sogs pa med par sems can thams cad kyi yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar byad pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: / zhi ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i me khong na med pas phyi'i sku zhe sdang gi rtags khro ga nyer la sogs pa med par sems can thams cad kyi yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar byad pa'i tshul lo //
translated: He is peaceful because the fire of the afflictions such as attachment does not exist within him and the signs of external anger such as wrath do not exist. He is the method of pleasing and delighting the minds of all sentient beings.

original: zhal gsum rnam par bsgom par bya ba ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i rtags su ston pa'i phyir dang // 'jig rten pa'i lha mgo grangs kyis yod pa rnams 'dul bar bstan pa 'am de dag la dad pa'i sems can rnams chos 'di la dad par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhal gsum rnam par bsgom par bya ba ni dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i rtags su ston pa'i phyir dang // 'jig rten pa'i lha mgo grangs kyis yod pa rnams 'dul bar bstan pa 'am de dag la dad pa'i sems can rnams chos 'di la dad par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meditation on the three faces is taught as a sign that he is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas of the three times, and in order to tame the worldly gods who have many heads, or in order to inspire faith in this Dharma in those sentient beings who have faith in them.

original: g-yas pa aindra n'i la zhes pa ni zhal gsum la g-yas phyogs kyi zhal thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas te de las mi 'gyur pas rin po che aindra n'i la'i kha dog bzhin mthing nag tu bstan to //
analyzed: g-yas pa aindra n'i la zhes pa ni zhal gsum la g-yas phyogs kyi zhal thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas te de las mi 'gyur pas rin po che aindra n'i la'i kha dog bzhin mthing nag tu bstan to //
translated: The right face is sapphire-colored. Since the right face among the three faces is the nature of mind, and since it is unchanging, it is taught as being dark blue like the color of a sapphire.

original: yang na 'jig rten pa'i lha khyab 'jug la sogs pa zhe sdang che zhing gnag pa rnams kyi don mthun pa'i sgo nas mdzad pa 'am de la dad pa rnams chos 'di la dad par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten pa'i lha khyab 'jug la sogs pa zhe sdang che zhing gnag pa rnams kyi don mthun pa'i sgo nas mdzad pa 'am de la dad pa rnams chos 'di la dad par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or, it is in order to perform deeds in accordance with the interests of the worldly gods such as Vishnu, who are very hateful and dark, or in order to inspire faith in this Dharma in those who have faith in them.

original: g-yon pa chags pas dmar ba ni sems can thams cad la thugs rje chen po'i sgo nas chags shing //
analyzed: g-yon pa chags pas dmar ba ni sems can thams cad la thugs rje chen po'i sgo nas chags shing //
translated: His left face is red with passion, because he is passionate toward all sentient beings through great compassion.

original: gsung gi sgo nas don byed pa'i rtags su g-yon dmar par bstan to //
analyzed: gsung gi sgo nas don byed pa'i rtags su g-yon dmar par bstan to //
translated: His left face is red as a sign of his activity for the sake of sentient beings through his speech.

original: yang lha chen po la sogs pa 'dod chags che zhing kha dog dmar par 'dug pa rnams kyi don mthun pa'i sgo nas mdzad pa 'am de dag la dad pa rnams chos 'di la dad par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang lha chen po la sogs pa 'dod chags che zhing kha dog dmar par 'dug pa rnams kyi don mthun pa'i sgo nas mdzad pa 'am de dag la dad pa rnams chos 'di la dad par bya ba'i don to //
translated: Alternatively, he acts in accordance with those who have great passion, such as the great gods, who are red in color, or he acts for the sake of those who have faith in them, so that they may have faith in this Dharma.

original: zhal dbus dkar ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral zhing sku'i rang bzhin yin pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: zhal dbus dkar ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bral zhing sku'i rang bzhin yin pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: His central face is white because he acts for the sake of sentient beings through his body, which is free from afflictions.

original: yang na tshangs pa la sogs pa dkar zhing gti mug shas che ba rnams kyi don mdzad pa gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa la sogs pa dkar zhing gti mug shas che ba rnams kyi don mdzad pa gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Alternatively, he acts for the sake of those who are white, such as Brahma, and who have a predominance of delusion, as above.

original: phyogs bcu thams cad snang byed pa //
analyzed: phyogs bcu thams cad snang byed pa //
translated: He illuminates all the ten directions.

original: de yi phyag drug rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: de yi phyag drug rnam par bsgom //
translated: You should visualize his six arms.

original: zhes pa ni shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs bzhi dang // me'i phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshams bzhi dang // steng 'og gi 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag tu @126b sku las ye shes kyi 'od zer 'phro zhing sems can gyi gti mug gi mun pa rnam par 'joms shing ye shes kyi snang ba skyed pa'i dpal byang chub sems rdo rje de phyag drug dangüîΩldan par bsgom zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs bzhi dang // me'i phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshams bzhi dang // steng 'og gi 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dag tu @126b sku las ye shes kyi 'od zer 'phro zhing sems can gyi gti mug gi mun pa rnam par 'joms shing ye shes kyi snang ba skyed pa'i dpal byang chub sems rdo rje de phyag drug dang ldan par bsgom zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that in the four directions, east and so on, and in the four intermediate directions, southeast and so on, and in the upper and lower world systems, the glorious Bodhisattva Vajra, who is the light of knowledge radiating from the body, completely destroys the darkness of ignorance of sentient beings and produces the light of knowledge, should be meditated upon as having six arms.

original: de la phyag drug ni sems can rnams la phyag drug gi sgo nas don byed pa dang // 'jig rten gyi lha khyab 'jug la sogs pa lag pa drug dang ldan pa rnams mthun pa'i sgo nas 'dul ba dang // de la mos pa'i sems can rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos la gzung pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la phyag drug ni sems can rnams la phyag drug gi sgo nas don byed pa dang // 'jig rten gyi lha khyab 'jug la sogs pa lag pa drug dang ldan pa rnams mthun pa'i sgo nas 'dul ba dang // de la mos pa'i sems can rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos la gzung pa'i don to //
translated: The six arms are for the purpose of acting for the benefit of sentient beings through the six arms, and for the purpose of subduing worldly gods such as Vishnu who have six arms, through a method of conformity, and for the purpose of holding sentient beings who are devoted to them in the teachings of the Buddha.

original: ye shes lnga bdag rdo rje ni //
analyzed: ye shes lnga bdag rdo rje ni //
translated: The vajra of the nature of the five knowledges

original: zhes pa la de la phyag g-yas kyi dang po ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin rdo rje rtse lnga pa kha dog aindra n'i la ltar 'dug pa phyag tu bsgom zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa la de la phyag g-yas kyi dang po ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin rdo rje rtse lnga pa kha dog aindra n'i la ltar 'dug pa phyag tu bsgom zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The phrase in his right hand is connected with the phrase one should meditate on the first [hand] holding a five-pointed vajra, the nature of the five gnoses, the color of sapphire.

original: 'bar ba lngas rnam par brgyan pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin 'od zer kha dog dkar po la sogs pa lnga rdo rje de nyid las 'phro zhing dkris pa'i don to //üîΩsangs rgyas sprin ni rnam par spro //
analyzed: 'bar ba lngas rnam par brgyan pa ni ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin 'od zer kha dog dkar po la sogs pa lnga rdo rje de nyid las 'phro zhing dkris pa'i don to // sangs rgyas sprin ni rnam par spro //
translated: The phrase adorned with five flames means that from that very vajra, five-colored light rays, the nature of the five gnoses, radiate and wrap around it.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje de las kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha dang lha mo phyogs bcur spros shing sems can gyi don byed par bsam zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje de las kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha dang lha mo phyogs bcur spros shing sems can gyi don byed par bsam zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase emanating clouds of buddhas means that one should imagine that from that vajra, the Bhagavat Vairocana and so forth, the male and female deities, emanate into the ten directions and perform the welfare of sentient beings.

original: gnyis pa 'khor lo chen po zhes pa phyag bar ma la 'khor lo bsnams pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'khor lo chen po zhes pa phyag bar ma la 'khor lo bsnams pa'i don to //
translated: The second [hand] holds a great wheel, meaning that the middle hand holds a wheel.

original: zla ba rtsibs brgyad lta bus ni dbyibs dang kha dog bstan te 'khor lo de rtsibs brgyad ldan zhing zla ba bzhin du dkar la zlum por 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba rtsibs brgyad lta bus ni dbyibs dang kha dog bstan te 'khor lo de rtsibs brgyad ldan zhing zla ba bzhin du dkar la zlum por 'dug pa'o //
translated: The moon-like eight-spoked wheel indicates the shape and color. The wheel has eight spokes and is white and round like the moon.üîΩOne should meditate on the radiating of the wheel,

original: bdud rnams thams cad gcod byed pa //üîΩrnam par 'phro bar bsgom par bya //
analyzed: bdud rnams thams cad gcod byed pa // rnam par 'phro bar bsgom par bya //
translated: which cuts all the demons.

original: zhes pa ni 'khor lo de la ye shes kyi 'od zer 'phros pas sems can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang // gnod par byed pa'i gnod sbyin dang / srin po rnams tshar gcod pa'i mthu dang ldan par bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khor lo de la ye shes kyi 'od zer 'phros pas sems can gyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bdud dang // gnod par byed pa'i gnod sbyin dang / srin po rnams tshar gcod pa'i mthu dang ldan par bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on the wheel as having the power to destroy the demons of the afflictions of passion, etc., of sentient beings, and the yakshas and rakshasas that do harm, by radiating the light of gnosis.

original: gsum pa padma chen po zhes pa ni g-yas kyi tha ma la padma bsnams pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsum pa padma chen po zhes pa ni g-yas kyi tha ma la padma bsnams pa'i don to //
translated: The third line, ‚Äúthe great lotus,‚Äù means that the wheel is held in the right hand.

original: chos kyi sprin gyis kun du 'khrigs //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin gyis kun du 'khrigs //
translated: It is covered with clouds of Dharma.

original: zhes pa ni padma de las snang ba mtha' yas kyi rang bzhin 'phros shing 'khrigs pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par chos kyi tshig 'byung pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni padma de las snang ba mtha' yas kyi rang bzhin 'phros shing 'khrigs pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par chos kyi tshig 'byung pa'i don to //
translated: This means that from that lotus there emanates and gathers the nature of AmitƒÅbha, and the meaning is that the words of the Dharma arise in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: kha ba zho lta bur dag /'dod chags thams cad dag mdzad pa //
analyzed: kha ba zho lta bur dag /'dod chags thams cad dag mdzad pa //
translated: White like snow and curd, he purifies all desire.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi don du 'dod chags dang du blangs shing spyad kyang @127a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi don du 'dod chags dang du blangs shing spyad kyang @127a * //
translated: This means that the BhagavƒÅn, for the sake of sentient beings, takes up and practices desire,

original: de'i nyes pas mi gos pa'i rtags padma ba zho 'am kha ba lta bur shin tu dkar ba bsnams par bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'i nyes pas mi gos pa'i rtags padma ba zho 'am kha ba lta bur shin tu dkar ba bsnams par bsgom mo //
translated: and the sign of his not being tainted by its faults is that he holds a lotus that is very white, like snow or curd.

original: g-yon pa'i dril bu dmar skya ste //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i dril bu dmar skya ste //
translated: The bell in the left hand is pale red,

original: ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od dang mtshungs //
analyzed: ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od dang mtshungs //
translated: and is like the light of an autumn moon.

original: zhes pa ni phyag g-yon gyi dang po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bas dkar ba sems can la snying rje'i sgo nas chags pa'i rtags su cung zad dmar par 'dug pa //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag g-yon gyi dang po la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyi pa'i rang bzhin nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bas dkar ba sems can la snying rje'i sgo nas chags pa'i rtags su cung zad dmar par 'dug pa //
translated: This means that the first of the left hands has the nature of the perfection of wisdom, and is white because it is free from all afflictions. The sign of his attachment to sentient beings through compassion is that it is slightly red.

original: ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od bzhin du shin tu dkar pa'i 'od 'phro zhing sems cad dga' bar byed pa sa so //
analyzed: ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od bzhin du shin tu dkar pa'i 'od 'phro zhing sems cad dga' bar byed pa sa so //
translated: It radiates a light that is very white, like the light of the autumn moon, and delights sentient beings.

original: chos rnams sgra brnyan lta bu zhes //
analyzed: chos rnams sgra brnyan lta bu zhes //
translated: The Dharma is like an echo,

original: sgras ni rab tu go bar mdzad //
analyzed: sgras ni rab tu go bar mdzad //
translated: and is understood through sound.

original: ces pa ni dril bu de las sgra byung bas sems can thams cad la chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin brag ca lta bu zhes rang bzhin med par stong pa nyid do zhes go bar byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni dril bu de las sgra byung bas sems can thams cad la chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin brag ca lta bu zhes rang bzhin med par stong pa nyid do zhes go bar byed pa'i don to //
translated: This means that since the sound arises from that bell, it causes all sentient beings to understand that the nature of all phenomena is like an echo, which is emptiness, the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: gnyis pa rin chen chen po ste //
analyzed: gnyis pa rin chen chen po ste //
translated: The second is a great jewel,

original: rdo rje 'bar bas rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar bas rnam par brgyan //
translated: adorned with blazing vajras.

original: zhes pa ni phyag bar ma las yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bsnams pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag bar ma las yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che bsnams pa ste //
translated: This means that the middle hand holds a wish-fulfilling jewel,

original: de yang ye shes kyi 'od zer 'bar zhing dkrigs pas brgyan zhes pa'o don to //
analyzed: de yang ye shes kyi 'od zer 'bar zhing dkrigs pas brgyan zhes pa'o don to //
translated: which is also adorned with blazing and radiating light rays of wisdom.

original: nyi ma 'char ka lta bu'i de ni kha dog shin tu yang dmar pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka lta bu'i de ni kha dog shin tu yang dmar pa'o //
translated: It is very red, like the rising sun.

original: re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni rin po che de las sems can gyi 'dod pa rnams 'byung zhing tshim par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa ni rin po che de las sems can gyi 'dod pa rnams 'byung zhing tshim par byed pa'i don to //
translated: The one that fulfills all hopes is the jewel, which has the meaning of satisfying and producing the desires of sentient beings.

original: gsum pa ral gri chen po ste //
analyzed: gsum pa ral gri chen po ste //
translated: The third is the great sword.

original: autpala sngo po'i lo ma bzhin du zhes pa ni phyag tha ma na ral gri'i kha dog autpala'i 'dab ma bzhin du 'dug pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: autpala sngo po'i lo ma bzhin du zhes pa ni phyag tha ma na ral gri'i kha dog autpala'i 'dab ma bzhin du 'dug pa rnams la'o //
translated: Like the leaf of a blue lotus means that in the last hand there is a sword that has the color of a lotus leaf.

original: chen po ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas thun mong ma yin pa'o don to //
analyzed: chen po ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas thun mong ma yin pa'o don to //
translated: Great means that it is not common because it is the nature of wisdom.üîΩIt cuts the ignorance and afflictions

original: phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi //üîΩmi shes nyon mongs gcod byed pa //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sems can thams cad kyi // mi shes nyon mongs gcod byed pa //
translated: of all sentient beings in the ten directions.

original: zhes pa ni de las 'od zer 'phros shing sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i bag chags thams cad gcod pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de las 'od zer 'phros shing sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i bag chags thams cad gcod pa'i don to //
translated: This means that light rays emanate from that and cut the habitual tendencies of ignorance of all sentient beings.

original: phyag mtshan de rnams kyang ye shes lnga dang rigs lnga'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag mtshan de rnams kyang ye shes lnga dang rigs lnga'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Those hand implements should be understood to be the nature of the five wisdoms and the five families.

original: dmar po sna tshogs 'bar 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: dmar po sna tshogs 'bar 'dra ba'i //
translated: Red, like a blazing fire,

original: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyis ni brgyan //
analyzed: 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyis ni brgyan //
translated: Adorned with a circle of light.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub sems rdo rje de nyid kyi sku las 'od zer byung bas dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du chags shing rgyab gtan du byas pas brgyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub sems rdo rje de nyid kyi sku las 'od zer byung bas dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du chags shing rgyab gtan du byas pas brgyan zhes bya'o //
translated: This means that light rays come from the body of that very vajra bodhicitta, and it is said to be ‚Äúadorned‚Äù because it is attached in the manner of a circle and is made firm.

original: zla ba dri med stong 'dra ba ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor de zla ba stong ngam de bas @127b lhag pa'i 'od 'phrog pa'i don to //
analyzed: zla ba dri med stong 'dra ba ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor de zla ba stong ngam de bas @127b lhag pa'i 'od 'phrog pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúLike a thousand stainless moons‚Äù means that the circle of light is like a thousand moons, or it means that it outshines the light of a thousand moons.

original: blo dang ldan pas rgyab tu bsam //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas rgyab tu bsam //
translated: The wise one should imagine it in the back.

original: zhes pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'i sgrub pa pos 'od kyi dkyil 'khor du bsgom pa'i don to //üîΩsnying ga'i dbus su phra mo yi //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs la mkhas pa'i sgrub pa pos 'od kyi dkyil 'khor du bsgom pa'i don to // snying ga'i dbus su phra mo yi //
translated: This means that the practitioner who is skilled in means should meditate on the circle of light.üîΩIn the center of the heart, one should meditate

original: ye shes sems dpa' rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' rnam par bsgom //
translated: on the subtle gnosis being.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar bdag byang chub sems rdo rje'i phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa'i phyag rgya de dang 'dra ba mtshon gang ba cig bsgom pa'o don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bdag byang chub sems rdo rje'i phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa'i phyag rgya de dang 'dra ba mtshon gang ba cig bsgom pa'o don to //
translated: This means that one should meditate on a finger-width-sized gnosis being, similar to oneself as the great seal of vajra bodhicitta, at the heart.

original: de'i dus su bsam pa ni //
analyzed: de'i dus su bsam pa ni //
translated: The thought at that time is as follows.

original: yi ge mchog ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge mchog ni dam pa'o //
translated: The supreme syllable is the best.

original: zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin dngos grub thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yi ge h'um bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin dngos grub thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yi ge h'um bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: This means that in the heart of the gnosis being one should meditate on the syllable h≈´·πÉ, the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times, the source of all powers.

original: de ltar bdag byang chub sems rdo rje'i phyag rgya ra gsal bar bsgom zhing zla ba drug tshun chad sems las su rung gi bar du 'og nas 'byung pa'i tshul rdo rje phra mo'i ting nges 'dzin skabs 'dir bsgom pa 'di man ngag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag byang chub sems rdo rje'i phyag rgya ra gsal bar bsgom zhing zla ba drug tshun chad sems las su rung gi bar du 'og nas 'byung pa'i tshul rdo rje phra mo'i ting nges 'dzin skabs 'dir bsgom pa 'di man ngag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on oneself as the form of Vajrasattva for six months or until the mind becomes workable. One should understand that the meditation on the samƒÅdhi of the subtle vajra, which will be explained below, is the instruction for this occasion.

original: sngom la gnas pa'i sngags pa yis //
analyzed: sngom la gnas pa'i sngags pa yis //
translated: The mantra practitioner who abides in the vow

original: bsnyen pa sngar ni byas nas su //
analyzed: bsnyen pa sngar ni byas nas su //
translated: having previously performed the approach

original: zhes pa ni de ltar bsnyen pa dan g nye ba'i bsnyen pa rdzogs par byas nas sgrub pa las 'jug par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bsnyen pa dan g nye ba'i bsnyen pa rdzogs par byas nas sgrub pa las 'jug par bstan to //
translated: This shows that having completed the approach and the close approach in that way, one should enter into the practice.

original: de la bsnyen pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ting nges 'dzin chos thams cad kyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin skye ba med par bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la bsnyen pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ting nges 'dzin chos thams cad kyi don dam pa'i rang bzhin skye ba med par bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: The approaching is the meaning of the samƒÅdhi of suchness, the meditation on the ultimate nature of all phenomena, which is non-arising.

original: nye ba'i bsnyen pa ni kun du snang gi ting nges 'dzin dang phra mo'i ting nges 'dzin gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i bsnyen pa ni kun du snang gi ting nges 'dzin dang phra mo'i ting nges 'dzin gyi bar du'o //
translated: The close approach is the samƒÅdhi of all-illumination up to the subtle samƒÅdhi.

original: sdom la gnas pa ni gong du bstan pa'i dam tshig dang spyod pa las mi 'da' ba'o //üîΩsngar bsnyen pa byas pa ni bsnyen pa rnam gnyis rim pa bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: sdom la gnas pa ni gong du bstan pa'i dam tshig dang spyod pa las mi 'da' ba'o // sngar bsnyen pa byas pa ni bsnyen pa rnam gnyis rim pa bzhin du byas nas /
translated: The abiding in the vow is not transgressing the pledges and conduct taught above.

original: sems las su rung ba'i sgrub pa la 'jug par bya'i gzhan du ma yin zhes pa'i don to //üîΩcho ga 'di yi sbyor pa yis //
analyzed: sems las su rung ba'i sgrub pa la 'jug par bya'i gzhan du ma yin zhes pa'i don to // cho ga 'di yi sbyor pa yis //
translated: The having previously performed the approaching means that after performing the two approaches in sequence, one should enter the practice of making the mind serviceable, and not otherwise.

original: zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung pa'i thabs kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung pa'i thabs kyis so //
translated: The meaning of by the yoga of this rite is by the method that will be explained below.

original: sgrub pa dag ni brtsams ma ni bdag sku gsung thugs thob par thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi rim pa la 'jug par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub pa dag ni brtsams ma ni bdag sku gsung thugs thob par thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi rim pa la 'jug par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of having begun the practice is to enter the stages of the method for attaining the attainment of the body, speech, and mind of the deity.

original: khrus mkhan gyi ni bdag nyid che //
analyzed: khrus mkhan gyi ni bdag nyid che //
translated: The great man of the bath.

original: zhes pa ni sgrub pa'i snod gzugs ma bstan te khrus mkhan ni gos 'khru zhing bco blag byed pa'i rigs ngan te de lta bu la rang bzhin mthu yang yod pas bdag nyid chen po zhes bya //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgrub pa'i snod gzugs ma bstan te khrus mkhan ni gos 'khru zhing bco blag byed pa'i rigs ngan te de lta bu la rang bzhin mthu yang yod pas bdag nyid chen po zhes bya //
translated: This shows the vessel of practice. The bath man is a low caste who washes clothes and does mending. He is a great man because he has natural power.

original: de ltar bu'i bu mo rigs ngan pas nga rgyas chung zhing bka' blo bde bas @128a * //
analyzed: de ltar bu'i bu mo rigs ngan pas nga rgyas chung zhing bka' blo bde bas @128a * //
translated: A low caste girl like that has little pride and is easy to talk to.

original: bdag ci dga' bar bye dpas sems las su rung pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag ci dga' bar bye dpas sems las su rung pa'i don to //
translated: She is a vessel for practice because she is flexible.

original: yang na khrus mkhan ni sdig pa spong zhing dge pa byed pa'i khyim bdag la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na khrus mkhan ni sdig pa spong zhing dge pa byed pa'i khyim bdag la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la bya'o //
translated: Or else, the bath man is any householder who gives up sin and does good.

original: bu mo mig ring rnyed pa ni //
analyzed: bu mo mig ring rnyed pa ni //
translated: The long-eyed girl is the attainment.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni rigs de lta bu'i bu mo shes pa che zhing sems gsal ba phyi'i mig kyang che zhing ring ba yid du 'ong bar 'dug pa kha dog kyang autpala'i lo ma bzhin sdo skyar 'dug pa gzugs yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni rigs de lta bu'i bu mo shes pa che zhing sems gsal ba phyi'i mig kyang che zhing ring ba yid du 'ong bar 'dug pa kha dog kyang autpala'i lo ma bzhin sdo skyar 'dug pa gzugs yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad
translated: Her body and limbs areüîΩcomplete.

original: tshang ba // 'dod chags bdo bas dar la bab pa //
analyzed: tshang ba // 'dod chags bdo bas dar la bab pa //
translated: She is in the prime of youth, with passion aroused.

original: brgyan pa ni de rnams dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: brgyan pa ni de rnams dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: Adorned means having those qualities.

original: thams cad rgyan gyis yongs su brgyan pa ni phyi'i rgyan gos dang rin po che la sogs pa rnams kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad rgyan gyis yongs su brgyan pa ni phyi'i rgyan gos dang rin po che la sogs pa rnams kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: She is adorned with all ornaments in that she is adorned with external ornaments such as clothes and jewels.

original: bzhin mdzes yid du 'ong ba zhes pa ni bsod nams che ba'i rtags gzugs byang shin tu sdug cing kun gyi yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin mdzes yid du 'ong ba zhes pa ni bsod nams che ba'i rtags gzugs byang shin tu sdug cing kun gyi yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: Beautiful face, pleasing means that she has the sign of great merit, a very beautiful form, pleasing to everyone.

original: bong tshod lo ni bcu gnyis pa ni bu mo lo grangs pa cu gnyis la yon tan de lta bu kun tshang bar rnyed na mchog go //
analyzed: bong tshod lo ni bcu gnyis pa ni bu mo lo grangs pa cu gnyis la yon tan de lta bu kun tshang bar rnyed na mchog go //
translated: If one finds a girl of twelve years of age with all those qualities, she is the best.

original: de ltar bstan kyang spyir bcu gnyis dang nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bar du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bstan kyang spyir bcu gnyis dang nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bar du shes par bya'o //
translated: Although it is taught in this way, it should be understood that there are twelve and twenty-five [types of consorts].

original: bzung nas bsgrub pa brtsam par bya //
analyzed: bzung nas bsgrub pa brtsam par bya //
translated: Having taken her, one should begin the practice.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This means

original: de ltar bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sgo nas btsal nas bsgrub pa la 'jug par bya ba'i don to //üîΩphyis gcin sogs dam tshig las shes pa ni de ltar mtshan dang ldan pa'i gzungs ma rnyed na //
analyzed: de ltar bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sgo nas btsal nas bsgrub pa la 'jug par bya ba'i don to // phyis gcin sogs dam tshig las shes pa ni de ltar mtshan dang ldan pa'i gzungs ma rnyed na //
translated: that, having sought a consort who has such qualities and is free of faults, one should engage in the practice.üîΩLater, one should know the pledge from urine and so forth.

original: gong du bstan pa'i gnas der bdud rtsi lngas mandala bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gong du bstan pa'i gnas der bdud rtsi lngas mandala bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that, having found a knowledge consort who has the characteristics, one should make a ma·πá·∏çala with the five nectars in that place taught above.

original: cho ga bzhin zhes pa ni aa mri ta lnga'i byin gyis brlab pa dang // dkyil 'khor gyi las tshang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin zhes pa ni aa mri ta lnga'i byin gyis brlab pa dang // dkyil 'khor gyi las tshang bar byed pa'o //
translated: According to the rite means that one should consecrate the five nectars and complete the ma·πá·∏çala activities.

original: grub bzhi pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs rgyas pa'i tshul du bya'o //
analyzed: grub bzhi pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbyibs rgyas pa'i tshul du bya'o //
translated: The four corners should be made in the manner of an extensive ma·πá·∏çala.

original: dkyil 'khor byas nas de dbus su //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor byas nas de dbus su //
translated: Having made the ma·πá·∏çala, in the center of that

original: sngar gsungs pa yi gnas der gzhag / ces ba ni dkyil 'khor de lta bu byas nas sngar gsungs pa'i gzungs ma dngos grub thams cad kyi 'byung gnas de'i dbus su gzhag ces pa'i don to //üîΩphyag rgya bzhi yi sbyor pa yis //üîΩbdag nyid mos pa'i lhar yang bsgom //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa yi gnas der gzhag / ces ba ni dkyil 'khor de lta bu byas nas sngar gsungs pa'i gzungs ma dngos grub thams cad kyi 'byung gnas de'i dbus su gzhag ces pa'i don to // phyag rgya bzhi yi sbyor pa yis // bdag nyid mos pa'i lhar yang bsgom //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúone should place it in the place previously mentioned‚Äù is that, having made the ma·πá·∏çala in that way, one should place in the center of it the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´-lady previously mentioned, the source of all powers.

original: zhes pa ni sgrub pa po bdag kyang de dang lhan cig dkyil 'khor gyi dkyil du 'dug la bdag nyid dad pa'i lha gang yang rung pa phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan par bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgrub pa po bdag kyang de dang lhan cig dkyil 'khor gyi dkyil du 'dug la bdag nyid dad pa'i lha gang yang rung pa phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan par bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúone should also visualize oneself as the deity of one‚Äôs choice by means of the yoga of the four seals‚Äù is that the practitioner also sits in the center of the ma·πá·∏çala together with her and visualizes oneself as any deity of one‚Äôs choice endowed with the four seals.

original: phyag rgya bzhi ni thugs @128b kar yig 'brug gnas pa chos kyi phyag rgya dang // rdo rje la sogs pa phyag mtshan 'dzin pa las kyi phyag rgya dang // g-yon phyogs su yum bskyed pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang // de rnams rdzogs pa phyag rgya chen po dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi ni thugs @128b kar yig 'brug gnas pa chos kyi phyag rgya dang // rdo rje la sogs pa phyag mtshan 'dzin pa las kyi phyag rgya dang // g-yon phyogs su yum bskyed pa dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang // de rnams rdzogs pa phyag rgya chen po dang bzhi'o //
translated: The four seals are the dharma-seal, which is the mind-vajra abiding as the seed syllable; the karma-seal, which is holding the hand implements such as the vajra; the pledge-seal, which is generating the consort on one‚Äôs left; and the great seal, which is the perfection of those.

original: yang na gsang pa'i yum bzhi phyogs bzhir bskyed nas bsgom pa la yang bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gsang pa'i yum bzhi phyogs bzhir bskyed nas bsgom pa la yang bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should do it in the meditation in which one generates the four secret consorts in the four directions.

original: rang gi lus las 'byung ba rnams //
analyzed: rang gi lus las 'byung ba rnams //
translated: The elements that arise from one's body

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i gnas su dmigs //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i gnas su dmigs //
translated: are visualized in the places of consecration.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar gzungs ma de lha mo gcig tu bsgoms la //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar gzungs ma de lha mo gcig tu bsgoms la //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on that knowledge woman as a single goddess.

original: rang gi lus las byung pa ni bdag phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i thugs ka nas rigs lnga phyung zhing byin gyis brlab pa'i gnas gzungs ma de gnas ldar bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi lus las byung pa ni bdag phyag rgya chen por gnas pa'i thugs ka nas rigs lnga phyung zhing byin gyis brlab pa'i gnas gzungs ma de gnas ldar bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: The elements that arise from one's body means that one generates the five clans from the heart of oneself abiding in the great seal, and consecrates the places of the knowledge woman who is generated in the place of the clans.üîΩBetween the breasts, on the crown of the head,

original: nu ma'i bar dang spyi gtsug dang // lte ba rked pa rkang rnams su //
analyzed: nu ma'i bar dang spyi gtsug dang // lte ba rked pa rkang rnams su //
translated: at the navel, at the hips, and on the feet,

original: zhes pa ni gnas lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnas lnga'o //
translated: are the five places.

original: rgyal ba bdag nyid gsang las skyes pa ni bdag byang chub sems rdo rje'i phyag rgyar gnas pa'i thugs ka thun mong dang rtog ge pa'i yul ma yin pas gsang ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba bdag nyid gsang las skyes pa ni bdag byang chub sems rdo rje'i phyag rgyar gnas pa'i thugs ka thun mong dang rtog ge pa'i yul ma yin pas gsang ba'o //
translated: The one born from the secret of the Victorious Ones is the meaning of the knowledge woman generated in the place of the clans.

original: skyes pa ni de las byung pa'i don to //
analyzed: skyes pa ni de las byung pa'i don to //
translated: The one born means the one arisen from that.

original: rigs lnga rnams ni rab tu dmigs //
analyzed: rigs lnga rnams ni rab tu dmigs //
translated: The five clans are clearly visualized.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar gsang ba las skyes pa'i bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs lnga //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar gsang ba las skyes pa'i bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rigs lnga //
translated: Thus, from the secret, the five clans of the BhagavƒÅn, Ak·π£hobhya, etc.

analyzed: yum de'i gnas lngar yig 'brul las bskyed cing gnas par dmigs pa'o //
translated: are generated from the seed syllables and visualized as abiding in the five places of the mother.üîΩIn the center of her heart, etc.

original: de'i snying ga'i dbus su zhes pa ni de rnams bkod pa'i rim pa bstan te //
analyzed: de'i snying ga'i dbus su zhes pa ni de rnams bkod pa'i rim pa bstan te //
translated: teaches the order of their arrangement.

original: yum de'i nu ma gnyis kyi bar //
analyzed: yum de'i nu ma gnyis kyi bar //
translated: In the two breasts of that mother,

analyzed: snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsam //
translated: in the heart one should visualize a sun ma·πá·∏çala.

original: zhes bya ste ma las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ste ma las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyed do //
translated: From the syllable ma·πÉ, one should generate a sun ma·πá·∏çala.

analyzed: de'i dbus mi 'khrugs gnyis su med pa ni de'i ye ge h'um las bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa yab yum bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: In its center, the nondual Ak·π£hobhya is the BhagavƒÅn Ak·π£hobhya, father and mother, generated from the syllable h≈´·πÉ.

original: phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan par gnas //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan par gnas //
translated: He abides with the four mudrƒÅs.

original: zhes pa ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul gnyis ltar yin pa 'am yang na bcom ldas 'das yab yum bzhugs pa'i phyogs bzhir l'a sye la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi bskyed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul gnyis ltar yin pa 'am yang na bcom ldas 'das yab yum bzhugs pa'i phyogs bzhir l'a sye la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi bskyed pa la bya'o //
translated: This is according to the two methods explained above, or else it refers to the four goddesses such as LƒÅsyƒÅ generated in the four directions where the BhagavƒÅn and his consort are situated.

analyzed: zhes pas ni sgrub pa chen po'i 'bras bu sku gsung thugs thob pa'i dus bstan to // de la rnal 'byor bas gong du bstan pa bzhin du bsnyen pa dang nye bsnyen zla ba drug gi bar du rgyun mi 'chad par byas pa'i sems las su rung bas gong du bstan pa bzhin du yul mtshan dang ldan par byin gyis brlab pa'i ting nges 'dzin
translated: This teaches the time of attaining the result of the great practice, the state of body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid dpal ye shes sems dpa'i sku mngon sum du mthong par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung bcas nas ni //
translated: Having assumed the sattva posture,üîΩone should place the vessel of accomplishment upon that.

analyzed: byang chub sems ni byung ba'i tshe //

translated: As stated, as soon as the bodhicitta emerges, one should think that by uttering ‚Äúpha·π≠,‚Äù all afflictions are abandoned and, again, by uttering ‚Äúpha·π≠,‚Äù countless wrathful ones and wrathful women emanate from the bodhicitta and completely vanquish all mƒÅras.

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bgegs dang srin po la sogs pa'i bdud rnams 'joms par bsam pa'i don to //

translated: Again, by uttering ‚Äúphat,‚Äù one imagines that one becomes an offering goddess and that one makes unsurpassable offerings to all the tathagatas of the world systems of the ten directions, arousing their mind streams and fulfilling the hopes of all sentient beings.

analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /

original: zhes pa ni gong ma ltar nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / khro bo dang khro mo spros shing bdud tshar gcod par bya ba dang / mchod pa'i lha mor gyur nas de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i bde bas tshim zhing rgyas par byed pa dang /

translated: As above, one imagines that one abandons the afflictions, emanates male and female wrathful ones to destroy the demons, becomes an offering goddess, and satisfies and delights the tathagatas with unsurpassable bliss.

original: zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: sngags 'di'i don bsgom zhing lan gsum du brjod par bya'o //

translated: The meaning of that is: the mind of bliss is emanated in various ways, and the bodhicitta, which is the nature of great bliss arisen from the nondual union of method and wisdom, is emanated in various ways, as before.

analyzed: // sprul skus thams cad khyab pa bzhin //

analyzed: zhes pa ni khro po dang / mchod pa'i lha mor sprul pa'i sku rnams kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab pa so so'i phrin las byas ma thag tu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is: the emanation bodies of the wrathful ones and the offering goddesses pervade the worlds of the ten directions, and as soon as they perform their individual activities,

analyzed: sku gsung sa bon byin brlabs te //

translated: Vajradh·πõk means that the nature of the mind of all sentient beings in samsara, which is without beginning or end, and the nature of the mind of all tathƒÅgatas is the vajra.

translated: to emanate Vajra Ak·π£obhya.

translated: The central face is black, in accordance with the body.

original: dmar ba ni g-yon pa'o //
analyzed: dmar ba ni g-yon pa'o //
translated: The left is red.

original: dkar ba ni g-yas so //
analyzed: dkar ba ni g-yas so //
translated: The right is white.

original: ral pa'i cod pan gnas dag la //
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan gnas dag la //
translated: On the places of the topknots,

original: mi 'khrugs dbang bskur rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs dbang bskur rnam par brgyan //
translated: Ak·π£obhya is crowned, fully adorned.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can 'dul ba'i ngor byang chub sems kyi nyon mongs pa dang du blangs shing mi spang ba'i rtags su ral pas cod pan byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can 'dul ba'i ngor byang chub sems kyi nyon mongs pa dang du blangs shing mi spang ba'i rtags su ral pas cod pan byas pa'o //
translated: This is the sign of not abandoning the afflictions of the mind of enlightenment in accordance with the disciples.

original: de'i steng du bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dbang bskur pa'i tshul du dbu rgyan du bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dbang bskur pa'i tshul du dbu rgyan du bsam pa'o //
translated: On top of that, one should imagine the Blessed One Vajra Mind as the crown, in the manner of conferring empowerment.

original: thams cad rgyan ni mtshan dang dpe byad dang dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi rgyan thams cad do //
analyzed: thams cad rgyan ni mtshan dang dpe byad dang dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi rgyan thams cad do //
translated: All ornaments are all the ornaments of the world, such as the major and minor marks and crowns.

original: rdzogs pa ni de rnams kyis sku rgyas par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni de rnams kyis sku rgyas par brgyan pa'o //
translated: Complete means the body is fully adorned with them.

original: phyag drug pa ni g-yas g-yon du phyag gsum gsum du bsam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyag drug pa ni g-yas g-yon du phyag gsum gsum du bsam zhes pa'o //
translated: Six arms means imagining three arms on the right and three on the left.

original: rdo rje 'khor lo 'bar 'chang ba //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo 'bar 'chang ba //
translated: Holding a vajra, blazing wheel,

original: chu skyes dag ni mdzes pa'i mchog / ces pa ni g-yas kyi gsum la phyag mtshan de gsum rim pa bzhin du shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: chu skyes dag ni mdzes pa'i mchog / ces pa ni g-yas kyi gsum la phyag mtshan de gsum rim pa bzhin du shes par bya'o ;
translated: The three implements on the right hand are to be known in order.

original: / dril bu ral gri nor bu rnams //
analyzed: / dril bu ral gri nor bu rnams //
translated: The bell, sword, and jewel

original: g-yon pa'i phyag tu bsam par bya //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag tu bsam par bya //
translated: are to be imagined in the left hands.

original: zhes pa ni g-yon pa'i phyag gsum la rim pa bzhin du 'di gsum bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni g-yon pa'i phyag gsum la rim pa bzhin du 'di gsum bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on these three in the three left hands in order.

original: snying ga nas ni de spros te //
analyzed: snying ga nas ni de spros te //
translated: Having emanated from the heart,

original: zhes bya ba'i yum gyi gsang ba'i thugs ka nas steng gi bar snang la 'don pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i yum gyi gsang ba'i thugs ka nas steng gi bar snang la 'don pa'o //
translated: means having emanated from the secret heart of the mother, into the space above.

original: phyogs bcu dag tu rnam par gzigs pa ni steng gi bar snang la cung zad cig gnas nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dag gi sems can gyi khams la 'dul ba'i thabs ji lta bu zhig yin dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag tu rnam par gzigs pa ni steng gi bar snang la cung zad cig gnas nas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa dag gi sems can gyi khams la 'dul ba'i thabs ji lta bu zhig yin dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Gazing in the ten directions means that having remained a little while in the space above, one gazes at the realms of sentient beings in the infinite world systems of the ten directions, thinking about what method of taming would be appropriate.üîΩThe buddhas perform miracles and so forth,

original: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul mdzad sogs dang // chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul mdzad sogs dang // chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor //
translated: and turn the wheel of dharma.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar dgongs nas dang por dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sems can 'dul ba'i thabs theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas bstan zhing chos bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar dgongs nas dang por dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du sems can 'dul ba'i thabs theg pa gsum gyi sgo nas bstan zhing chos bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the thought: having first dwelt in the Tu·π£ita realm, he taught and explained the Dharma through the three vehicles, the means of taming sentient beings, from the Tu·π£ita realm up to nirvana.

original: gzhan yang 'gro ba rigs drug gi lus su bstan zhing de rnams kyi don @132b byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'gro ba rigs drug gi lus su bstan zhing de rnams kyi don @132b byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he manifested bodies in the six realms of migrating beings and acted for their benefit.üîΩHaving completely purified all sentient beings

original: zhe sdang spyod pa'i lam gnas pa'i //üîΩsems can ma lus rab sbyangs nas //
analyzed: zhe sdang spyod pa'i lam gnas pa'i // sems can ma lus rab sbyangs nas //
translated: who abide on the path of conduct of hatred,

original: zhes pa ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa kun mdzad mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa kun mdzad mod kyi /
translated: this is saying that although he has performed all the deeds of a buddha,

original: rigs kyi phrin las zhe sdang can spyad ba'i thabs khyad par du mdzad pa yin pas de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi phrin las zhe sdang can spyad ba'i thabs khyad par du mdzad pa yin pas de skad gsungs so //
translated: he has performed the activity of the family of those with hatred in particular.

original: byang chub sems kyi mdun nas ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi mdun nas ni //
translated: In front of the mind of enlightenment,

original: rdo rje sems la rnam par zhugs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems la rnam par zhugs //
translated: he entered into Vajrasattva.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad nas /
translated: This is saying that having performed the benefit of all sentient beings,

original: slar byon nas byang chub kyi sems kyi mdun phyogs nas de nyid kyi thugs ka nyid du zhugs par bsam zhes pa'o //
analyzed: slar byon nas byang chub kyi sems kyi mdun phyogs nas de nyid kyi thugs ka nyid du zhugs par bsam zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, having returned, one should imagine that it enters into the heart of the Bodhisattva Vajra Mind, in front of the Bodhisattva Mind of Enlightenment.

original: de la zhugs par dang byas nas //
analyzed: de la zhugs par dang byas nas //
translated: Having entered there,

original: rdo rje sems ni rnam par bsam //
analyzed: rdo rje sems ni rnam par bsam //
translated: one should imagine the Vajra Mind.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa dang byang chub sems rdo rje gnyis su med par gyur ma thag tu byang chub sems rdo rje snga ma'i tshul spangs nas rdo rjer gyur par bsam zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni de ltar bcom ldan 'das mi bskyod pa dang byang chub sems rdo rje gnyis su med par gyur ma thag tu byang chub sems rdo rje snga ma'i tshul spangs nas rdo rjer gyur par bsam zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this and the following is that, in this way, as soon as the Lord Akshobhya and the Bodhisattva Vajra Mind become nondual, one should imagine that the Bodhisattva Vajra Mind abandons his former mode and becomes a vajra.

original: aindra n'i la'i 'od 'dra ba ni zhe sdang rdo rje'i sku mdog bstan te mi bskyod pa dang 'dra bar gnag pa las cung zang skya ba'o //
analyzed: aindra n'i la'i 'od 'dra ba ni zhe sdang rdo rje'i sku mdog bstan te mi bskyod pa dang 'dra bar gnag pa las cung zang skya ba'o //
translated: Having the luster of sapphire indicates the color of the body of the Vajra Mind of Hatred, which is black like Akshobhya, but slightly pale.

original: zhal gdangs mche ba gtsigs pas 'jigs //
analyzed: zhal gdangs mche ba gtsigs pas 'jigs //
translated: With open mouth and bared fangs, he is terrifying.

original: zhes pa ni sems can yang dag ba'i lta ba spangs nas log par spyod pa rnams de las bzlog par dgongs nas 'jigs par byed pa'i rtags su khros pa'i cha lugs shin tu yang che bar bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems can yang dag ba'i lta ba spangs nas log par spyod pa rnams de las bzlog par dgongs nas 'jigs par byed pa'i rtags su khros pa'i cha lugs shin tu yang che bar bstan pa'i don to //
translated: This means that, intending to turn away from that those sentient beings who have abandoned the right view and engage in perverse conduct, he displays a very great wrathful aspect as a sign of fear.

original: yang na srin po ma rungs pa dang lha nga rgyal che ba rnams 'dul ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na srin po ma rungs pa dang lha nga rgyal che ba rnams 'dul ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, it means for the purpose of subduing the wicked rƒÅk·π£asas and the haughty gods.

original: mi 'khrugs 'bar ba spyi bor 'chang //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs 'bar ba spyi bor 'chang //
translated: He holds the blazing Ak·π£obhya on his crown.

original: zhes pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje de ltar phyi khros pa'i tshul ston kyang thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems dang ma bral ba'i rtags su byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje de ltar phyi khros pa'i tshul ston kyang thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems dang ma bral ba'i rtags su byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that although he displays such an external wrathful manner, he is not separated from the nature of great compassion and the thought of awakening. This is a sign that he is of the nature of the thought of awakening.

original: yang na chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pas bdag po'i tshul lo //
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pas bdag po'i tshul lo //
translated: Or else, he is in the manner of a lord because he is the nature of all phenomena.

original: 'jig rten khams kun 'khrugs par mdzad //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams kun 'khrugs par mdzad //
translated: He agitates all the worldly realms.

original: ces pa ni gong du bstan pa'i sems can rnams 'jigs par byed cing dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni gong du bstan pa'i sems can rnams 'jigs par byed cing dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: This means that he terrifies and subjugates the beings taught above.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa //
translated: In the middle of the sun mandala,

original: nyi ma bye pa phrag brgya'i 'od //
analyzed: nyi ma bye pa phrag brgya'i 'od //
translated: the light of a hundred million suns,

original: ces pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la bzhugs shing /
analyzed: ces pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la bzhugs shing /
translated: This means that he sits on a sun mandala seat,

original: nyi ma de tsam gyi 'od dang 'dra bar sku las 'od 'phro zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyi ma de tsam gyi 'od dang 'dra bar sku las 'od 'phro zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gsal bar byed pa'i don to //
translated: and that his body radiates light like that of a sun of that magnitude, illuminating the world systems.

original: dmar po spyan ni 'jigs pa che //üîΩzhes pa ni sems can thams @133a * //
analyzed: dmar po spyan ni 'jigs pa che // zhes pa ni sems can thams @133a * //
translated: His red eyes are very frightening.üîΩThis means that he shows red eyes out of compassion for all beings,

original: cad la thugs rjes chags shing 'jigs par byed pas spyan dmar por ston pa dang / yum la chags shing bde ba chen po nyams su blang bar bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cad la thugs rjes chags shing 'jigs par byed pas spyan dmar por ston pa dang / yum la chags shing bde ba chen po nyams su blang bar bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because he wishes to enjoy the passion of the consort and experience great bliss.

original: rgyan rnams kun zhes pa ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //üîΩkhro gnyer zhi ba 'dod chags che //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun zhes pa ni gong ma dang 'dra'o // khro gnyer zhi ba 'dod chags che //
translated: All ornaments means the same as above.

original: zhal gsum dag ni rnam par 'chang //
analyzed: zhal gsum dag ni rnam par 'chang //
translated: He has three faces, with frowns, peaceful, and very passionate,

original: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang rdo rje zhal gsum dang ldan zhes ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang rdo rje zhal gsum dang ldan zhes ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúwrathful vajra with three faces.‚Äù

analyzed: de yang dbus zhe sdang gi rigs kyi rang bzhin yin pas khro gnyer mang zhing gnag pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since the middle face is the nature of the family of wrath, it is wrathful and black.

original: g-yas gti mug gi rigs kyi rang bzhin yin pas dkar zhing zhi ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas gti mug gi rigs kyi rang bzhin yin pas dkar zhing zhi ba'o //
translated: Since the right face is the nature of the family of delusion, it is white and peaceful.

original: g-yon 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin yin pas dmar zhing 'dod chags che ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon 'dod chags kyi rang bzhin yin pas dmar zhing 'dod chags che ba'o //
translated: Since the left face is the nature of passion, it is red and passionate.

original: rang gi dam tshig mnyam par ldan //
analyzed: rang gi dam tshig mnyam par ldan //
translated: He is endowed with his own pledge,

original: zhes pa ni yum dang gnyis su med par bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yum dang gnyis su med par bzhugs pa'o //
translated: meaning that he abides in nonduality with the mother.

original: phyag drug ni mi bskyod pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phyag drug ni mi bskyod pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The six arms are like those of Ak·π£obhya.

original: 'dzam bu na da'i 'od 'dra ba //
analyzed: 'dzam bu na da'i 'od 'dra ba //
translated: His color is like the color of the jyoti·π£ka gem,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje'i phyag g-yas kyi dang po rdo rje rtse dgu pa kha dog gser dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje'i phyag g-yas kyi dang po rdo rje rtse dgu pa kha dog gser dang 'dra ba /
translated: and so forth. The first right hand of Wrathful Vajra holds a nine-pronged vajra the color of gold.

original: rigs lnga la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi sku phra mo 'od zer bzhin du rdo rje nyid las 'phro zhing dkrigs pa cig bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: rigs lnga la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi sku phra mo 'od zer bzhin du rdo rje nyid las 'phro zhing dkrigs pa cig bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one meditates on the subtle bodies of the deities of the mandala, such as the five families, emanating and gathering like light rays from the vajra itself.

original: sngar gsungs pa yi rim bzhin du //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa yi rim bzhin du //
translated: As previously taught,

original: phyag rgya phyi ma rnam par bsgom //
analyzed: phyag rgya phyi ma rnam par bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the subsequent seals.

original: zhes pa ni phyi ma phyag rgya lnga la gong du mi bskyod pa'i phyag mtshan du bstan pa bzhin du bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyi ma phyag rgya lnga la gong du mi bskyod pa'i phyag mtshan du bstan pa bzhin du bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on the subsequent five seals as taught above as the insignia of Ak·π£obhya.

original: zhe sdang rdo rjer byin brlabs nas //
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rjer byin brlabs nas //
translated: Having consecrated oneself as Hatred Vajra,

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par spro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par spro //
translated: one should emanate the entire mandala.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar bdag zhe sdang rdo rjer bsgoms nas yum dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor byas la gong ma bzhin du byang chub sems las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad so so'i
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bdag zhe sdang rdo rjer bsgoms nas yum dang gnyis su med pa'i sbyor byas la gong ma bzhin du byang chub sems las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad so so'i
translated: The meaning is that having thus meditated on oneself as Hatred Vajra, one should perform the yoga of union with the consort, and as above, from the bodhicitta, one should generate and emanate all the deities of the mandala that will be taught below, such as the BhagavƒÅn Vairocana, and so on, from their individual

original: sa bon las ba skyed cing spro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon las ba skyed cing spro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: seed syllables.

original: aom dzi na dzik ces pa'i sngags 'dis gti mug gi rigs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bskul zhing bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: aom dzi na dzik ces pa'i sngags 'dis gti mug gi rigs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bskul zhing bskyed par bya'o //
translated: One should invoke and generate the Tathagata of the passion family with the mantra Om Jinavajra.

original: de la 'dzin ni dus gsum gyi rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dzin ni dus gsum gyi rgyal ba'o //
translated: Here, Jin means the Victorious Ones of the three times.

original: dzik ni de rnams kyi sku'i ngo bor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dzik ni de rnams kyi sku'i ngo bor gnas pa'o //
translated: Vajra means that they abide in the nature of body.

original: yang na 'dzin ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad nyid la bya /
analyzed: yang na 'dzin ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad nyid la bya /
translated: Alternatively, Jin means the Lord Vairocana himself.

original: dzik ni gzugs kyi dngos po thams cad du khyab pa'o //
analyzed: dzik ni gzugs kyi dngos po thams cad du khyab pa'o //
translated: Vajra means that he pervades all things of form.

original: sa bon las ni bskyed bya ba //
analyzed: sa bon las ni bskyed bya ba //
translated: One should generate from the seedüîΩVairocana, the chief,

original: rnam par snang mdzad gtso bo zhes pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje yab yum @133b gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems las aom dkar po dmigs la de las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad khams gsum gyi mchog tu gyur pa gong ma'i tshul bskyed par bya
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad gtso bo zhes pa ni zhe sdang rdo rje yab yum @133b gnyis su med pa'i byang chub sems las aom dkar po dmigs la de las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad khams gsum gyi mchog tu gyur pa gong ma'i tshul bskyed par bya
translated: means that one visualizes a white Om from the bodhicitta of the nondual union of the father, the vajra of anger, and the mother, and that one generates the Lord Vairocana, the best of the three realms, in the manner above.

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: zhi ba'i cha lugs dag dang ldan //
analyzed: zhi ba'i cha lugs dag dang ldan //
translated: Endowed with a peaceful appearance,

original: zhes pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang khro gnyer la sogs pa'i tshul med pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhe sdang la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang khro gnyer la sogs pa'i tshul med pa'i don to //
translated: This means that he is free from the afflictions such as hatred, and from the ways of frowning, and so on.

original: phyogs bcu thams cad snang bar mdzad pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyi sems mi shes pa'i mun bas khabs pa rnams la bsam pa dang mthun pa'i sgo nas chos ston cing ye shes kyi snang ba bskyed pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu thams cad snang bar mdzad pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams kyi sems mi shes pa'i mun bas khabs pa rnams la bsam pa dang mthun pa'i sgo nas chos ston cing ye shes kyi snang ba bskyed pa dang /
translated: Illuminating all the ten directions means that he teaches the Dharma in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings in the world systems of the ten directions, who are covered by the darkness of ignorance about the mind, and generates the light of wisdom.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mun par snang ba thams cad sku'i 'od kyis gsal bar mdzad pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mun par snang ba thams cad sku'i 'od kyis gsal bar mdzad pa'i don to //
translated: It means that he illuminates with the light of his body all the light in the darkness of the world systems of the ten directions.

original: ston ka'i 'dam bu'i 'od 'dra ba ni ston ka'i dus kyi 'dam bu'i tshul bzhin du sku mdog shin tu dkar ba'o //
analyzed: ston ka'i 'dam bu'i 'od 'dra ba ni ston ka'i dus kyi 'dam bu'i tshul bzhin du sku mdog shin tu dkar ba'o //
translated: Like the light of autumn lotuses means that his body is very white, like the appearance of lotuses in the autumn season.

original: ral pa'i cod pan dag gis brgyan //
analyzed: ral pa'i cod pan dag gis brgyan //
translated: Adorned with a crown of hair tufts

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ni gong ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: and so on is the same as above.

original: dkar dang gnag dang dmar chen po //
analyzed: dkar dang gnag dang dmar chen po //
translated: White, black, and great red

original: kha dog gsum po zhal gsum po //
analyzed: kha dog gsum po zhal gsum po //
translated: are the three colors of the three faces.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das de yang kha dog gsum gyi zhal gsum dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das de yang kha dog gsum gyi zhal gsum dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the BhagavƒÅn has three faces with three colors.

original: de yang zhal dbus ma sku dang mthun par dkar la g-yas gnag cing g-yon dmar ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhal dbus ma sku dang mthun par dkar la g-yas gnag cing g-yon dmar ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the central face is white, in accordance with the body, the right is black, and the left is red.

original: zhal gsum dang phyag drug la sogs pa'i don gong du bstan pa'i byang chub sems rdo rje dang mthun no //

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i rtags dang 'gro ba rnams kyi yid du 'ong bar bya ba'i phyir me tog tsam pa ka la sogs pa'i thang las skyes pa rnams dang / autpala la sogs pa'i chu las skyes pa rnams spel zhing phreng ba byas pas dbu la rgyan gyi tshul du byas pa'o //
