translated: This is the garland of flowers, such as the campaka and so on, which are born from the land, and the utpala and so on, which are born from the water, which are spread out and made into a garland, and which are used as an ornament on the head, in order to be a sign of possessing all the qualities of the Buddha and in order to be pleasing to the minds of beings.

original: dkar dang gnag dang dmar chen po //
analyzed: dkar dang gnag dang dmar chen po //
translated: White, black, and great red,

original: zhal gsum pa ni rab tu 'bar //
analyzed: zhal gsum pa ni rab tu 'bar //
translated: the three faces are blazing.

original: zhes pa ni zhal gsum gyi kha dog ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang mthun no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zhal gsum gyi kha dog ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang mthun no //
translated: The three faces have the same color as the Lord Vairocana.

original: 'bar ba ni 'od zer 'phro ba'o //üîΩcha lugs rgyan dang ldan pa ste //
analyzed: 'bar ba ni 'od zer 'phro ba'o // cha lugs rgyan dang ldan pa ste //
translated: Blazing means radiating light rays.üîΩEndowed with the costume and ornaments,

original: de ni sku mdog la sogs pa'i cha lugs dbu rgyan la sogs ba'i rgyan rnams kyis shin tu yang mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sku mdog la sogs pa'i cha lugs dbu rgyan la sogs ba'i rgyan rnams kyis shin tu yang mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: he is made very beautiful by the costume, such as the color of the body, and by the ornaments, such as the crown.

original: 'od zer dkar pos kun du 'khrigs pa ni sku dang mthun pa'i 'od zer 'byung bas kun nas dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer dkar pos kun du 'khrigs pa ni sku dang mthun pa'i 'od zer 'byung bas kun nas dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: The white light rays that completely fill it are the light rays that are in harmony with the body, abiding in the manner of a mandala.üîΩOne should visualize the six-armed one

original: rgyan rnams kun dang ldan pa yi //üîΩphyag drug pa ni rnam par bsam //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun dang ldan pa yi // phyag drug pa ni rnam par bsam //
translated: endowed with all the ornaments.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i rgyan dang ldan pa de phyag drug dang ldan par bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i rgyan dang ldan pa de phyag drug dang ldan par bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: This means that one should generate the one endowed with such ornaments as having six arms.

original: lha mo 'khor lo rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: lha mo 'khor lo rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: The goddess holds a wheel and a vajra,

original: autpala dkar po phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: autpala dkar po phyag na bsnams //
translated: and holds a white utpala in her hand.

original: rin chen sdong bu yid 'ong dang // dril bu ral gri g-yon par mtshon //
analyzed: rin chen sdong bu yid 'ong dang // dril bu ral gri g-yon par mtshon //
translated: The beautiful jewel stem, the bell, and the sword are shown in the left [hands].

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag drug la phyag mtshan de drug rim pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag drug la phyag mtshan de drug rim pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the six hand implements in the six arms in order.

original: de bzhin snying ga nas byung nas //
analyzed: de bzhin snying ga nas byung nas //
translated: In the same way, having arisen from the heart,

original: phyogs bcu dag tu rnam par gzigs pa yang gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag tu rnam par gzigs pa yang gong ma bzhin no //
translated: one should look in the ten directions as before.

original: gdon nad na ba'i sems can rnams //
analyzed: gdon nad na ba'i sems can rnams //
translated: The sentient beings who are afflicted by spirits and illness

original: zhi ba'i gnas kyis zhi bar mdzad //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gnas kyis zhi bar mdzad //
translated: are pacified by the place of peace.

original: ces pa ni lha mo lo tsa na'i khyad par gyi phrin las zhi ba yin pas /
analyzed: ces pa ni lha mo lo tsa na'i khyad par gyi phrin las zhi ba yin pas /
translated: This is the special pacifying activity of goddess LocanƒÅ.

original: gdon nad @137b kyis zin nas na ba'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zhi ba'i sgo nas zhi bar mdzad cing phan 'dogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: gdon nad @137b kyis zin nas na ba'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zhi ba'i sgo nas zhi bar mdzad cing phan 'dogs pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it means that she pacifies and benefits sentient beings who are afflicted by the suffering of being seized by the illness of spirits.

original: snang mdzad de ni slar gshegs nas //
analyzed: snang mdzad de ni slar gshegs nas //
translated: Then, having returned,

original: dang ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //
analyzed: dang ba'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //
translated: in the center of the pure ma·πá·∏çala,

original: shar gyi grvar ni bzhugs nas kyang //
analyzed: shar gyi grvar ni bzhugs nas kyang //
translated: having sat in the eastern corner,

original: rdo rje mgon ni gzigs par mdzad //
analyzed: rdo rje mgon ni gzigs par mdzad //
translated: the vajra lord looks.

original: ces pa ni de ltar sems can gyi don mdzad ma thag tu slar byon nas dkyil 'khor gyi shar lho mtshams kyi nang gi re'u'i cha zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gtso bo la chags pa'i tshul gyis blta zhing bzhugs par bsgom pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar sems can gyi don mdzad ma thag tu slar byon nas dkyil 'khor gyi shar lho mtshams kyi nang gi re'u'i cha zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gtso bo la chags pa'i tshul gyis blta zhing bzhugs par bsgom pa'i don to //
translated: As such, having immediately performed the benefit of sentient beings, having returned, one should meditate on the meaning of the goddess residing in the eastern corner of the inner enclosure of the ma·πá·∏çala, on top of a moon ma·πá·∏çala, looking at the principal one with a passionate expression.

original: r'a ga ra ti /
analyzed: r'a ga ra ti /
translated: RƒÅgarati.

original: gsang sngags las ni grub pa yi //
analyzed: gsang sngags las ni grub pa yi //
translated: The one who is accomplished from the secret mantra

original: gos dkar mo ni bskyed par bya //
analyzed: gos dkar mo ni bskyed par bya //
translated: should generate PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngags 'dis bskul zhing yi ge pam las lha mo gos dkar mo gong ma bzhin du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngags 'dis bskul zhing yi ge pam las lha mo gos dkar mo gong ma bzhin du bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is the invocation with the mantra. One should generate the goddess PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´ from the syllable pa·πÉ as before.

original: zhal mdzes spyan ni ring ba ste //
analyzed: zhal mdzes spyan ni ring ba ste //
translated: Beautiful face, long eyes,

original: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas lha dang mi las 'phags par mdzes shing yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas lha dang mi las 'phags par mdzes shing yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: Since she is the nature of gnosis, she is beautiful and pleasing, superior to gods and humans.

original: padma r'a ga'i mdog 'dra ba ni sku mdog shin tu dmar ba'o //
analyzed: padma r'a ga'i mdog 'dra ba ni sku mdog shin tu dmar ba'o //
translated: The color of a ruby is a very red body color.

original: zhal gsum dag ni bzhad pa'i zhal //
analyzed: zhal gsum dag ni bzhad pa'i zhal //
translated: Three faces, a smiling face,

original: zhes pa ni lha mo de yang zhal gsum dang ldan la sems can don la shin tu yang dga' ba 'am 'dod chags slong ba'i rang bzhin yin pas rtag tu bzhad tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha mo de yang zhal gsum dang ldan la sems can don la shin tu yang dga' ba 'am 'dod chags slong ba'i rang bzhin yin pas rtag tu bzhad tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: That goddess also has three faces. Since she is very fond of the welfare of sentient beings, or since she is the nature of arousing passion, she always remains in a smiling manner.

original: dmar dang gnag dang dkar ba ni//
analyzed: dmar dang gnag dang dkar ba ni//
translated: Red, black, and white,

original: snang ba mtha' yas dang mthun no //üîΩsnang ba mtha' yas cod pan gnas //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas dang mthun no // snang ba mtha' yas cod pan gnas //
translated: are in harmony with AmitƒÅbha.üîΩThe crown is AmitƒÅbha.

original: thams cad rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: thams cad rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: All are adorned with ornaments.

original: zhes pa gong ma bzhin du snang ba mtha' yas dbang bskur ba'i tshul du gnas pa dang / dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan thams cad dang ldan pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa gong ma bzhin du snang ba mtha' yas dbang bskur ba'i tshul du gnas pa dang / dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan thams cad dang ldan pa'i don to //
translated: As above, this means that one should visualize the consecration of Amitabha, and that one should visualize all the ornaments such as the crown.

original: rdzu 'phrul mtshan las kun du 'byung //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mtshan las kun du 'byung //
translated: The miracles arise from the marks.

original: zhes pa ni sku'i mtshan rnams las sems can 'dul bar byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung zhing 'gro ba'i don byed ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku'i mtshan rnams las sems can 'dul bar byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung zhing 'gro ba'i don byed ces pa'o //
translated: This means that various miracles of the miracle of psychic power, which tame sentient beings, arise from the marks of the body, and one should work for the welfare of living beings.

original: 'dod chags dmar po 'chang dga' ba ni /üîΩsems can gyi don la chags pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dmar po 'chang dga' ba ni / sems can gyi don la chags pa'am /
translated: The one who delights in holding the red passion

original: 'dod chags dmar po ni bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas yin pa de dang gnyis su med pa'i bde bas rtag tu gnas pa'i 'dod pa ni 'chang ba la dga' ba zhes pa'o //üîΩmtshan rnams thams cad kun rdzogs pa //
analyzed: 'dod chags dmar po ni bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas yin pa de dang gnyis su med pa'i bde bas rtag tu gnas pa'i 'dod pa ni 'chang ba la dga' ba zhes pa'o // mtshan rnams thams cad kun rdzogs pa //
translated: is the one who delights in holding the passion, which is the bliss of non-duality with the red passion, the Bhagavat Amitabha, and always abiding in that.üîΩOne should visualize the six arms

original: phyag drug rnam par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: phyag drug rnam par bsgom par bya //
translated: of the one who is complete with all the marks.

original: zhes pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa'i mtshan @138a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sum cu rtsa gnyis la sogs pa'i mtshan @138a * //
translated: These are the thirty-two major marks and so on.üîΩ

original: dang dpe byad rnams sku la rdzogs pa dang / phyag drug dang ldan par brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang dpe byad rnams sku la rdzogs pa dang / phyag drug dang ldan par brjod pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the thirty-two major marks and so forth are complete on his body, and that he is described as having six arms.

original: g-yon pa 'gying bas dril bu dang / sdong bu lor bcas autpala 'dzin //
analyzed: g-yon pa 'gying bas dril bu dang / sdong bu lor bcas autpala 'dzin //
translated: The left holds a bell with a proud gesture, and a lotus stalk with a leaf.

original: zhes pa ni phyag g-yon gyi dang po dril bu dang autpala yu ba bcas par 'gying bag tu 'dzin pa'o//üîΩsgra dang bcas pa g-yas pa yis //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag g-yon gyi dang po dril bu dang autpala yu ba bcas par 'gying bag tu 'dzin pa'o// sgra dang bcas pa g-yas pa yis //
translated: This means that the first of the left hands holds a bell and a lotus stalk with a proud gesture.

original: autpala dmar po kha yang 'byed //
analyzed: autpala dmar po kha yang 'byed //
translated: The right hand opens the red lotus with a sound.

original: ces pa ni phyag g-yas kyi dang pos autpala la de nyid kyi kha skrag pa'i tshul du 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni phyag g-yas kyi dang pos autpala la de nyid kyi kha skrag pa'i tshul du 'byed pa'o //
translated: This means that the first of the right hands opens the lotus with the sound of its petals opening.

original: g-yas gnyis rdo rje 'khor lo 'dzin //
analyzed: g-yas gnyis rdo rje 'khor lo 'dzin //
translated: The two right hands hold a vajra and a wheel,

original: g-yon gnyis nor bu ral gri 'chang ba ni rim ba bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yon gnyis nor bu ral gri 'chang ba ni rim ba bzhin no //
translated: and the two left hands hold a jewel and a sword, respectively.

original: snying ga nas ni byung gyur nas //
analyzed: snying ga nas ni byung gyur nas //
translated: Having emerged from the heart,

original: thams cad phyogs su rnam par gzigs pa yang gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad phyogs su rnam par gzigs pa yang gong ma bzhin no //
translated: he looks in all directions, just as before.

original: gza' tshogs kyis skams sems can rnams //
analyzed: gza' tshogs kyis skams sems can rnams //
translated: The planets and constellations dry up living beings.

original: tshe dang longs spyod rgyas par mdzad //
analyzed: tshe dang longs spyod rgyas par mdzad //
translated: They increase life and enjoyments.

original: ces pa ni lha mo 'di'i khyad par gyi phrin las rgyas pa yin pas gza' la sogs pa bgegs kyis bzung nas sha skams shing sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / tshe thung zhing bsod nams chung ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal dang bar chad rnams med par byed cing tshe ring ba dang bsod nams rgya che ba dang /
analyzed: ces pa ni lha mo 'di'i khyad par gyi phrin las rgyas pa yin pas gza' la sogs pa bgegs kyis bzung nas sha skams shing sdug bsngal ba rnams dang / tshe thung zhing bsod nams chung ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal dang bar chad rnams med par byed cing tshe ring ba dang bsod nams rgya che ba dang /
translated: This is the special activity of this goddess, which is increasing. Therefore, she removes the suffering and obstacles of those who are seized by obstacles such as the planets and so forth, who are emaciated and suffering, who have short lives and little merit.

original: nor rdzas la sogs pa'i longs spyod rgyas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: nor rdzas la sogs pa'i longs spyod rgyas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: She makes their lives long, their merit vast, and their enjoyments such as wealth and possessions increase.

original: slar gshegs padma'i dbus su ni ;
analyzed: slar gshegs padma'i dbus su ni ;
translated: Having returned, she sits in the center of the lotus

original: / nub phyogs kyi ni grvar yang bzhugs //
analyzed: / nub phyogs kyi ni grvar yang bzhugs //
translated: in the southwest corner.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar mdzad nas slar byon nas dkyil 'khor de'i nub byang gi mtshams su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gong ma'i tshul du bzhugs pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar mdzad nas slar byon nas dkyil 'khor de'i nub byang gi mtshams su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gong ma'i tshul du bzhugs pa'i don to //
translated: Having done that, she returns and sits in the northwest corner of that mandala on a moon mandala in the manner above.

original: badzra r'a ti /
analyzed: badzra r'a ti /
translated: Vajrarati.

original: gsang sngags las ni grub pa yi //
analyzed: gsang sngags las ni grub pa yi //
translated: And the accomplishments of secret mantra.üîΩ

original: lha mo sgrol ma mkhas pas bskyed //
analyzed: lha mo sgrol ma mkhas pas bskyed //
translated: By the mantra, the wise one generates the goddess Tara,üîΩthe accomplished one.

original: ces pa ni sngags 'dis bskal zhing gong ma'i tshul du yi ge tam las las kyi rigs kyi yum lha mo sgrol ma bskyed ces pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni sngags 'dis bskal zhing gong ma'i tshul du yi ge tam las las kyi rigs kyi yum lha mo sgrol ma bskyed ces pa'o //
translated: This means that by this mantra, the wise one generates the goddess Tara, the mother of the karma family, from the syllable tam, in the manner of the previous ones.

original: yan lag mtshan rnams kun dang ldan pa ni sku'i yan lag dang nyid lag rnams lha dang mi las 'phags pa dang / mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rnams kyis sku la shin tu brgyan pa'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag mtshan rnams kun dang ldan pa ni sku'i yan lag dang nyid lag rnams lha dang mi las 'phags pa dang / mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu rnams kyis sku la shin tu brgyan pa'i don to //
translated: Possessing all the characteristics of the limbs means that the limbs and minor limbs of the body are superior to those of gods and humans, and that the body is well adorned with the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks.

original: yang yan lag ni sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan gyi yan lag la yang bya'o //
analyzed: yang yan lag ni sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan gyi yan lag la yang bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the limbs should also be taken as the limbs of the great qualities of the Buddha.

original: bud med ma lus spyos mdzad brtson //
analyzed: bud med ma lus spyos mdzad brtson //
translated: The wise one generates the goddess Tara, the accomplished one, who is diligent in defiling all women.

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa gong gis lha mo'am klu mo la sogs pa @138b dbang du byed par 'dod cing bsgrubs na de'i dngos grub khyad par du yang grub par mdzad pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa gong gis lha mo'am klu mo la sogs pa @138b dbang du byed par 'dod cing bsgrubs na de'i dngos grub khyad par du yang grub par mdzad pa'i don to //
translated: This means that if the practitioner desires to bring a goddess, naga woman, or others under control and accomplishes them, he will accomplish their special powers.

original: mdzes pa'i zhal ni spyan ring ba ni gong du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i zhal ni spyan ring ba ni gong du bshad pa yin no //
translated: The beautiful face is long-eyed, as explained above.

original: margat ser po'i mdog 'dra ba ni sku mdog rin po che margat bzhin ljang ba las cung zad ser ba'o //
analyzed: margat ser po'i mdog 'dra ba ni sku mdog rin po che margat bzhin ljang ba las cung zad ser ba'o //
translated: The color is like a yellow emerald, the color of the body is green like an emerald, but a little yellow.

original: gdon mi za bas cod pan mdzad //
analyzed: gdon mi za bas cod pan mdzad //
translated: He is adorned with a crown of hair on the head,

original: ces pa ni bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pas spyi bor dbang bskur ba'i tshul du bsam pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa ni bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pas spyi bor dbang bskur ba'i tshul du bsam pa'i don to //
translated: which means that one should think of him as being crowned by the Blessed Amoghasiddhi.

original: me tog phreng gi cod pan dkris pa ni gong bzhin no //üîΩljang gu gnag dang dkar ba yi //
analyzed: me tog phreng gi cod pan dkris pa ni gong bzhin no // ljang gu gnag dang dkar ba yi //
translated: The crown of a garland of flowers is as above.

original: zhal gsum gyis ni rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: zhal gsum gyis ni rnam par brgyan //
translated: He has three faces, green, black, and white,

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa dang mthun pa'i kha dog gsum gyi zhal gsum dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das don yod grub pa dang mthun pa'i kha dog gsum gyi zhal gsum dang ldan pa'o //
translated: which means that he has three faces with the three colors corresponding to the Blessed Amoghasiddhi.

original: rgyan rnams thams cad kun rdzogs ni dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis sku shin tu spras pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad kun rdzogs ni dbu rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis sku shin tu spras pa'o //
translated: He is completely adorned with all ornaments, his body is well adorned with all ornaments such as a crown.

original: phyag drug par ni bsam par bya ba ni de lta bu de phyag drug dang ldan par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: phyag drug par ni bsam par bya ba ni de lta bu de phyag drug dang ldan par bsgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the six-armed one is as follows: The meditation on the six-armed one is the meditation on the one just described as having six arms.

original: rdo rje rgya gram 'khor lo dang // autpala dmar po phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: rdo rje rgya gram 'khor lo dang // autpala dmar po phyag na bsnams //
translated: He holds a vajra cross, a wheel, and a red lotus in his hands.

original: zhes pa ni g-yas kyi phyag gsum la rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni g-yas kyi phyag gsum la rim pa bzhin no //
translated: This is in his three right hands, respectively.

original: g-yon pa 'gying bas dril bu dang // rin chen ral gri chen po bsnams pa yang rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yon pa 'gying bas dril bu dang // rin chen ral gri chen po bsnams pa yang rim pa bzhin no //
translated: In his three left hands he holds a bell with a proud gesture, a jewel, and a great sword, respectively.

original: chen po ni khyad par yin pas kun la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: chen po ni khyad par yin pas kun la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The ‚Äúgreat‚Äù is a distinction, so it applies to all.

original: snying ga nas ni byung gyur nas //üîΩ'dod chags zhe sdang gis rmongs pa'i //üîΩ'od zer gyis ni reg tsam gyis //
analyzed: snying ga nas ni byung gyur nas // 'dod chags zhe sdang gis rmongs pa'i // 'od zer gyis ni reg tsam gyis //
translated: Having emerged from his heart,üîΩhe subjugates all beings

original: sems can thams cad dbang du mdzad //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dbang du mdzad //
translated: merely by the touch of his light rays,üîΩthose who are deluded by passion and hatred.

original: ces pa ni gong ma rnams dang mthun par gsang ba'i thugs ka nas phyung nas ;
analyzed: ces pa ni gong ma rnams dang mthun par gsang ba'i thugs ka nas phyung nas ;
translated: This is in accord with the above. Having emerged from his secret heart center,

original: sems can gyi don phrin las kun gyi sgo nas mdzad kyang khyad par du dbang gi sgo nas mdzad ces ston to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don phrin las kun gyi sgo nas mdzad kyang khyad par du dbang gi sgo nas mdzad ces ston to //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i khro bo gong ma bzhin gsang ba'i thugs ka nas byung nas phyogs bcu'i sems can btul ma thag tu slar gshegs nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi gdan la tshangs pa chen po mnan pa'i tshul du nub kyi phyogs kyi sgor gnas

As soon as he has subdued the sentient beings of the ten directions, he returns and stands in the western door, pressing on Great BrahmƒÅ in the manner of standing on the sun ma·πá·∏çala.

translated: This means that by inciting with this mantra, one should generate the wrathful Am·πõtaku·πá·∏çali from the syllable h≈´·πÉ, like the previous ones.

original: 'od zer stug 'phro 'bar ba yi //
analyzed: 'od zer stug 'phro 'bar ba yi //

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //

original: khro bo @143a * //

translated: This is similar to the above. Having emerged from the secret heart center, she acts for the welfare of sentient beings in the ten directions. As soon as she has done so, she returns and is visualized standing in the northern door of the mandala, on a seat of a sun mandala, in the posture of drawn up and extended, above the obstacle king Vinayaka.

original: khro gnyer dam tshig gsung ba ni //
analyzed: khro gnyer dam tshig gsung ba ni //

original: ro langs gzhan gyis mi thub pa //
analyzed: ro langs gzhan gyis mi thub pa //

analyzed: khro gnyer ral ba gcig ma ste //

original: lha mo 'di dag rab tu grags //
analyzed: lha mo 'di dag rab tu grags //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'i sgo bzhi'i khro bo rnams kyi gzugs bstan te /

analyzed: de la dam tshig ces pa ni lha mo 'di rnams dang khro bo de dag rtag tu gnyis su med pa'i tshul las mi 'da' bas so //
translated: Here, ‚Äúpledge‚Äù means that these goddesses and those wrathful ones never transgress the mode of being indivisible.

analyzed: de la ro langs ma ni gshin rje gshed kyi'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni mnyam sbyor bas //

analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil krung gnas pa ste //

analyzed: zhes pas ni dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams 'dug pa bstan te /

translated: There, the five Buddhas of the families are in union with their consorts, the sign of which is that they are seated in the bodhisattva posture.

original: byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gsungs //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gsungs //

translated: The Bodhisattvas are also in union with their consorts, so like the above, they are in the bodhisattva posture.

analyzed: khro mo ni g-yon brkyang la g-yas bskum pa'i don to //

analyzed: thams cad dam tshig bzhis rgyas btab zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor dag ni dkyil 'khor dag ni bskyed pa'i lha rigs lnga'i de @143b bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad phyag rgya bzhi dang ldan pas dam tshig bzhi rgyas btab ces bya'o //
translated: All the mandalas that are generated are the five families of deities. All the tathagatas are sealed with the four pledges endowed with the four seals.

original: de la phyag rgya bzhi ni so so'i mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pa'i cha lugs kyis sku'i ngo bor gnas pa nyid phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: de la phyag rgya bzhi ni so so'i mtshan dang dpe byad la sogs pa'i cha lugs kyis sku'i ngo bor gnas pa nyid phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: The four seals are as follows: The great seal is the abiding in the nature of the body by means of the individual major and minor marks and so forth.

original: yab yum dang ldan la yum yab dang ldan pa ni so so'i dam tshig yin pas so so'i dam tshig phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: yab yum dang ldan la yum yab dang ldan pa ni so so'i dam tshig yin pas so so'i dam tshig phyag rgya'o //
translated: The pledge seal is the individual pledge, the female deity in union with the male deity, the male deity in union with the female deity.

analyzed: de gnyis gnyis su med par sbyor ba'i bde ba chen po nyams su blangs pa ni chos nyid kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The practice of the great bliss that unites those two without duality is the reality seal.

original: de ltar nyams su blangs nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems las sems can ji ltar 'dul ba dang ldan mthun par sku spro shing don mdzad pa ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyams su blangs nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems las sems can ji ltar 'dul ba dang ldan mthun par sku spro shing don mdzad pa ni las kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: Having practiced in that way, the emanation of the body and performance of deeds in accordance with the dispositions of sentient beings from the nature of great bliss, bodhicitta, is the action seal.

original: de bzhi dang gong du bstan pa bzhi tshul bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhi dang gong du bstan pa bzhi tshul bzhin du shes par bya'o //

original: de ltar sbyor bas mnyam bsdus na //
analyzed: de ltar sbyor bas mnyam bsdus na //

original: phra mo'i sbyor ba brtsam par bya ba ni gong du bstan pa bzhin du dkyil 'khor du lha rnams bkod cing gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bzhugs par bsgoms nas 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du rdo rje phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phra mo'i sbyor ba brtsam par bya ba ni gong du bstan pa bzhin du dkyil 'khor du lha rnams bkod cing gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bzhugs par bsgoms nas 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul du rdo rje phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhaving meditated on the samƒÅdhi of the subtle vajra in the way that will be explained‚Äù is that one should meditate on the deities arranged in the ma·πá·∏çala in the manner of nonduality, as explained above.

analyzed: skabs 'dir phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Why is the samƒÅdhi of the subtle taught in this section?

original: yo ga la sogs pa'i chos 'og ma rnams kyi tshul ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu bzlas pa bya ba yin pas de dag dad mthun par bstan to //
analyzed: yo ga la sogs pa'i chos 'og ma rnams kyi tshul ni ting nge 'dzin gyi 'og tu bzlas pa bya ba yin pas de dag dad mthun par bstan to //
translated: The way of the lower Dharmas such as Yoga is to perform recitation after samƒÅdhi, so they are taught in accordance with that.

analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin yin pas phra mo'i sbyor ba ni bzlas par bstan to //
translated: Since the meditation on the ma·πá·∏çala is samƒÅdhi, the practice of the subtle is taught as recitation.

analyzed: yang na yan lag bzhi bzhir phye ba'i sgrub pa chen po'i bsnyen pa yin pas 'di ltar bstan to //
translated: Alternatively, since this is the approach of the great approach of the sƒÅdhana divided into four branches, it is taught in this way.

original: de la bzhi bzhir zhes pa ni //
analyzed: de la bzhi bzhir zhes pa ni //
translated: The four branches are as follows:

original: lus dang ngag yid rdo rje ni //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid rdo rje ni //

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: is the approach.

analyzed: bdag nyid rang bzhin med mthong nas //

analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ni bsnyen pa'o //

analyzed: yi ge rnam par bsgom par bya //

original: zhes pa nas //
analyzed: zhes pa nas //
translated: is the accomplishment.üîΩThe three syllables are considered to melt

analyzed: yi ge 'bru gsum zhu bar brtag / ces pa'i bar du ni bsnyen pa'i nye ba'i bsnyen pa'o //

analyzed: ye shes 'od zer rnam spros pas //
translated: The light rays of gnosis radiate

analyzed: zhes pa nas dharmma dh'a tu sngags kyi bar du ni bsnyen pa'i sgrub pa'o //

translated: The yogi should imagine a mustard seed at the tip of his nose and meditate on reality without his mind being distracted to any other thing until that [seed] becomes manifest.

original: de nas reg pa'am reg pa'i rtags sam mthong ba'am mthong ba'i rtags mngon sum du gyur pa dang spro zhing bsdu bar bya'o //

original: dang po gcig spro shing bsdus pa bzhin du gnyis nas @144b bcu dang brgya dang stong dang khri dang 'bum dang bye ba la sogs pa'i grangs dpag tu med pa'i bar du sems kyis lcogs tshad spro zhing bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: dang po gcig spro shing bsdus pa bzhin du gnyis nas @144b bcu dang brgya dang stong dang khri dang 'bum dang bye ba la sogs pa'i grangs dpag tu med pa'i bar du sems kyis lcogs tshad spro zhing bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Just as he expands and withdraws one [seed] at first, he should expand and withdraw as many as his mind can manage, from two up to a hundred, a thousand, ten thousand, a hundred thousand, a million, and so on, up to an immeasurable number.

original: de ltar spros shing bsdus pa brtan pa dang / yungs kar de'i nang du rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad so so'i bye brag dang bcas ba ma 'dres par bsam mo //
analyzed: de ltar spros shing bsdus pa brtan pa dang / yungs kar de'i nang du rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad so so'i bye brag dang bcas ba ma 'dres par bsam mo //
translated: In that way, when expanding and withdrawing is stable, he should imagine that all the worlds, moving and unmoving, with their individual distinctions, are unmixed within that mustard seed.

original: de ltar gnas pa de yang mngon sum du gsal bar ma gyur gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa de yang mngon sum du gsal bar ma gyur gyi bar du bsgom par bya'o //

original: gsal bar gyur pa dang gong ma bzhi na du gcig nas dpag tu med pa'i bar du spro zhing bsdu bas sems sbyangs la sgrub pa la 'jug par bya zhes pa'i don to //üîΩtshad med ye shes gnas thob phyir //üîΩgsang ba'i ye shes brtags pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ni de ltar sems las su rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs la sogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dang 'jig rten gyi yon tan dpag tu med pa thob par 'dod na thun mong ma yin pa dang
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa dang gong ma bzhi na du gcig nas dpag tu med pa'i bar du spro zhing bsdu bas sems sbyangs la sgrub pa la 'jug par bya zhes pa'i don to // tshad med ye shes gnas thob phyir // gsang ba'i ye shes brtags pa'o // zhes pa ni de ltar sems las su rung ba'i rnal 'byor pas dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs la sogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dang 'jig rten gyi yon tan dpag tu med pa thob par 'dod na thun mong ma yin pa dang
translated: When it becomes clear, one should enter into practice by training the mind through emanating and gathering from one up to immeasurable, as above.üîΩThe meaning is that one should meditate on the samƒÅdhi of the five colors, and so on, which is called ‚Äúsecret pristine consciousness‚Äù because it is difficult to attain and is not common.

original: / thob par dka' bas gsang ba'i ye shes zhes bya ste 'og nas 'byung ba'i kha dog lnga pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: / thob par dka' bas gsang ba'i ye shes zhes bya ste 'og nas 'byung ba'i kha dog lnga pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The yogƒ´ who has a serviceable mind, desiring to attain the supramundane qualities of the body, speech, mind, and so on, of glorious Vajrasattva and the immeasurably mundane qualities, should meditate on the samƒÅdhis that will arise below, such as the five colors, and so on, which is called ‚Äúsecret pristine consciousness‚Äù because it is difficult to attain and is not common.

original: kha dog lnga pa rin po che //
analyzed: kha dog lnga pa rin po che //
translated: The five-colored jewel

original: yungs kar sgom pa'i tshad tsam dag / sna yi rtse mor nan tan du //
analyzed: yungs kar sgom pa'i tshad tsam dag / sna yi rtse mor nan tan du //
translated: The size of a mustard seed,

original: rnal 'byor pas ni rtag tu bsgom //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni rtag tu bsgom //
translated: The yogi should always meditateüîΩAt the tip of the nose.

original: zhes pa ni rin po che'i rigs kyi sgo nas phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rin po che'i rigs kyi sgo nas phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the meditation on subtle concentration through the jewel family.

analyzed: bdag gzungs dang rin po che'i rigs kyi lha dang lha dang lha mo'i phyag rgyar bsgom zhing rdo rje dang padmar ldan pa gnyis su med par byas la gong gi yungs kar bzhin du ye shes lnga'i 'od zer 'bar ba yungs kar las cung zad che ba /
translated: Meditating on oneself as the deity of the jewel family, with the mudra of the male and female deities, united in vajra and lotus, nondual, like the mustard seed above, blazing with the light rays of the five wisdoms, slightly larger than the mustard seed,

original: bdag gis na'i rtse mor sems mi g-yeng bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis na'i rtse mor sems mi g-yeng bar bsgom par bya'o //

analyzed: brtan par gyur nas rin chen spro / brtan par ma gyur yong mi spro //
translated: When stable, emanate the jewels;üîΩWhen unstable, do not emanate.

analyzed: zhes pa ni gong ma ltar mngon sum du ma gyur par spro bar mi bya zhes pa'i don to //

original: de la spro ba'i tshul ni gsal bar mngon sum du gyur pa dang / sna'i bu gnas 'das shing snying gar gnas pa'i sna'i rtse mor byung zhing slar 'das nas thugs kar gnas /

original: snying ga nas sna'i rtse mor ro //
analyzed: snying ga nas sna'i rtse mor ro //

original: sangs rgyas 'od 'bar lta bu yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'od 'bar lta bu yi //

translated: This means that having thus emanated and reabsorbed, from the jewel located at the tip of the nose, one should emanate countless tiny bodies of male and female deities of the jewel family, endowed with light rays and light circles, and adorned with the qualities of the major and minor marks, like an actual body, like the jewel above, orüîΩa little larger than the jewel, in the manner of the above cloud.

analyzed: rin po che bas cung zad che ba grangs med pa sprin bzhin du gong ma'i tshul du spro bar bya ba'i don to //

original: autpala sngon po'i mdog 'dra ba //
analyzed: autpala sngon po'i mdog 'dra ba //
translated: The color of a blue lotus,

translated: A five-pointed vajra, the color of a vai·∏ç≈´rya gem, the nature of the five gnoses, radiating five-colored light, the size of a mere thumb, is visualized at the tip of one‚Äôs nose.

original: 'khor lo la sogs bye brag dag / de ltar bsgoms par brtag pa ste //

translated: One should meditate on the distinctions of the wheel and so forth,üîΩas explained above.

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong gi rin po che dang rdo rje bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs dang / padmo'i rigs dang / las kyi rigs bsgoms na yang 'khor lo dang padma dang / ral gri che chung sran ma tsam so so'i kha dog dang ldan pa /
translated: As with the gem and the vajra above, if one meditates on the TathƒÅgata family, the lotus family, and the action family, one should visualize a wheel, a lotus, and a sword, respectively, the size of a bean, with their respective colors.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin 'od 'phro ba gong ma bzhin du sna'i rtse mor bsam zhing spro bsdu la sogs pa bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin 'od 'phro ba gong ma bzhin du sna'i rtse mor bsam zhing spro bsdu la sogs pa bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should imagine the light radiating the nature of the five pristine awarenesses at the tip of the nose, as above, and perform the emanation and re-absorption, and so forth.

original: rdo rje 'khor lo sprin chen pos //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khor lo sprin chen pos //

original: padma 'dzin cing mtshon cha 'dzin //
analyzed: padma 'dzin cing mtshon cha 'dzin //

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje ni zhe sdang rdo rje'i'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje ni zhe sdang rdo rje'i'o //

analyzed: 'khor lo ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi'o //

analyzed: mdzod ni ral gri ste don yod grub pa'i'o //
translated: The sword is the treasure, that of Amoghasiddhi.

original: @145b de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi phyag mtshan du 'dzin pas mtshon cha 'dzin zhes de rnams la bya /
analyzed: @145b de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi phyag mtshan du 'dzin pas mtshon cha 'dzin zhes de rnams la bya /
translated: Holding the weapon is holding the insignia of those Tathagatas.

original: de la ci ltar rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag mtshan rin po che spros na brtan zhing gsal bar gyur pa dang / de'i rigs kyi lha dang lha mo'i sku phra mo'i spro bsdu byas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la ci ltar rin chen 'byung ldan gyi phyag mtshan rin po che spros na brtan zhing gsal bar gyur pa dang / de'i rigs kyi lha dang lha mo'i sku phra mo'i spro bsdu byas pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one emanates and re-absorbs the jewel, the insignia of Ratnasa·πÉbhava, it becomes firm and clear, and one emanates and re-absorbs the small figures of the deities of that family, male and female.

original: rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams rim pa bzhin du spros shing bsdus pa las gsal bar gyur pa dang / so so'i rigs kyi lha dang / lha mo'i sku phra mo sprin bzhin du spro bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa'i phyag mtshan rnams rim pa bzhin du spros shing bsdus pa las gsal bar gyur pa dang / so so'i rigs kyi lha dang / lha mo'i sku phra mo sprin bzhin du spro bar bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should emanate and reabsorb the hand implements such as the vajra, etc., in sequence, and then, when they become clear, one should emanate the subtle bodies of the deities of one's own family and the goddesses, like clouds.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sprin chen po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sprin chen po //
translated: The great cloud of the bodhisattvas

original: spro ba'i bdag nyid spro bar bya //
analyzed: spro ba'i bdag nyid spro bar bya //
translated: should be emanated by one who is of the nature of emanation.

original: zhes pa ni ci ltar rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag mtshan dang / sku phra mo spros pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dang sems ma rnams spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ci ltar rigs lnga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyag mtshan dang / sku phra mo spros pa bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' dang sems ma rnams spro bar bya'o //
translated: Just as one emanates the hand implements of the five Tathagatas and the subtle bodies, one should emanate the bodhisattvas and the female bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du khro bo dang khro mo rnams kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khro bo dang khro mo rnams kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the wrathful deities and the female wrathful deities.

original: spro ba'i bdag nyid ni yungs kar la sems sbyangs shing las su rung bar byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa nyid do //
analyzed: spro ba'i bdag nyid ni yungs kar la sems sbyangs shing las su rung bar byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa nyid do //
translated: One who is of the nature of emanation is one who has trained the mind in mustard seeds and made it serviceable.

original: byang chub tshad med sgrub 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: byang chub tshad med sgrub 'gyur zhing //
translated: One will accomplish the immeasurable enlightenment

original: yon tan gnas rnams thams cad 'grub //
analyzed: yon tan gnas rnams thams cad 'grub //
translated: and all the states of good qualities.

original: ces pa ni de ltar phra mo'i sbyor ba bsgoms pa'i yon tan te /
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar phra mo'i sbyor ba bsgoms pa'i yon tan te /
translated: This is the quality of the cultivation of the subtle yoga.

original: de la byang chub tshad med pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub tshad med pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable enlightenment is the supramundane attainment, becoming the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times.

original: yon tan gnas rnams ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub ste /
analyzed: yon tan gnas rnams ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub ste /
translated: The abodes of qualities are the mundane attainments,

original: dngos grub chen po brgyad la sogs pa dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga rnam ma bslabs shing ma btsal bar 'thob pa'i don to //
analyzed: dngos grub chen po brgyad la sogs pa dang / rig pa'i gnas lnga rnam ma bslabs shing ma btsal bar 'thob pa'i don to //
translated: meaning that one attains the eight great attainments and the five sciences without training or effort.

original: mdor na de ltar bskyed byas na //
analyzed: mdor na de ltar bskyed byas na //
translated: In brief, having thus generated

original: sangs rgyas byang chub rab tu gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub rab tu gnas //
translated: one abides in the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms shing bsgrubs na che 'di nyid la sangs rgyas ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'/
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar bsgoms shing bsgrubs na che 'di nyid la sangs rgyas ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'/
translated: If one meditates and practices in that way, in this very lifetime one becomes a buddha, glorious Vajrasattva.

original: byang chub ni de'i sku gsung thugs /
analyzed: byang chub ni de'i sku gsung thugs /
translated: Enlightenment is his body, speech, and mind.

original: rab tu gnas pa ni bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa ni bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i don to //
translated: Abiding is the meaning of one‚Äôs body, voice, and mind becoming the nature of those.

original: chos kyi gnas ni 'byung 'gyur te //
analyzed: chos kyi gnas ni 'byung 'gyur te //
translated: The abode of Dharma will arise.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du gyur pas sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sems can gyi don du sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du gyur pas sngon gyi smon lam gyi mthus sems can gyi don du sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: This means that, having become the nature of the realm of phenomena, one appears in various ways for the sake of sentient beings by the power of former aspirations.

original: lus dang ngag yid mtshon pa ni de ltar sku gsung thugs thob pas kun rdzob tu sems can gyi mos pa dang mthun par sgo gsum gyi bye brag bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid mtshon pa ni de ltar sku gsung thugs thob pas kun rdzob tu sems can gyi mos pa dang mthun par sgo gsum gyi bye brag bstan pa'o //
translated: The indication of body, speech, and mind is that, having attained the body, speech, and mind, one conventionally teaches the distinctions of the three doors in accordance with the inclinations of sentient beings.

original: de nas spro bar @146a * //
analyzed: de nas spro bar @146a * //
translated: Then, one should emanate.

original: bya ba ni rdo rje'i bye brag grangs med de //
analyzed: bya ba ni rdo rje'i bye brag grangs med de //
translated: The emanations of the vajra are innumerable.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams so sor yang nas yang du spros shing mngon sum du gyur pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dus gcig tu grangs med par spro ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams so sor yang nas yang du spros shing mngon sum du gyur pa dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad dus gcig tu grangs med par spro ba'o //
translated: This means that, having emanated the deities of the ma·πá·∏çala individually again and again, one visualizes them, and all the deities of the ma·πá·∏çala are emanated simultaneously and innumerable times.

original: til gang bzhin du mkha' bkang nas //
analyzed: til gang bzhin du mkha' bkang nas //
translated: Having filled the sky like a sesame seed pod,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa brtsam par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa brtsam par bya //
translated: one should begin vajra repetition.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar spros pas sems can gyis lcogs thong gi nam mkha'i khams su til gyi gang bu la til 'dug pa bzhin du lha dang lha mos khyab par dmigs la 'og nas 'byung ba'i bzlas pa bya zhes pa'i don to //üîΩbzlas mthar sangs rgyas ye shes kyi //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar spros pas sems can gyis lcogs thong gi nam mkha'i khams su til gyi gang bu la til 'dug pa bzhin du lha dang lha mos khyab par dmigs la 'og nas 'byung ba'i bzlas pa bya zhes pa'i don to // bzlas mthar sangs rgyas ye shes kyi //
translated: This means that one should visualize the realm of space as filled with gods and goddesses, like sesame seeds in a sesame pod, and then perform the recitation that will be explained below.

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms te //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms te //
translated: At the end of the recitation, one should meditate on the three vajras of the gnosis of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni sku gsung thugs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni sku gsung thugs so //
translated: The gnosis of the buddhas of the three times is body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang ma bskyed pa'i rang bzhin pas rdo rje mi phyed ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ma bskyed pa'i rang bzhin pas rdo rje mi phyed ces bya'o //
translated: And since that is the nature of the unborn, it is called the ‚Äúindivisible vajra.‚Äù

original: de gsum gyi gong du bskyed pa'i phra mo rnams la byin gyis brlab ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de gsum gyi gong du bskyed pa'i phra mo rnams la byin gyis brlab ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should bless the subtle [vajras] generated above those three.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of vajra recitation,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi byin gyis brlab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi byin gyis brlab //
translated: one is blessed by all the buddhas.

original: ces pa ni de ltar bsgom pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa yin la /
analyzed: ces pa ni de ltar bsgom pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa yin la /
translated: The meaning is that such meditation is vajra recitation.

original: de bsgoms pas sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa la sogs mngon sum du 'byung zhing bdag la dbang bskur nas sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bur byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bsgoms pas sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa la sogs mngon sum du 'byung zhing bdag la dbang bskur nas sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bur byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that by meditating on that, Ak·π£obhya Buddha and so forth appear in actuality, confer empowerment upon oneself, and bless one with the result of buddhahood.

original: dus gsum sangs rgyas kun 'byung ba /
analyzed: dus gsum sangs rgyas kun 'byung ba /
translated: The source of all buddhas of the three times,üîΩthe vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyang dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs bsgoms nas grub pa yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyang dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs bsgoms nas grub pa yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means that the buddhas of the three times also accomplish the state of ≈örƒ´ Vajrasattva through meditating on the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: rdo rje gsang sngags byin rlabs kyis //
analyzed: rdo rje gsang sngags byin rlabs kyis //
translated: The vajra secret mantra

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i ye shes 'thob //üîΩces pa ni rdo rje gsang sngags ni /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i ye shes 'thob // ces pa ni rdo rje gsang sngags ni /
translated: attains incomparable wisdom.üîΩThe vajra secret mantra

original: aom dad a'a:dang h'um gsum mo //
analyzed: aom dad a'a:dang h'um gsum mo //
translated: is the three syllables o·πÉ, ƒÅ·∏•, and h≈´·πÉ.

original: de gsum ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas na de gsum brjod cing so so'i kha dog gsal bar dmigs nas phyag rgya bskyed pa dang byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas na 'jig rten na dpe zla med pa'i
analyzed: de gsum ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas na de gsum brjod cing so so'i kha dog gsal bar dmigs nas phyag rgya bskyed pa dang byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa byas na 'jig rten na dpe zla med pa'i
translated: Since these three are the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times, if one recites those three and visualizes their individual colors, and then creates the mudra and performs the consecration, and so on, there is nothing in the world that can compare with it.üîΩ

original: ye shes kyi sku gsung thugs 'thob pa'i don to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku gsung thugs 'thob pa'i don to //
translated: Since these three are the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times, if one recites these three and visualizes their individual colors, and then creates the seal and blesses it, and so on, one will obtain the body, speech, and mind of pristine consciousness that is without peer in the world.

original: gsang sngags don kun bzlas pa ni //üîΩrdo rje mi phyed gsum gyis mtshan //
analyzed: gsang sngags don kun bzlas pa ni // rdo rje mi phyed gsum gyis mtshan //
translated: The meaning of all the mantras is recited.üîΩThe vajra is marked with the three inseparable ones.

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum rdzogs par //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum rdzogs par //
translated: The vajra is perfected with the three inseparable ones.

original: 'di dmigs rdo rje gsum zhes bya //
analyzed: 'di dmigs rdo rje gsum zhes bya //
translated: This is called the three vajras.üîΩNo matter what seal one meditates on, it is created from the three syllables above.

original: zhes pa ni phyag rgya gang sgom yang @146b gong gi yi ge gsum las bskyed la de yang yi ge gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs pas lha thams cad sku gsung thugs gsum dang ldan pas rdo rje gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyag rgya gang sgom yang @146b gong gi yi ge gsum las bskyed la de yang yi ge gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs pas lha thams cad sku gsung thugs gsum dang ldan pas rdo rje gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since all the deities are endowed with body, speech, and mind through the blessing of the three syllables, they are called the three vajras.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni sku gsung thugs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni sku gsung thugs //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of the buddhas

original: rdo rje ye shes bsgoms nas ni //
analyzed: rdo rje ye shes bsgoms nas ni //
translated: are meditated on as the vajra pristine consciousness.

original: zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs gzod ma nas mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rdo rje ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs gzod ma nas mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rdo rje ye shes so //
translated: This is the vajra intuition, because the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times are primordially unchanging.

original: bdag rnal 'byor pa gzugs dang / gnyis pa de'i rang bzhin du bsgoms la mchod pa spro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag rnal 'byor pa gzugs dang / gnyis pa de'i rang bzhin du bsgoms la mchod pa spro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the yogin, having meditated on himself and the buddhas as having the same nature, should imagine the offering.

original: mchod pa'i mchog ni brtag byas na //
analyzed: mchod pa'i mchog ni brtag byas na //
translated: Having imagined the supreme offering,

original: 'di ni byang chub mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: one becomes equal to enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar gnas nas gnyis su med pa'i byang chub kyi sems de mchod pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin du gyur nas til gyi gang bu la til gnas pa bzhin du nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la mchod cing dgyes par
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar gnas nas gnyis su med pa'i byang chub kyi sems de mchod pa sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin du gyur nas til gyi gang bu la til gnas pa bzhin du nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la mchod cing dgyes par
translated: The meaning is that, having remained in that state, one imagines that the nondual mind of enlightenment becomes the nature of various offerings, and that one makes offerings to the buddhas who fill all of space, like sesame seeds filling a pod of sesame.

original: bsams na de rnams dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i don to ;üîΩ/ sku gsung thugs ni mngon sum du //
analyzed: bsams na de rnams dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'i don to ; / sku gsung thugs ni mngon sum du //
translated: One should imagine that they are pleased, and that one becomes like them.

original: cho ga gsum gyis spro bar bya //
analyzed: cho ga gsum gyis spro bar bya //
translated: The body, speech, and mind are emanated by the three rites.

original: bzlas pa rdo rje 'di yis ni //
analyzed: bzlas pa rdo rje 'di yis ni //
translated: This mantra recitation is the vajra.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi thugs 'drar 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi thugs 'drar 'gyur //
translated: One becomes like the mind of the three vajras.

original: zhes pa ni gong gi dkyil 'khor 'don pa'i tshul du byang chub kyi sems las cho ga gsum gyis phyag rgya bskyed la gong du spro ba'i rim pa bstan pa bzhin du spros pa ni bzlas pa rdo rje'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong gi dkyil 'khor 'don pa'i tshul du byang chub kyi sems las cho ga gsum gyis phyag rgya bskyed la gong du spro ba'i rim pa bstan pa bzhin du spros pa ni bzlas pa rdo rje'o //
translated: This is the repetition of the vajra, which is the creation of the seal by means of the three rites from the Thought of Enlightenment, in the manner of the recitation of the mandala above, and the emission in the manner taught above.

original: de ltar spros pa'i yon tan ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsum ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar spros pa'i yon tan ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa gsum ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: The quality of the emission is that one becomes like the mind of the three vajras, the three Tathagatas Ak·π£hobhya and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi thugs kyi rang bzhin du bdag 'gyur ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thugs kyi rang bzhin du bdag 'gyur ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one becomes of the nature of their mind.

original: yang na spro bar bya ba ni //
analyzed: yang na spro bar bya ba ni //
translated: Or else, the emission

original: so so'am gsum gyi bye brag gis //üîΩsku gsung thugs ni bdag med par //
analyzed: so so'am gsum gyi bye brag gis // sku gsung thugs ni bdag med par //
translated: is by means of the individual or the three.üîΩThe wisdom being should be emitted

original: ye shes sems ni spro bar bya //
analyzed: ye shes sems ni spro bar bya //
translated: in the selflessness of body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar phyag rgya la sogs pa spro ba la ma mos pa'am ma lcogs pa yod pa na bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum dang // 'phags pa'i sku gsung thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis so so'i bye brag tu don dam pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du dmigs la de'i don la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar phyag rgya la sogs pa spro ba la ma mos pa'am ma lcogs pa yod pa na bdag gi lus ngag yid gsum dang // 'phags pa'i sku gsung thugs yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis so so'i bye brag tu don dam pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du dmigs la de'i don la gnas par bya ste /
translated: If one is not devoted to the emanation of the seal, etc., or if one is not able to do it, then one should visualize one's body, speech, and mind, and the body, speech, and mind of the noble ones, as the nature of emptiness, the ultimate reality, in their individual particulars, by means of the pure gnosis. One should abide in that meaning.

original: ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du dus gsum gyi sems can yang dmigs pa ni spro ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du dus gsum gyi sems can yang dmigs pa ni spro ba'o //
translated: Just as one abides, so also one should visualize the sentient beings of the three times. This is the emanation.

original: sngags kyi yi ge gnas thob nas //
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge gnas thob nas //
translated: Having attained the abode of the mantra syllables,

original: rang gi rdo rje dkyil 'khor las /üîΩzhes pa ni lha gang yang rung ba'i sa bon gyi @147a * //
analyzed: rang gi rdo rje dkyil 'khor las / zhes pa ni lha gang yang rung ba'i sa bon gyi @147a * //
translated: from one's vajra ma·πá·∏çala,

original: yi ge las bskyed cing gzugs dang bcas par gnas la /
analyzed: yi ge las bskyed cing gzugs dang bcas par gnas la /
translated: The seed syllables of any deity are generated and abide with form.

original: de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor phra mo'i tshul du spro zhing bsdu ba yang bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dkyil 'khor phra mo'i tshul du spro zhing bsdu ba yang bzlas pa yin no //
translated: That very [seed syllable] is emanated and reabsorbed in the manner of the subtle ma·πá·∏çala. This is the recitation.

original: khro bo dam tshig ye shes kyis //
analyzed: khro bo dam tshig ye shes kyis //
translated: With the gnosis of the pledge of wrath,

original: rang gi rdo rje dkyil 'khor du //
analyzed: rang gi rdo rje dkyil 'khor du //
translated: in one's vajra ma·πá·∏çala,

original: sngags kyi yi ge'i sgra sgrogs pa //
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge'i sgra sgrogs pa //
translated: The sound of the mantra syllables

original: de ni khro ba'i bzlas pa yin //
analyzed: de ni khro ba'i bzlas pa yin //
translated: is the recitation of wrath.üîΩThis means that no matter which wrathful one is meditated upon, one should invoke the wrathful one and generate the seal from the seed syllable, and abide in nonduality with the wrathful one.

original: zhes pa ni khro bo gang sgom yang rung ba bskul zhing sa bon las phyag rgyar bskyed cing khro bo dang gnyis su med par gnas la gong du bstan pa'i tshul du khro bo dang khro mo'i sku phra mo rang gi sngags h'um phat la sogs pa sgrogs
analyzed: zhes pa ni khro bo gang sgom yang rung ba bskul zhing sa bon las phyag rgyar bskyed cing khro bo dang gnyis su med par gnas la gong du bstan pa'i tshul du khro bo dang khro mo'i sku phra mo rang gi sngags h'um phat la sogs pa sgrogs
translated: In the manner taught above, one should emanate wrathful and wrathful female figures, uttering their respective mantras such as h≈´·πÉ pha·π≠, and perform the recitation of wrathful ones.

original: shing spros pa'i khro ba'i bzlas pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shing spros pa'i khro ba'i bzlas pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement ‚Äúthe recitation of wrath.‚Äù

original: bskyed pa rdo rje kun du spro //
analyzed: bskyed pa rdo rje kun du spro //
translated: The creation is the vajra emanation.

original: rdzogs nas rab tu bsdu bar bya /
analyzed: rdzogs nas rab tu bsdu bar bya /
translated: The perfection is the complete gathering.

original: zhes pa ni lha gang sgom yang rung gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bskyed pa'i sku rnams phyogs thams cad du spros nas sems can gyi don gdul bya dbang du rdzogs par bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha gang sgom yang rung gnyis su med pa'i tshul du bskyed pa'i sku rnams phyogs thams cad du spros nas sems can gyi don gdul bya dbang du rdzogs par bya ba nas /
translated: This means that no matter which deity is meditated upon, one should emanate the forms of the creation in the manner of nonduality, and having emanated in all directions, one should perfect the subjugation of sentient beings to be tamed,

original: bsdu bar bya ba'i bar ma rdzogs pas ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsdu bar bya ba'i bar ma rdzogs pas ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: up to the complete gathering. This is the meaning of the statement ‚Äúnot by the incomplete.‚Äù

original: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //

original: bzlas par gsungs pa don dam pa //
analyzed: bzlas par gsungs pa don dam pa //
translated: The recitation is said to be ultimate.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar sgom zhing spro bsdu byed pa ni yo ga la sogs pa'i nang nas sngags kyi yi ge'i sgra bzlas pa na yang dag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar sgom zhing spro bsdu byed pa ni yo ga la sogs pa'i nang nas sngags kyi yi ge'i sgra bzlas pa na yang dag pa ma yin la /

analyzed: yang dag pa'i bzlas pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid yin no zhes dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement by the buddhas of the three times is that this is the way of the correct recitation.

original: chos ngag phyag rgya glur blangs pa //
analyzed: chos ngag phyag rgya glur blangs pa //
translated: The Dharma, speech, seal, and song

original: rdo rje tshig tu sbyar ba ni //
analyzed: rdo rje tshig tu sbyar ba ni //
translated: are applied as vajra words.

original: yang na mos pa'i dbang gis chos //
analyzed: yang na mos pa'i dbang gis chos //
translated: Or, by the power of interest, the Dharma

original: ngag gi phyag rgya rdo rje ni //
analyzed: ngag gi phyag rgya rdo rje ni //

original: h'um la sogs pa bzlas par 'dod na yang rdo rje tshig tu bya'o //
analyzed: h'um la sogs pa bzlas par 'dod na yang rdo rje tshig tu bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to recite h≈´·πÉ and so forth, one should do it as vajra words.üîΩThat is the clear secret word.

original: de ni gsal bar gsang ba'i tshig / rdo rje tshig ni skad gdangs med ;
analyzed: de ni gsal bar gsang ba'i tshig / rdo rje tshig ni skad gdangs med ;

translated: Moreover, one should meditate on the individual colors and shapes of the letters of the collection of mantras such as h≈´·πÉ vajra dhrƒ´·∏•, and so on, with the mind.

original: bzlas pa spros pa bsdus nas ni //
analyzed: bzlas pa spros pa bsdus nas ni //
translated: Having withdrawn the elaborate repetition,

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bsgrub par bya //

analyzed: de mngon du gyur pa dang / rdo rje sems dpa' gtsor bsten te gang la mos pa'i lha bsgrub par bya zhes pa'i don to //

original: gal te rgyal po ma grub na //
analyzed: gal te rgyal po ma grub na //

translated: If, having practiced in that way, one does not attain the result because of not purifying the habitual tendencies, one should practice for another seven days, without laziness, in the manner of urging oneself not to give up, with disgust.

analyzed: khro bo'i cha lugs dang ldan pa de sangs rgyas kyi bdag po dngos grub thams cad kyi 'byung gnas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' 'og min gyi gnas nas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du gnas pa der khro bo de gtang bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the wrathful one should be sent to that glorious Vajrasattva, the lord of the buddhas, the source of all powers, who abides in the Akani·π£·π≠ha realm in the nature of the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, endowed with the attire of wrath.

original: khros pas snying kar brdeg bya zhing //
analyzed: khros pas snying kar brdeg bya zhing //
translated: One should strike the heart with wrath,

original: khro bo'i tshig gis bskul bar bya //üîΩzhes pa ni /

analyzed: che ge zhes bya rdo rje che //

analyzed: khyod ni bskul bar gnas pa ste /

analyzed: zhes pa ni khro bos rnal 'byor pa'i ming phyung nas 'dis khyod tshul bzhin du sgrub par gnas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the wrathful one should utter the name of the yogin and say, You abide in the state of proper practice.

original: de ltar rtag tu khyed la gus //
analyzed: de ltar rtag tu khyed la gus //
translated: Thus, always respectful to you,

original: 'di ni dam tshig bsrung ba'i mchog / ces pa ni de @148a * //
analyzed: 'di ni dam tshig bsrung ba'i mchog / ces pa ni de @148a * //

original: ltar tshul bzhin du sgrub pa yang yin la theg pa 'og ma la mos pa yang ma yin zhing chos kyi tshul 'di nyid la mos shing yid ches pa yin te /

original: sku gsung thugs la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams kyang mi srung ba ma yin la tshul bzhin srung bas bsrung ba'i mchog go /

original: dbang bskur rjes su gnang ba ste ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan yang dbang bskur ba dang gnang ba med pas dngos grub mi stsol zhe na yang de lta bu ma yin te /

original: tshul bzhin du rdo rje slob dpon gyis dbang bskur ba dang / gnang ba byin pa yin pas de la dngos grub stsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //

original: 'di ni rdo rje'i tshul mchog ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje'i tshul mchog ste /

translated: As soon as he is thus invoked by the words, glorious Vajrasattva, in a state of fear and trembling, comes into the presence of the practitioner, or so it is imagined.

analyzed: rgyal ba byang chub rgya mtsho yi //üîΩrdo rje sems dpar de 'gyur ro //

original: zhes pa ni de nyid yang bstan te /

analyzed: zhes par 'brel to //

analyzed: de la gang la ba lta zhing bskul zhe na rdo rje sems dpa' la'o //
