translated: Among those two, the supreme one is the glorious Vajrasattva who abides in the nature of the dharmakaya.

original: yang na yum dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba las byung ba'i byang chub sems las 'gro ba'i don sgrub pa'i bde ba nyams su blang bar bzhed pa la'o //
analyzed: yang na yum dang gnyis su med par sbyor ba las byung ba'i byang chub sems las 'gro ba'i don sgrub pa'i bde ba nyams su blang bar bzhed pa la'o //
translated: Alternatively, it is the bliss of practicing for the benefit of migrating beings that arises from the bodhicitta that arises from the union with the mother.

original: de yang ji lta bu'i tshul du bskul zhe na //
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu'i tshul du bskul zhe na //
translated: Moreover, in what way is he urged?

original: snyan zhing mdzes pa'i tshig dag dang // phra mo yi ni dbyangs la sogs //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: snyan zhing mdzes pa'i tshig dag dang // phra mo yi ni dbyangs la sogs // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and with the sound of the cuckoo, etc.

original: de la snyan zhing mdzes pa'i tshig ni tshig dang don mthun pa /
analyzed: de la snyan zhing mdzes pa'i tshig ni tshig dang don mthun pa /
translated: Here, sweet and beautiful words are those that accord with the words and meanings.

original: rdo rje sems khyod sa bdag ste //
analyzed: rdo rje sems khyod sa bdag ste //
translated: O Vajrasattva, you are the lord of the earth,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: phra mo'i dbyangs ni ka k'a li la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phra mo'i dbyangs ni ka k'a li la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sound of the cuckoo, etc.

original: de ltar ci'i phyir bskul zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci'i phyir bskul zhe na /
translated: Why is it thus urged?

original: 'dod pa bde bzhi don gyis zhes bya ste rdo rje dang padmar yang dag par ldan pa'i 'dod chags kyi bde ba chen po'i sgo nas zhi ba'i don mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du gnas par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa bde bzhi don gyis zhes bya ste rdo rje dang padmar yang dag par ldan pa'i 'dod chags kyi bde ba chen po'i sgo nas zhi ba'i don mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin du gnas par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of the bliss of desire, that is, in order to abide in the nature of nirvana, the peaceful state, through the great bliss of passion arising from the union of vajra and lotus.

original: bskul ba'i ngag tu rnam par bsam //
analyzed: bskul ba'i ngag tu rnam par bsam //
translated: One should imagine the speech of urging.

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pas gong du bstan pa'i tshul du dkyil 'khor bskyed cing bsgom pa des phyi rol gyi gzhi la sogs par bya ba byed pa'i dus su dkyil 'khor bsdus nas 'gro ba yin pas lha mo rnams @149a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pas gong du bstan pa'i tshul du dkyil 'khor bskyed cing bsgom pa des phyi rol gyi gzhi la sogs par bya ba byed pa'i dus su dkyil 'khor bsdus nas 'gro ba yin pas lha mo rnams @149a * //
translated: This is to say, the yogi/nƒ´, having generated and meditated on the ma·πá·∏çala in the manner explained above, when the time comes to perform the rite in the external place, etc., dissolves the ma·πá·∏çala and goes.

original: de ltar bskul bar bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: de ltar bskul bar bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to /
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the goddesses as being exhorted.

original: rdo rje sems khyod sa bdag ste //
analyzed: rdo rje sems khyod sa bdag ste //
translated: You are Vajrasattva, the lord of the earth,üîΩwho moves the elements of sentient beings.

original: sems can khams ni skyod mdzad pa ni lha mo m'a ma k'i sa zhe sdang rdo rje yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod cing bskul ba'o //
analyzed: sems can khams ni skyod mdzad pa ni lha mo m'a ma k'i sa zhe sdang rdo rje yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod cing bskul ba'o //
translated: This is to praise and exhort Mamaki, the goddess of anger, in terms of her qualities.

original: ji ltar bstod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar bstod ce na /
translated: How does one praise her?

original: rdo rje sems dpa' khyod sa bdag rgyal po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' khyod sa bdag rgyal po dang 'dra ste /
translated: You, Vajrasattva, are like a king, the lord of the earth.

original: ji ltar rgyal pos 'bangs rnams skyong zhing mtho bar byed pa de bzhin du khyod kyang srid pa gsum gyi sems can rnams 'khor ba la bskyod cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su phyin par mdzad pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal pos 'bangs rnams skyong zhing mtho bar byed pa de bzhin du khyod kyang srid pa gsum gyi sems can rnams 'khor ba la bskyod cing mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su phyin par mdzad pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as a king protects and exalts his subjects, so you, O Blessed One, are the one who causes the beings of the three worlds to go to nirvana, the realm of nirvana.

original: sems can kun gnyen chen po mchog ni sems can rnams la de lta bu'i phan 'dogs pas gnyen gyi mchog go //
analyzed: sems can kun gnyen chen po mchog ni sems can rnams la de lta bu'i phan 'dogs pas gnyen gyi mchog go //
translated: The supreme friend of all beings, because you help beings in that way, you are the supreme friend.

original: gal te mgon pos bdag srog bzhed pa na //
analyzed: gal te mgon pos bdag srog bzhed pa na //
translated: If the Lord wishes to preserve my life,

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa khyod bdag gi srog ni lha mo m'a ma k'i'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa khyod bdag gi srog ni lha mo m'a ma k'i'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: my life, which is of the nature of the goddess Mamaki, the realm of reality,

original: bzhad pa ni sbrul sku spangs nas de dang gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bzhad pa ni sbrul sku spangs nas de dang gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du gnas pa'o //
translated: having abandoned the emanation body, remains in the nature of the reality body, which is nondual with it.

original: kun rdzob tu sems can 'dul ba'i don du thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul mi bstan du mi rung bas srog dang 'dra ba dang / gsang sngags kyi sgo nas spyod pa'i rnal 'byor bas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba las 'dir mi rung bas srog go //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sems can 'dul ba'i don du thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul mi bstan du mi rung bas srog dang 'dra ba dang / gsang sngags kyi sgo nas spyod pa'i rnal 'byor bas gnyis su med pa'i sbyor ba las 'dir mi rung bas srog go //
translated: It is like life because it is not suitable to not teach the method and wisdom modes for the sake of taming sentient beings conventionally. It is life because it is not suitable to not engage in the yoga of conduct through the door of secret mantra in the union of nonduality.

original: de mi spong zhing dang du len par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: de mi spong zhing dang du len par bzhed pa'o //
translated: It is asserted that one should not abandon it but rather accept it.

original: 'dod pa'i dga' ba yid 'ong don chen nges //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba yid 'ong don chen nges //
translated: The delightful joy of desire is certainly a great purpose.

original: mgon pos bdag la 'dod pa spyad du gsol //
analyzed: mgon pos bdag la 'dod pa spyad du gsol //
translated: Lord, please enjoy the desire of me, the yoginƒ´.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i don gyis 'dod pa'i dga' ba thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don chen por 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi don chen por 'gyur ba'i spyod pa des bdag la spyod cig ces bskul ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i don gyis 'dod pa'i dga' ba thabs dang shes rab kyi rol pa'i sgo nas bdag gi don chen por 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi don chen por 'gyur ba'i spyod pa des bdag la spyod cig ces bskul ba'i don to //
translated: This means that with such a purpose, the delightful joy of desire through the door of the play of method and wisdom becomes the conduct that is a great purpose for oneself and a great purpose for others.

original: rdo rje sku khyod sangs rgyas 'khor lo'i don //
analyzed: rdo rje sku khyod sangs rgyas 'khor lo'i don //
translated: O VajrakƒÅya, you are the purpose of the wheel of buddhas.

original: sems can mang por dga' ba rtogs mdzad cing //
analyzed: sems can mang por dga' ba rtogs mdzad cing //
translated: You cause the delight of many sentient beings to be realized.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lha mo sangs rgyas kyis rang gi gtso bo la bstod cing bskul ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lha mo sangs rgyas kyis rang gi gtso bo la bstod cing bskul ba'o //
translated: With these and other verses, the goddess Buddha praises her chief and implores him.

original: de la rdo rje sku ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ngo bor gnas pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de la rdo rje sku ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ngo bor gnas pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Therein, the vajra body is the Bhagavat Vairocana, who abides as the essence of the body of the buddhas of the three times.

original: sangs rgyas 'khor lo ni sems can 'dul ba'i phyir thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas chos bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'khor lo ni sems can 'dul ba'i phyir thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas chos bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The wheel of buddhas is the teachings of the Dharma through various means in order to tame sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi @149b don bsam gyis mi khyab pa thabs kyis bstan zhing dga' bar byed pa dang de nyid rtogs par mdzad pa khyod bdag la spyad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi @149b don bsam gyis mi khyab pa thabs kyis bstan zhing dga' bar byed pa dang de nyid rtogs par mdzad pa khyod bdag la spyad du gsol zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: You, who teach and delight with those inconceivable meanings through skillful means and cause them to be realized, I pray to you.

original: yang na sangs rgyas 'khor lo'i don ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs dang sems can gyi lus ngag yid gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas 'khor lo'i don ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku gsung thugs dang sems can gyi lus ngag yid gsum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Or, the meaning of the wheel of buddhas is the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the buddhas of the three times and the body, speech, and mind of sentient beings.

original: de nyid gong ma bzhin du ston zhing rtogs par mdzad ces kyang bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid gong ma bzhin du ston zhing rtogs par mdzad ces kyang bshad do //
translated: That very [nature] is taught and realized as before.

original: byang chub dam pa'i don ni phan par ston //
analyzed: byang chub dam pa'i don ni phan par ston //
translated: The ultimate meaning of enlightenment is taught as beneficial.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i tshul nyid byang chub ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las 'phags pas dam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i tshul nyid byang chub ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas las 'phags pas dam pa'o //
translated: This is the very method of enlightenment, which is ultimate because it is superior to the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: de nyid kyi don sems can la phyi rol ba'i tshul du dga' ba spyod pa'i sgo nas thob par ma bstan zhing thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshul du rtogs shing thob par ston zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don sems can la phyi rol ba'i tshul du dga' ba spyod pa'i sgo nas thob par ma bstan zhing thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i tshul du rtogs shing thob par ston zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The ultimate meaning of that is not taught as being attained by means of the practice of delight in the manner of an external object for sentient beings, but as being realized and attained by means of the method of the nonduality of method and wisdom.

original: gzhan yang ji lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa la bskul zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan pa la bskul zhe na /
translated: Moreover, in what way is one urged who possesses such qualities?

original: dam tshig la ni 'dod pas 'dod chags pa //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: dam tshig la ni 'dod pas 'dod chags pa // zhes smos te /
translated: He is one who is desirous of the pledge, who is passionate,

original: de la dam tshig ni sku rnam pa sna tshogs bstan zhing sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de la dam tshig ni sku rnam pa sna tshogs bstan zhing sems can gyi don mdzad pa'o //
translated: The pledge is the display of various bodies and the performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa ni thugs kyi dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni thugs kyi dgongs pa'o //
translated: Desire is the intention of the mind.

original: 'dod chags pa ni nyid dang ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags pa ni nyid dang ma bral ba'o //
translated: Passion is the nonseparation from that.

original: yang na dam tshig ni sangs rgyas spyan nyid kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: yang na dam tshig ni sangs rgyas spyan nyid kyi rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Or else, the pledge is the realm of reality, the nature of Buddhalocana herself.

original: de dang gnyis su med par chos kyi sku'i tshul du gnas pas na 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: de dang gnyis su med par chos kyi sku'i tshul du gnas pas na 'dod chags pa'o //
translated: Since she abides in the manner of the reality body, nondual with that, she is passionate.

original: gsal te mgo po bdag sgro bzhed pa na //
analyzed: gsal te mgo po bdag sgro bzhed pa na //
translated: She is clear, and wishes to adorn herself.

original: khyod kyis 'dod pa bdag la spyad du gsol //
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dod pa bdag la spyad du gsol //
translated: Please enjoy your desired object in me!

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i yon dang ldan pa khyod bdag la thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul du rol cig pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i yon dang ldan pa khyod bdag la thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul du rol cig pa'i don to //
translated: This means that you should sport with me in the manner of means and wisdom, endowed with such qualities.

original: phyi ma'i tshig gong ma dang 'dra'o //üîΩrdo rje gsung khyod thams cad kun la ni //
analyzed: phyi ma'i tshig gong ma dang 'dra'o // rdo rje gsung khyod thams cad kun la ni //
translated: The latter part of the verse is the same as above.üîΩYou, Vajra Speech, for the sake of the world,

original: phan dang thugs brtser ldan pa 'jig rten don //
analyzed: phan dang thugs brtser ldan pa 'jig rten don //
translated: are endowed with benefit and compassion for all.

original: zhes pa ni lha mo pandar ba sis bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas la bstod cing bskul ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha mo pandar ba sis bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas la bstod cing bskul ba'o //
translated: This is a praise and exhortation to the Bhagavat Amitabha by the goddess Pandaravasini.

original: de la rdo rje gsung ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas gsung gi rang bzhin du gnas shing chos ston pa bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: de la rdo rje gsung ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas gsung gi rang bzhin du gnas shing chos ston pa bcom ldan 'das tshe dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: Vajra Speech is the speech of the Buddhas of the three times, which abides in the nature of speech and teaches the Dharma. It is the Bhagavat Amitabha.
